Open-Transactions  master/1066fb4910a63ee3f7de8e0807fee3eb663b66c7

  • File List

src/otapi/ot_commands_ot.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // NEW RETURN CODE CONVENTION!
00002 
00003 // OT API already returns: -1 for error, 0 for "didn't need to do anything" and 1 for success (or larger.)
00004 // All of the below functions follow that convention (they just return the same values.)
00005 //
00006 // But for the OT command line tool, we need to return 0 for success, and non-zero codes for errors.
00007 // This is because it's a UNIX convention and will be expected by anyone writing bash scripts.
00008 //
00009 // However, I don't want to physically change all the below functions, so I'm going to change the
00010 // opentxs script itself, so that it translates the return value. That way I only have to change it
00011 // in one spot, and we have access to use these scripts both ways.
00012 //
00013 // THE POINT? If you notice these scripts returning 1, which is then interpreted as 0 by bash scripts,
00014 // it's because the script that CALLS these scripts, is doing that translation (for the above described
00015 // reasons.)
00016 //
00017 
00018 
00019 #include <stdafx.hpp>
00020 
00021 #include "ot_commands_ot.hpp"
00022 
00023 #include "ot_utility_ot.hpp"
00024 #include "ot_otapi_ot.hpp"
00025 #include "ot_made_easy_ot.hpp"
00026 
00027 #include <OTAPI.hpp>
00028 #include <OT_ME.hpp>

00031 extern string Args;
00032 
00033 extern string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(string, string);

00040 
00041     return -1;
00042 }

00061 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_basket()
00062 {
00063     string strUsage = "Usage:    opentxs showbasket\nOPTIONAL:   --args \"index BASKET_INDEX\"\n\nNOTE: If you leave off the index, then it lists all the basket currencies.\nBut if an index is provided, this command will zoom in and show the details\nfor that specific basket currency.\n\n";
00064     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
00065 
00066     return OT_Command::details_show_basket();
00067 }
00068 
00069 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_show_basket()
00070 {
00071     bool bOnFirstIteration = true;
00072     int32_t nAssetCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetTypeCount();
00073 
00074     if (VerifyIntVal(nAssetCount) && (nAssetCount > 0))
00075     {
00076         string strIndex = "";
00077 
00078         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
00079         {
00080             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
00081             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
00082             //
00083             string strTempIndex = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "index");
00084 
00085             if (VerifyStringVal(strTempIndex))
00086             {
00087                 strIndex = strTempIndex;
00088             }
00089         } // args
00090 
00091         // Zoom in on a specific basket currency.
00092         //
00093         if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
00094         {
00095             int32_t nIndex = to_int(strIndex);
00096 
00097             if (!VerifyIntVal(nIndex))
00098             {
00099                 return -1;
00100             }
00101             else if ((nIndex < 0) || (nIndex >= nAssetCount))
00102             {
00103                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: index out of bounds.\n");
00104                 return -1;
00105             }
00106             else
00107             {
00108                 string strAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_ID(nIndex);
00109                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetID))
00110                 {
00111                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "ERROR: Failed getting asset type ID at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + "\n");
00112                 }
00113                 else
00114                 {
00115                     string strAssetName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Name(strAssetID);
00116                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetName))
00117                     {
00118                         strAssetName = "";
00119                     }
00120 
00121                     if (!OTAPI_Wrap::IsBasketCurrency(strAssetID))
00122                     {
00123                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: not a basket currency: " + strAssetID + " : " + strAssetName + "\n");
00124                     }
00125                     else
00126                     {
00127                         // DISPLAY ALL THE DETAILS ABOUT THIS BASKET CURRENCY:
00128                         //
00129                         print("Name: " + strAssetName);
00130                         print("ID:   " + strAssetID);
00131 
00132                         int32_t nMemberCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMemberCount(strAssetID);
00133 
00134                         if (!VerifyIntVal(nMemberCount))
00135                         {
00136                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "ERROR: expected int32_t return value from OT_API_Basket_GetMemberCount(strAssetID)\n");
00137                         }
00138                         else if (nMemberCount <= 0)
00139                         {
00140                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange: this basket has " + to_string(nMemberCount) + " sub-currencies. (Expected 1 or more.)\n");
00141                         }
00142                         else
00143                         {
00144                             int64_t nBasketMinTransAmt = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMinimumTransferAmount(strAssetID);
00145 
00146                             if (!VerifyIntVal(nBasketMinTransAmt))
00147                             {
00148                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange: expected minimum transfer amount for basket, but got bad value instead.\n");
00149                             }
00150                             else
00151                             {
00152                                 print("Minimum transfer amount for basket:     " + to_string(nBasketMinTransAmt));
00153                                 print("Number of sub-currencies in the basket: " + to_string(nMemberCount));
00154 
00155                                 bool bFirstMember = true;
00156 
00157                                 for (int32_t nMemberIndex = 0; nMemberIndex < nMemberCount; ++nMemberIndex)
00158                                 {
00159                                     string strMemberType = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMemberType(strAssetID, nMemberIndex);
00160                                     string strMemberName = VerifyStringVal(strMemberType) ? OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Name(strMemberType) : "";
00161 
00162                                     int64_t nMinTransAmt = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMemberMinimumTransferAmount(strAssetID, nMemberIndex);
00163 
00164                                     if (bFirstMember)
00165                                     {
00166                                         bFirstMember = false;
00167 
00168                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "    Index  :  Min Transfer Amount  :  Member currency  \n---------------------------------------\n");
00169                                     }
00170                                     print("    " + to_string(nMemberIndex) + "      : " + (VerifyIntVal(nMinTransAmt) ? to_string(nMinTransAmt) : "ERROR_AMT") + " : " + strMemberType + " : " + (VerifyStringVal(strMemberName) ? strMemberName : "ERROR_NAME"));
00171                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "---------------------------------------\n");
00172                                 }
00173                             }
00174                         }
00175                     }
00176                 }
00177             }
00178             return 1;
00179         }
00180 
00181         // List ALL the basket currencies.
00182         //
00183         for (int32_t nAssetIndex = 0; nAssetIndex < nAssetCount; ++nAssetIndex)
00184         {
00185             string strAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_ID(nAssetIndex);
00186             if (VerifyStringVal(strAssetID) && OTAPI_Wrap::IsBasketCurrency(strAssetID))
00187             {
00188                 if (bOnFirstIteration)
00189                 {
00190                     bOnFirstIteration = false;
00191                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Index |  Basket currencies:\n------------------------------------\n");
00192                 }
00193 
00194                 string strAssetName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Name(strAssetID);
00195 
00196                 if (VerifyStringVal(strAssetName))
00197                 {
00198                     print(to_string(nAssetIndex) + ": " + strAssetID + " : " + strAssetName);
00199                 }
00200                 else
00201                 {
00202                     print(to_string(nAssetIndex) + ": " + strAssetID);
00203                 }
00204             }
00205         } // for
00206         if (nAssetCount > 0) { OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); }
00207     }
00208 
00209     return -1;
00210 }

00213 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_new_basket()
00214 {
00215     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
00216     {
00217         return OT_Command::details_new_basket(Server, MyNym);
00218     }
00219 
00220     return -1;
00221 }
00222 
00223 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_new_basket(const string & strServer, const string & strNym)
00224 {
00225     int32_t nBasketCount = 2;
00226     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "How many different asset types will compose this new basket currency? [2]: ");
00227 
00228     string strBasketCount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00229 
00230     if (VerifyStringVal(strBasketCount))
00231     {
00232         nBasketCount = to_int(strBasketCount);
00233 
00234         if (nBasketCount < 2)
00235         {
00236             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, but a basket currency must be composed of at least 2 sub-currencies.\n");
00237             return -1;
00238         }
00239     }
00240 
00241     int64_t lMinimumTransAmount = int64_t(100);
00242 
00243     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nIf your basket has a minimum transfer amount of 100, you might have 2 or 3 sub-currencies,\nwith the first being a minimum of 2 gold, the second being a minimum of 50 dollars, and the\nthird being a minimum of 30 silver.\nIn this example, 100 units of the basket currency is transferrable in or out of the\nbasket currency, in return for 2 gold, 50 dollars, and 30 silver.\n\n");
00244     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "What is the minimum transfer amount for the basket currency itself? [100]: ");
00245 
00246     string strMinAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00247 
00248     if (VerifyStringVal(strMinAmount))
00249     {
00250         lMinimumTransAmount = to_long(strMinAmount);
00251 
00252         if (lMinimumTransAmount < 1)
00253         {
00254             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, but this needs to be a non-zero value. Minimum is 1.\n");
00255             return -1;
00256         }
00257     }
00258 
00259     string strBasket = OTAPI_Wrap::GenerateBasketCreation(strNym, lMinimumTransAmount);
00260 
00261     if (!VerifyStringVal(strBasket))
00262     {
00263         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while generating initial basket object.\n");
00264         return -1;
00265     }
00266 
00267     for (int32_t ibasket = 0; ibasket < nBasketCount; ++ibasket)
00268     {
00269         OT_Command::main_stat_assets();
00270 
00271         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nThis basket currency has " + to_string(nBasketCount) + " subcurrencies.\n");
00272         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "So far you have defined " + to_string(ibasket) + " of them.\n");
00273         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please PASTE the asset type ID for a subcurrency of this basket: ");
00274 
00275         string strSubcurrencyID = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00276 
00277         if (!VerifyStringVal(strSubcurrencyID))
00278         {
00279             return -1;
00280         }
00281 
00282         string strSubcurrencyContract = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Contract(strSubcurrencyID);
00283 
00284         if (!VerifyStringVal(strSubcurrencyContract))
00285         {
00286             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, but " + strSubcurrencyID + " is apparently not a currency contract in your wallet.\n");
00287             ibasket -= 1;
00288             continue;
00289         }
00290 
00291         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter minimum transfer amount for that asset type [100]: ");
00292 
00293         lMinimumTransAmount = 100;
00294         strMinAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00295 
00296         if (VerifyStringVal(strMinAmount))
00297         {
00298             lMinimumTransAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strSubcurrencyID, strMinAmount);
00299 
00300             if (lMinimumTransAmount < 1)
00301             {
00302                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, but this needs to be a non-zero value. Minimum is 1.\n");
00303                 ibasket -= 1;
00304                 continue;
00305             }
00306         }
00307 
00308         string strTempBasket = OTAPI_Wrap::AddBasketCreationItem(strNym, strBasket, strSubcurrencyID, lMinimumTransAmount);
00309 
00310         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempBasket))
00311         {
00312             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: OT_API_AddBasketCreationItem returned NULL. (Failure.)\n");
00313             return -1;
00314         }
00315         else
00316         {
00317             strBasket = strTempBasket;
00318         }
00319     }
00320 
00321 
00322     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Here's the basket we're issuing:\n\n" + strBasket + "\n");
00323 
00324 
00325     string strResponse = MadeEasy::issue_basket_currency(strServer, strNym, strBasket);
00326     int32_t nStatus = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
00327 
00328     // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
00329     // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
00330     // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
00331     //
00332     // -1 is error,
00333     //  0 is reply received: failure
00334     //  1 is reply received: success
00335     //
00336     switch (nStatus)
00337     {
00338     case 1:
00339     {
00340               OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS in issue_basket_currency! Server response:\n\n");
00341               print(strResponse); // stdout
00342 
00343               string strNewID = OTAPI_Wrap::Message_GetNewAssetTypeID(strResponse);
00344               bool bGotNewID = VerifyStringVal(strNewID);
00345               bool bRetrieved = false;
00346               string strEnding = ".";
00347 
00348               if (bGotNewID)
00349               {
00350                   string strRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_contract(strServer, strNym, strNewID);
00351                   strEnding = ": " + strNewID;
00352 
00353                   if (1 == VerifyMessageSuccess(strRetrieved))
00354                   {
00355                       bRetrieved = true;
00356                   }
00357               }
00358               OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response: SUCCESS in issue_basket_currency!\n");
00359               OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving new basket contract" + strEnding + "\n");
00360               break;
00361     }
00362     case 0:
00363         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILURE in issue_basket_currency! Server response:\n\n");
00364         print(strResponse); // stdout
00365         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, " FAILURE in issue_basket_currency!\n");
00366         break;
00367     default:
00368         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nError in issue_basket_currency! nStatus is: " + to_string(nStatus) + "\n");
00369 
00370         if (VerifyStringVal(strResponse))
00371         {
00372             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response:\n\n");
00373             print(strResponse); // stdout
00374             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nError in issue_basket_currency! nStatus is: " + to_string(nStatus) + "\n");
00375         }
00376         break;
00377     }
00378     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); //stderr
00379 
00380     return (0 == nStatus) ? -1 : nStatus;
00381 }
00382 
00383 
00384 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_exchange_basket(const string & strServer, const string & strNym, const string & strAcct, const string & strBasketType)
00385 {
00386     // NOTE: details_exchange_basket ASSUMES that strAcct has a server of strServer and
00387     // a NymID of strNym and an asset type of strBasketType. (These are already verified
00388     // in OT_Command::main_exchange_basket.)
00389     //
00390     int32_t nMemberCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMemberCount(strBasketType);
00391 
00392     if (!VerifyIntVal(nMemberCount) || (nMemberCount < 2))
00393     {
00394         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange, the chosen basket asset type apparently has no sub-currencies. (Failure.)\n");
00395         return -1;
00396     }
00397 
00398     int64_t lMinimumTransAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMinimumTransferAmount(strBasketType);
00399 
00400     if (!VerifyIntVal(lMinimumTransAmount))
00401     {
00402         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange, the chosen basket asset type apparently has no minimum transfer amount. (Failure.)\n");
00403         return -1;
00404     }
00405 
00406     bool bExchangingIn = true;
00407 
00408     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Are you exchanging IN or OUT of the basket? [IN]: ");
00409     string strInOrOut = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00410 
00411     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInOrOut))
00412     {
00413         strInOrOut = "in";
00414     }
00415 
00416     int64_t lBalance = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_Balance(strAcct);
00417 
00418     if (!VerifyIntVal(lBalance))
00419     {
00420         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange: unable to retrieve balance for basket account: " + strAcct + "\n");
00421         return -1;
00422     }
00423 
00424     if ((strInOrOut == "out") || (strInOrOut == "OUT"))
00425     {
00426         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Exchanging OUT of the basket currency...\n\n");
00427         bExchangingIn = false;
00428 
00429         if (lBalance < lMinimumTransAmount)
00430         {
00431             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, but the minimum transfer amount for this basket currency is " + to_string(lMinimumTransAmount) + "\nand the chosen account's balance is only " + to_string(lBalance) + ". (Failure.)\n");
00432             return -1;
00433         }
00434     }
00435     else
00436     {
00437         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Exchanging IN to the basket currency...\n\n");
00438     }
00439 
00440     int32_t nTransferMultiple = 1;
00441 
00442     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "This basket currency has a minimum transfer amount of " + to_string(lMinimumTransAmount) + ".\n");
00443     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Now you must choose the Transfer Multiple for the exchange. For example:\n");
00444 
00445     for (int32_t i = 1; i < 5; ++i)
00446     {
00447         int64_t lUnits = i * lMinimumTransAmount;
00448 
00449         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "A transfer multiple of " + to_string(i) + " will exchange " + to_string(lUnits) + " units of the basket currency.\n");
00450     }
00451     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Etc.\n");
00452 
00453     if (!bExchangingIn) { OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Keep in mind, the balance in the basket account is: " + to_string(lBalance) + "\n\n"); }
00454 
00455     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please choose a transfer multiple [1]: ");
00456     string strTransferMultiple = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00457 
00458     if (VerifyStringVal(strTransferMultiple))
00459     {
00460         int32_t nTempMultiple = to_int(strTransferMultiple);
00461 
00462         if (VerifyIntVal(nTempMultiple) && (nTempMultiple > 1)) { nTransferMultiple = nTempMultiple; }
00463     }
00464 
00465     int64_t lAttemptedTransfer = (nTransferMultiple * lMinimumTransAmount);
00466 
00467     if (!bExchangingIn && (lAttemptedTransfer > lBalance))
00468     {
00469         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "A transfer multiple of " + to_string(nTransferMultiple) + " will exchange " + to_string(lAttemptedTransfer) + " units out of the basket currency.\nUnfortunately, you only have a " + to_string(lBalance) + " balance in your basket account. (Failed.)\n");
00470         return -1;
00471     }
00472 
00473     if (!MadeEasy::insure_enough_nums(20, strServer, strNym))
00474     {
00475         return -1;
00476     }
00477 
00478     string strBasket = OTAPI_Wrap::GenerateBasketExchange(strServer, strNym, strBasketType, strAcct, nTransferMultiple);
00479 
00480     if (!VerifyStringVal(strBasket))
00481     {
00482         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed generating basket exchange request.\n");
00483         return -1;
00484     }
00485 
00486     // Below this point, after any failure, call this before returning:
00487     //
00488     // OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false)
00489     //
00490     // NOTE: Only do this up until the message is sent. Once it's sent, the harvesting is already
00491     // handled internally. (Only need to harvest in the event that some failure occurs in the middle of
00492     // constructing the basket exchange request, for any time BEFORE actually trying to send it.)
00493 
00494 
00495     // SUB-CURRENCIES!
00496 
00497     for (int32_t nMember = 0; nMember < nMemberCount; ++nMember)
00498     {
00499         string strMemberType = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMemberType(strBasketType, nMember);
00500 
00501         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemberType))
00502         {
00503             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error retrieving member type from index " + to_string(nMember) + " of basket currency: " + strBasketType + "\n");
00504             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00505             return -1;
00506         }
00507 
00508         string strMemberTypeName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Name(strMemberType);
00509 
00510         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemberTypeName))
00511         {
00512             strMemberTypeName = "";
00513         }
00514 
00515         int64_t lMemberAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::Basket_GetMemberMinimumTransferAmount(strBasketType, nMember);
00516 
00517         if (!VerifyIntVal(lMemberAmount))
00518         {
00519             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error retrieving minimum transfer amount from index " + to_string(nMember) + " (" + strMemberType + ") on basket currency: " + strBasketType + "\n");
00520             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00521             return -1;
00522         }
00523 
00524         lAttemptedTransfer = (nTransferMultiple * lMemberAmount);
00525 
00526         // This will only display accounts registered on strServer of asset type strMemberType.
00527         //
00528         OT_Command::stat_basket_accounts(strServer, strNym, true, strMemberType);
00529 
00530         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "There are " + to_string(nMemberCount - nMember) + " accounts remaining to be selected.\n\n");
00531         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Currently we need to select an account with the asset type:\n" + strMemberType + " (" + strMemberTypeName + ")\n");
00532         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Above are all the accounts in the wallet, for the relevant server and nym, of that asset type.\n");
00533 
00534         if (bExchangingIn) { OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nKeep in mind, with a transfer multiple of " + to_string(nTransferMultiple) + " and a minimum transfer amount of " + to_string(lMemberAmount) + "\n(for this sub-currency), you must therefore select an account with a minimum\nbalance of: " + to_string(lAttemptedTransfer) + "\n"); }
00535 
00536         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nPlease PASTE an account ID from the above list: ");
00537         string strSubAccount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00538 
00539         if (!VerifyStringVal(strSubAccount))
00540         {
00541             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00542             return -1;
00543         }
00544 
00545         string strSubAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strSubAccount);
00546 
00547         if (!VerifyStringVal(strSubAssetID))
00548         {
00549             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error retrieving asset type ID from pasted account: " + strSubAccount + "\n");
00550             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00551             return -1;
00552         }
00553 
00554         if (strMemberType != strSubAssetID)
00555         {
00556             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: The selected account has the wrong asset type: " + strSubAssetID + "\n");
00557             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00558             return -1;
00559         }
00560 
00561         lBalance = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_Balance(strSubAccount);
00562 
00563         if (!VerifyIntVal(lBalance))
00564         {
00565             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange, error while retrieving balance for sub-account: " + strSubAccount + "\n");
00566             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00567             return -1;
00568         }
00569 
00570         if (bExchangingIn && (lAttemptedTransfer > lBalance))
00571         {
00572             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nWith a minimum transfer amount of " + to_string(lMemberAmount) + " for this sub-currency, a transfer multiple of " + to_string(nTransferMultiple) + " will exchange " + to_string(lAttemptedTransfer) + " units out of the basket currency.\n\nUnfortunately, you only have a " + to_string(lBalance) + " balance in your selected account. (Failure.)\n");
00573             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00574             return -1;
00575         }
00576 
00577         string strTempBasket = OTAPI_Wrap::AddBasketExchangeItem(strServer, strNym, strBasket, strSubAssetID, strSubAccount);
00578 
00579         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempBasket))
00580         {
00581             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed while adding this sub-account to the exchange request!\n");
00582             OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strBasket, strNym, false, false, false, false, false);
00583             return -1;
00584         }
00585 
00586         strBasket = strTempBasket;
00587 
00588         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
00589     } // for
00590 
00591     // Send the exchange transaction...
00592     //
00593     string strResponse = MadeEasy::exchange_basket_currency(strServer, strNym, strBasketType, strBasket, strAcct, bExchangingIn);
00594     string strAttempt = "exchange_basket";
00595     // ***************************************************************
00596 
00597     // Interpret the server reply...
00598 
00599     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServer, strNym, strAcct, strAttempt, strResponse);
00600 
00601     if (1 == nInterpretReply)
00602     {
00603         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
00604         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
00605         //
00606         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServer, strNym, strAcct, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
00607 
00608         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS exchanging basket!\n");
00609         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
00610     }
00611 
00612     // ***************************************************************
00613     //
00614     // Return status to caller.
00615     //
00616     return nInterpretReply;
00617 }
00618 
00619 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_exchange_basket()
00620 {
00621     string strUsage = "Usage:   opentxs exchange --myacct BASKET_ACCT_ID\n\nThis command exchanges in or out of a basket currency.\nYou must already have an asset account which has a basket currency as its asset type.\nYou must also have accounts for all the subcurrencies in that basket.\n\n";
00622     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
00623 
00624     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
00625     {
00626         string strAcctType = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
00627         string strServer = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(MyAcct);
00628         string strNym = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
00629 
00630         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctType))
00631         {
00632             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while trying to retrieve asset type for account: " + MyAcct + "\n");
00633         }
00634         else if (!VerifyStringVal(strServer))
00635         {
00636             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while trying to retrieve server ID for account: " + MyAcct + "\n");
00637         }
00638         else if (!VerifyStringVal(strNym))
00639         {
00640             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while trying to retrieve Nym ID for account: " + MyAcct + "\n");
00641         }
00642 
00643         else if (VerifyExists("MyPurse", false) && (MyPurse != strAcctType))
00644         {
00645             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyAcct has a different asset type than the one specified at the command line.\nPlease re-try, and add: --mypurse " + strAcctType + "\n");
00646         }
00647         else if (VerifyExists("Server", false) && (Server != strServer))
00648         {
00649             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyAcct has a different server ID than the one specified at the command line.\nPlease re-try, and add: --server " + strServer + "\n");
00650         }
00651         else if (VerifyExists("MyNym", false) && (MyNym != strNym))
00652         {
00653             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyAcct has a different owner Nym ID than the one specified at the command line.\nPlease re-try, and add: --mynym " + strNym + "\n");
00654         }
00655 
00656         else if (!OTAPI_Wrap::IsBasketCurrency(strAcctType))
00657         {
00658             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nMyAcct is NOT a basket currency! Its asset type is: " + strAcctType + "\nHere is a list of the basket currencies in your wallet:\n");
00659 
00660             details_show_basket();
00661 
00662             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nHere is a list of the accounts whose asset type IS a basket currency:\n");
00663 
00664             stat_basket_accounts("", "", false, "");
00665 
00666             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nMyAcct is not a basket currency!\nPlease use --myacct to specify an account whose asset type IS a basket currency.\n");
00667         }
00668 
00669         else
00670         {
00671             return details_exchange_basket(strServer, strNym, MyAcct, strAcctType);
00672         }
00673     }
00674     else
00675     {
00676         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "You must provide an account ID, and that account must have a basket\ncurrency for its asset type. Use --myacct and choose from these basket accounts:\n");
00677 
00678         stat_basket_accounts("", "", false, "");
00679     }
00680 
00681     return -1;
00682 }
00683 
00684 
00685 // Used by exchange_basket for displaying certain types of accounts.
00686 //
00687 // if strBasketType doesn't exist, it will ONLY show accounts that are basket currencies.
00688 // if strBasketType exists, and bFilter is TRUE, it will ONLY show accounts of that type.
00689 // if strBasketType exists, and bFilter is FALSE, it will only show accounts that are NOT of that type.
00690 //
00691 // Also: if strServer exists, the accounts are filtered by that server.
00692 // Also: if strNym exists, the accounts are filtered by that Nym.
00693 //
00694 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::stat_basket_accounts(const string & strServer, const string & strNym, const bool bFilter, const string & strBasketType)
00695 {
00696     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
00697     print(" ** ACCOUNTS :\n");
00698 
00699     int32_t nAccountCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountCount();
00700 
00701     for (int32_t i = 0; i < nAccountCount; ++i)
00702     {
00703         string strID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ID(i);
00704         string strAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strID);
00705         string strAcctServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strID);
00706         string strAcctNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strID);
00707 
00708         if (!VerifyStringVal(strServer) || (VerifyStringVal(strServer) && (strServer == strAcctServerID)))
00709         {
00710             if (!VerifyStringVal(strNym) || (VerifyStringVal(strNym) && (strNym == strAcctNymID)))
00711             {
00712                 if ((!VerifyStringVal(strBasketType) && OTAPI_Wrap::IsBasketCurrency(strAssetID)) || // Only show basket accounts.
00713                     (VerifyStringVal(strBasketType) && bFilter && (strBasketType == strAssetID)) || // Only show accounts of type strBasketType
00714                     (VerifyStringVal(strBasketType) && !bFilter && (strBasketType != strAssetID)))   // Only show accounts NOT of type strBasketType
00715                 {
00716                     if ((i > 0) && (i != (nAccountCount))) { print("-------------------------------------"); }
00717 
00718                     string strStatAcct = MadeEasy::stat_asset_account(strID);
00719                     bool bSuccess = VerifyStringVal(strStatAcct);
00720                     if (bSuccess)
00721                     {
00722                         print(strStatAcct);
00723                     }
00724                     else
00725                     {
00726                         print("Error trying to stat an account: " + strID);
00727                     }
00728                     // stderr
00729                     print("");
00730                 }
00731             }
00732         }
00733     }
00734     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
00735 
00736     return 1;
00737 }
00738 
00739 
00740 // ALSO TODO:  Modified cancelCronItem so you can pass an instrument.
00741 // So even for non-cron items, you should still be able to cancel them.
00742 // (aka cancel the transaction numbers on it.) This is for when you change
00743 // your mind on an outgoing instrument, and you want it cancelled before the
00744 // recipient can process it.
00745 // Outgoing cheque, outgoing payment plan, outgoing smart contract, etc.
00746 //
00747 
00748 // AND WHAT ABOUT incoming cheques? I can already discard it, but that leaves
00749 // the sender with it still sitting in his outpayment box, until it expires.
00750 // I'd rather notify him. He should get a failure/rejection notice so that his
00751 // client can also harvest whatever numbers it needs to harvest.
00752 
00753 
00754 // TODO:  details_cancel_outgoing and details_discard_incoming both need to be updated
00755 // so that they involve a server message. This way the other parties can be notified of
00756 // the cancellation / discarding.
00757 //
00758 
00759 
00760 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_discard_incoming(const string & strServer, const string & strMyNym, const string & strIndices)
00761 {
00762     if (!VerifyStringVal(strIndices)) { return -1; }
00763 
00764     int32_t nSuccess = 1;
00765 
00766     string strInbox = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPaymentInbox(strServer, strMyNym); // Returns NULL, or an inbox.
00767 
00768     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInbox))
00769     {
00770         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n details_discard_incoming:  OT_API_LoadPaymentInbox Failed.\n\n");
00771         return -1;
00772     }
00773 
00774     int32_t nInboxCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetCount(strServer, strMyNym, strMyNym, strInbox);
00775 
00776     if (!VerifyIntVal(nInboxCount))
00777     {
00778         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "details_discard_incoming: Unable to retrieve size of payments inbox ledger. (Failure.)\n");
00779         return -1;
00780     }
00781 
00782     if (nInboxCount > 0)
00783     {
00784 
00785         int32_t nIndicesCount = VerifyStringVal(strIndices) ? OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Count(strIndices) : 0;
00786 
00787         // Either we loop through all the instruments and accept them all, or
00788         // we loop through all the instruments and accept the specified indices.
00789         //
00790         // (But either way, we loop through all the instruments.)
00791         //
00792         for (int32_t nInboxIndex = (nInboxCount - 1); nInboxIndex >= 0; --nInboxIndex) // Loop from back to front, so if any are removed, the indices remain accurate subsequently.
00793         {
00794             bool bContinue = false;
00795 
00796             // - If "all" was passed, we process the item.
00797             // - If indices are specified, but the current index is not on
00798             //   that list, then continue...
00799             //
00800             if (!("all" == strIndices) && ((nIndicesCount > 0) && !OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nInboxIndex))))
00801             {
00802 //              continue  // apparently not supported by the language.
00803                 bContinue = true;
00804             }
00805 
00806             // If it IS "all" OR, if there are indices and the current index was found in them.
00807             //
00808             if (!bContinue)
00809             {
00810                 // removes payment instrument (from payments in or out box)
00811                 bool bRecorded = OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(strServer, strMyNym,
00812                     true, // true == payments inbox. false == payments outbox.
00813                     nInboxIndex, false);  //bSaveCopy = false, since we're discarding it.
00814                 string strRecorded = bRecorded ? "Success" : "Failure";
00815                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n" + strRecorded + " discarding instrument from payments inbox at index: " + to_string(nInboxIndex) + ".\n\n NOTE: Now the sender has to leave it in his outbox until it expires or he cancels it on his end.\n");
00816                 if (!bRecorded) { nSuccess = -1; }
00817             } //if (!bContinue)
00818 
00819         } // for
00820 
00821     } // if (nCount > 0)
00822     else { return 0; } // 1 means we successfully did something. 0 means the payments inbox was empty.
00823 
00824     return nSuccess;
00825 }
00826 
00827 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_discard_incoming()
00828 {
00829     string strUsage = "Usage:   opentxs discard --mynym NYM_ID --server SERVER_ID --args \"index|indices INDICES_GO_HERE\"\n\nThis command discards an incoming instrument from the payments inbox.\n(Usually used for discarding an invoice, for when you don't want to pay it.)\nYou can also use 'all' for the index, for it to process ALL instruments.\n\n";
00830     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
00831 
00832     if (VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("Server"))
00833     {
00834         string strIndex = "";
00835         string strIndices = "";
00836         string strFinalIndex = "";
00837         bool bUseStdin = false;
00838 
00839         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
00840         {
00841             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
00842             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
00843             //
00844             strIndex = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "index");
00845             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
00846 
00847             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
00848             {
00849                 strFinalIndex = strIndex;
00850             }
00851             else if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices))
00852             {
00853                 strFinalIndex = strIndices;
00854             }
00855             else
00856             {
00857                 bUseStdin = true;
00858             }
00859         }
00860         else { bUseStdin = true; }
00861 
00862         if (bUseStdin)
00863         {
00864             OT_Command::main_show_payments_inbox();
00865 
00866             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nPlease enter the index (in your payments inbox)\nof the instrument you are discarding: ");
00867             strIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
00868 
00869             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
00870             {
00871                 strFinalIndex = strIndex;
00872             }
00873             else { return -1; }
00874         }
00875 
00876         return details_discard_incoming(Server, MyNym, strFinalIndex);
00877     }
00878 
00879     return -1;
00880 }
00881 
00882 /*
00883 std::string GetNym_OutpaymentsContentsByIndex(const std::string & NYM_ID, const int32_t & nIndex); // returns the message itself
00884 std::string GetNym_OutpaymentsRecipientIDByIndex(const std::string & NYM_ID, const int32_t & nIndex); // returns the NymID of the recipient.
00885 std::string GetNym_OutpaymentsServerIDByIndex(const std::string & NYM_ID, const int32_t & nIndex); // returns the ServerID where the message came from.
00886 bool Nym_RemoveOutpaymentsByIndex(const std::string & NYM_ID, const int32_t & nIndex); // (1 or 0.)
00887 bool Nym_VerifyOutpaymentsByIndex(const std::string & NYM_ID, const int32_t & nIndex); // true if signature verifies. (Sender Nym MUST be in my wallet for this to work.)
00888 
00889 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAmount(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00890 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetTransNum(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00891 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidFrom(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00892 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidTo(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00893 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetMemo(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00894 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00895 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00896 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00897 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00898 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderAcctID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00899 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00900 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientAcctID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
00901 */
00902 
00903 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_cancel_outgoing(const string & strMyNym, const string & strMyAcct, const string & strIndices)
00904 {
00905     int32_t nIndicesCount = OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Count(strIndices);
00906     int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_OutpaymentsCount(strMyNym);
00907     int32_t nSuccess = 1;
00908 
00909     //    OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nNOTE: You can't just discard a sent cheque from your outpayment box. Why not?\nJust because you remove your record of the outgoing cheque, doesn't mean you didn't already send it. (The recipient still received it, and still has it, whether you remove it from your outbox or not.) If you really want to cancel the cheque, then you need to do it in such a way that it will fail-as-cancelled when the recipient tries to deposit it. Otherwise, he would get that money whether you kept your own outgoing record or not. Therefore TODO: SOME server message must be performed here, which actually cancels the transaction number itself that appears on the cheque. This is the only way to insure that the cheque can't be used by the recipient (and even this will only work if you beat him to the punch -- otherwise if he deposits it before you cancel it, then it's already too late and he has the money.) THIS is why RecordPayment, regarding outpayments, only works on expired instruments -- because if it's not expired, you don't just want to remove your record of it. You want to cancel the transaction number itself -- and that requires server communication.\n\n");
00910 
00911 
00912     if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount))
00913     {
00914         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error retrieving outpayments count for Nym: " + strMyNym + "\n");
00915         return -1;
00916     }
00917 
00918     if (nCount == 0)
00919     {
00920         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "(Outpayment box is empty.)\n");
00921         nSuccess = 0;
00922     }
00923     else
00924     {
00925         for (int32_t nIndex = (nCount - 1); nIndex >= 0; --nIndex)
00926         {
00927 //          bool bRemoved = OTAPI_Wrap::Nym_RemoveOutpaymentsByIndex(strMyNym, nIndex); // (1 or 0.)
00928 
00929 //          string strRecorded = bRecorded ? "Success" : "Failure"
00930 //          OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0,  strRecorded + " discarding instrument from outpayment box at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + ".\n");
00931 
00932 //          if (!bRemoved)
00933 //          { nSuccess = -1; }
00934 
00935             bool bContinue = false;
00936 
00937             // - If "all" was passed, we process the item.
00938             // - If indices are specified, but the current index is not on
00939             //   that list, then continue...
00940             //
00941             if (!("all" == strIndices) && (VerifyIntVal(nIndicesCount) && (nIndicesCount > 0) && !OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nIndex))))
00942             {
00943                 //              continue  // apparently not supported by the language.
00944                 bContinue = true;
00945             }
00946 
00947             string strServer = "";
00948             // If it IS "all," OR, if there are indices and the current index was found in them.
00949             //
00950             if (!bContinue)
00951             {
00952                 strServer = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_OutpaymentsServerIDByIndex(strMyNym, nIndex);
00953                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strServer))
00954                 {
00955                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "ERROR: Failed retrieving server ID from outpayment at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + "\n");
00956                 }
00957 
00958                 else
00959                 {
00960                     string strPaymentContents = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_OutpaymentsContentsByIndex(strMyNym, nIndex);
00961 
00962                     if (VerifyStringVal(strPaymentContents))
00963                     {
00964                         //                        string strPaymentAssetID   = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID (strPaymentContents)
00965                         string strPaymentType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strPaymentContents);
00966 
00967                         // Done: Put the code here where we message the server to cancel all relevant transaction
00968                         // numbers for the instrument. If it's a cheque, there's only one number. But if it's a smart
00969                         // contract, there could be many numbers. Seems like best thing is to just activate it, but
00970                         // have a "rejected" flag which causes the activation to fail. (That way, all the other parties
00971                         // will be properly notified, which the server already does.) We don't even need to remove it
00972                         // from the outpayment box, because the failure notification from the server will already cause
00973                         // the OTClient to remove it from the outpayment box.
00974                         //
00975                         // Ah-ha! ANY outgoing payment plan or smart contract is necessarily incomplete: it's outgoing
00976                         // because it was sent to the next party so he could sign it, too, and probably activate it.
00977                         // Presumably he has not done so yet (if I am 'beating him to the punch' by cancelling it before
00978                         // he can activate it) and therefore the plan or smart contract still is missing at least one
00979                         // signer, so it is GUARANTEED to fail verification if I try to activate it myself. (Good.)
00980                         //
00981                         // This means I can just take whatever instrument appears outgoing, and try to activate it myself.
00982                         // It will definitely fail activation, and then the failure notice will already be sent from that,
00983                         // to all the parties, and they can harvest back their numbers automatically as necessary.
00984                         //
00985                         // The one problem is, though this works for payment plans and smart contracts, it will not work
00986                         // for cheques. The cheque is made out to someone else, and he is the one normally who needs to
00987                         // deposit it. Plus, I can't deposit a cheque into the same account it's drawn on.
00988                         //
00989                         // UPDATE: Now when a cheque is deposited into the same account it was drawn on, that will be
00990                         // interpreted by the server as a request to CANCEL the cheque.
00991                         //
00992 
00993 
00994                         if ("SMARTCONTRACT" == strPaymentType)
00995                         {
00996                             // Just take the smart contract from the outpayment box, and try to
00997                             // activate it. It WILL fail, and then the failure message will be
00998                             // propagated to all the other parties to the contract. (Which will
00999                             // result in its automatic removal from the outpayment box.)
01000                             //
01001                             if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyAcct))
01002                             {
01003                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "You must provide an account owned by this Nym, which will be used for the cancellation. Try adding --myacct ACCT_ID\nNOTE: in the future we should just look up one of the accounts from the smart contract itself, since the current Nym has already confirmed the contract. But for now I'm just collecting the acct ID at the command line, since it's faster.\n");
01004                             }
01005                             else
01006                             {
01007                                 string strResponse = MadeEasy::activate_smart_contract(strServer, strMyNym, strMyAcct, "acct_agent_name", strPaymentContents);
01008 
01009                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Okay I just tried to activate the smart contract. (As a way of cancelling it.)\nSo while we expect this 'activation' to fail, it should have the desired effect of cancelling the smart contract and sending failure notices to all the parties.\n");
01010 
01011                                 if (VerifyStringVal(strResponse))
01012                                 {
01013                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Here's the server reply: \n" + strResponse + "\n");
01014 
01015                                     int32_t nTransCancelled = OTAPI_Wrap::Message_IsTransactionCanceled(strServer, strMyNym, strMyAcct, strResponse);
01016 
01017                                     if (VerifyIntVal(nTransCancelled) && (1 == nTransCancelled))
01018                                     {
01019                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Success canceling!\n");
01020                                     }
01021                                     else
01022                                     {
01023                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Error canceling!\n");
01024                                         nSuccess = -1;
01025                                     }
01026                                 }
01027                                 else
01028                                 {
01029                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange, tried to cancel, but received a NULL server reply.\n");
01030                                 }
01031                             }
01032                         }
01033 
01034 
01035                         else if ("PAYMENT PLAN" == strPaymentType)
01036                         {
01037                             // Just take the payment plan from the outpayment box, and try to
01038                             // activate it. It WILL fail, and then the failure message will be
01039                             // propagated to the other party to the contract. (Which will
01040                             // result in its automatic removal from the outpayment box.)
01041 
01042                             string strResponse = MadeEasy::cancel_payment_plan(strServer, strMyNym, strPaymentContents);
01043 
01044                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Okay I just tried to activate the payment plan. (As a way of cancelling it.)\nSo while we expect this 'activation' to fail, it should have the desired effect of cancelling the payment plan and sending failure notices to all the parties.\n");
01045 
01046                             if (VerifyStringVal(strResponse))
01047                             {
01048                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Here's the server reply: \n" + strResponse + "\n");
01049 
01050                                 int32_t nTransCancelled = OTAPI_Wrap::Message_IsTransactionCanceled(strServer, strMyNym, strMyAcct, strResponse);
01051 
01052                                 if (VerifyIntVal(nTransCancelled) && (1 == nTransCancelled))
01053                                 {
01054                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Success canceling!\n");
01055                                 }
01056                                 else
01057                                 {
01058                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Error canceling!\n");
01059                                     nSuccess = -1;
01060                                 }
01061                             }
01062                             else
01063                             {
01064                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange, tried to cancel, but received a NULL server reply.\n");
01065                             }
01066                         }
01067 
01068 
01069                         else if ("PURSE" == strPaymentType)
01070                         {
01071                             // This is a tricky one -- why would anyone EVER want to discard outgoing cash?
01072                             // Normally your incentive would be to do the opposite: Keep a copy of all outgoing
01073                             // cash until the copy itself expires (when the cash expires.) This way it's always
01074                             // recoverable in the event of a "worst case" situation.
01075                             //
01076                             // So what do we do in this case? Nevertheless, the user has explicitly just instructed
01077                             // the client to DISCARD OUTGOING CASH.
01078                             //
01079                             // Perhaps we should just ask the user to CONFIRM that he wants to erase the cash,
01080                             // and make SURE that he understands the consequences of that choice.
01081 
01082 //                          OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Any outgoing cash will already be automatically moved to the record box once it expires. No need to move it by hand.\nAre you SURE you want to move it now? [y/N] ");
01083 //                          string strYes = OT_CLI_ReadLine()
01084 //
01085 //                          if (VerifyStringVal(strYes) && (("y" == strYes) || ("Y" == strYes)))
01086                             {
01087                                 // removes payment instrument (from payments in or out box)
01088                                 bool bRecorded = OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(strServer, strMyNym,
01089                                 false, // true == payments inbox. false == payments outbox.
01090                                 nIndex,
01091                                 false); // bSaveCopy = false.
01092                                 if (!bRecorded) { nSuccess = -1; }
01093                                 else { OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Discarded cash purse:\n\n" + strPaymentContents + "\n"); }
01094                                 string strRecorded = bRecorded ? "Success" : "Failure";
01095                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strRecorded + " discarding cash purse from outpayment box at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + ".\n\n");
01096                             }
01097 
01098                         }
01099 
01100 
01101                         else  // CHEQUE VOUCHER INVOICE
01102                         {
01103                             int32_t nDepositCheque = -1;
01104                             bool bIsVoucher = ("VOUCHER" == strPaymentType);
01105 
01106                             // Get the nym and account IDs from the cheque itself.
01107                             //
01108                             string strSenderAcctID = (bIsVoucher ? OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRemitterAcctID(strPaymentContents) : OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderAcctID(strPaymentContents));
01109                             string strSenderUserID = (bIsVoucher ? OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRemitterUserID(strPaymentContents) : OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(strPaymentContents));
01110 
01111                             if (!VerifyStringVal(strSenderAcctID))
01112                             {
01113                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure trying to retrieve asset account ID from instrument.\n");
01114                             }
01115                             else if (!VerifyStringVal(strSenderUserID))
01116                             {
01117                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure trying to retrieve Sender Nym ID from instrument.\n");
01118                             }
01119                             else if (!(strSenderUserID == strMyNym))
01120                             {
01121                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure, very strange: Sender Nym ID on the instrument doesn't match the Nym ID.\n");
01122                             }
01123                             else
01124                             {
01125                                 nDepositCheque = OT_Command::details_deposit_cheque(strServer, strSenderAcctID, strSenderUserID, strPaymentContents, strPaymentType);
01126 
01127                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n" + string((1 == nDepositCheque) ? "Success" : "Failure") + " canceling cheque of type: " + strPaymentType + "\n");
01128                             }
01129                         }
01130 
01131 
01132                     }
01133 
01134                 }
01135             } //if (!bContinue)
01136 
01137         } // for (backwards through outpayments box.)
01138     }
01139     return nSuccess;
01140 }
01141 
01142 
01143 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_cancel_outgoing()
01144 {
01145     string strUsage = "Usage:   opentxs cancel --mynym NYM_ID --args \"index INDEX_GOES_HERE\"\n\nThis command cancels an outgoing instrument from the outpayment box.\n(Usually used for cancelling a cheque, payment plan, or smart contract.)\nThis, of course, will fail on the server side, if the recipient has already deposited the cheque.\n\n";
01146     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
01147 
01148     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
01149     {
01150         string strIndex = "";
01151         string strIndices = "";
01152         string strFinalIndex = "";
01153         bool bUseStdin = false;
01154 
01155         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
01156         {
01157             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
01158             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
01159             //
01160             strIndex = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "index");
01161             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
01162 
01163             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
01164             {
01165                 strFinalIndex = strIndex;
01166             }
01167             else if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices))
01168             {
01169                 strFinalIndex = strIndices;
01170             }
01171             else
01172             {
01173                 bUseStdin = true;
01174             }
01175         }
01176         else { bUseStdin = true; }
01177 
01178         if (bUseStdin)
01179         {
01180             int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_OutpaymentsCount(MyNym);
01181 
01182             for (int32_t nPayments = 0; nPayments < nCount; ++nPayments)
01183             {
01184                 show_outpayment(MyNym, nPayments, false); // bShowInFull=false
01185             }
01186 
01187             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nPlease enter the index (in your outpayment box)\nof the instrument you are cancelling: ");
01188             strIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
01189 
01190             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
01191             {
01192                 strFinalIndex = strIndex;
01193             }
01194             else { return -1; }
01195         }
01196 
01197         string strMyAcct = "";
01198         if (VerifyExists("MyAcct", false)) // Used in the case of smart contracts.
01199         {
01200             strMyAcct = MyAcct;
01201         }
01202 
01203         return details_cancel_outgoing(MyNym, strMyAcct, strFinalIndex);
01204     }
01205 
01206     return -1;
01207 }
01208 
01209 
01210 /*
01211 We might also need something like: OT_Command::main_show_cron_items
01212 (Because we can't trigger a clause on a running smart contract,
01213 unless we are able to list the running smart contracts and thus
01214 ascertain the transaction number of the one whose clause we wish
01215 to trigger.)
01216 */
01217 
01218 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_trigger_clause(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyNymID, const string & strTransNum, const string & strClause, const string & strParam)
01219 {
01220     string strResponse = MadeEasy::trigger_clause(strServerID, strMyNymID, strTransNum, strClause, strParam);
01221     int32_t nMessageSuccess = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
01222 
01223     if (!VerifyIntVal(nMessageSuccess) || (1 != nMessageSuccess))
01224     {
01225         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "For whatever reason, our attempt to trigger the clause has failed.\n");
01226     }
01227     else
01228     {
01229         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success!\n");
01230     }
01231 
01232     return nMessageSuccess;
01233 }
01234 
01235 
01236 //def OT_Command::main_trigger_clause()
01237 //{; }
01238 
01239 
01240 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_trigger_clause()
01241 {
01242     string strUsage = "USAGE STRING GOES HERE";
01243     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
01244 
01245 
01246     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
01247     {
01248         // At this point we need to collect some other data:
01249         // First, we need the transaction number for the smart contract.
01250         // Second, we need the name of the clause we will be triggering.
01251         // Third we need (optionally) any string parameter that the user
01252         // may wish to pass into the clause when it gets triggered.
01253         //
01254 
01255         string strTransNum = "";
01256         string strClause = "";
01257         string strParam = "";
01258 
01259         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
01260         {
01261             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
01262             //                                  const std::string str_key)
01263             //
01264             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
01265             // EXAMPLE:  --args "index 1"
01266             //
01267             string strTempTransNum = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "id");
01268             string strTempClause = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "clause");
01269             string strTempParam = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "param");
01270 
01271             // TRANSACTION ID
01272             //
01273             if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempTransNum))
01274             {
01275                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the transaction ID for the running smart contract: ");
01276                 string strInputTransNum = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
01277 
01278                 if (VerifyStringVal(strInputTransNum))
01279                 {
01280                     strTransNum = strInputTransNum;
01281                 }
01282             }
01283             else
01284             {
01285                 strTransNum = strTempTransNum;
01286             }
01287 
01288             // CLAUSE NAME
01289             //
01290             if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempClause))
01291             {
01292                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the name of the clause you wish to trigger: ");
01293                 string strInputClause = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
01294 
01295                 if (VerifyStringVal(strInputClause))
01296                 {
01297                     strClause = strInputClause;
01298                 }
01299             }
01300             else
01301             {
01302                 strClause = strTempClause;
01303             }
01304 
01305             // OPTIONAL PARAMETER
01306             //
01307             if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempParam))
01308             {
01309                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "You can pass an optional parameter string (to pass to the clause itself)\nfollowed by a ~ by itself on a blank line. (Just use ~ to leave it blank.)\n\n");
01310                 string strInputParam = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
01311 
01312                 if (VerifyStringVal(strInputParam))
01313                 {
01314                     strParam = strInputParam;
01315                 }
01316             }
01317             else
01318             {
01319                 strParam = strTempParam;
01320             }
01321 
01322         } // VerifyExists("Args")
01323 
01324         if (VerifyStringVal(strTransNum) && VerifyStringVal(strClause))
01325         {
01326             return details_trigger_clause(Server, MyNym, strTransNum, strClause, strParam);
01327         }
01328 
01329     }
01330     return -1;
01331 }
01332 
01333 
01334 OT_COMMANDS_OT string OT_Command::find_revokedID_for_subcred(const string & strMyNymID, const string & strInputID)
01335 {
01336     int32_t nCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_RevokedCredCount(strMyNymID);
01337 
01338     if (!VerifyIntVal(nCredCount))
01339     {
01340         return "";
01341     }
01342 
01343     else if (nCredCount >= 1)
01344     {
01345         for (int32_t nCurrent = 0; nCurrent < nCredCount; ++nCurrent)
01346         {
01347             string strCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_RevokedCredID(strMyNymID, nCurrent);
01348 
01349             int32_t nSubCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubcredentialCount(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01350 
01351             if (VerifyIntVal(nSubCredCount) && (nSubCredCount >= 1))
01352             {
01353                 for (int32_t nCurrentSubCred = 0; nCurrentSubCred < nSubCredCount; ++nCurrentSubCred)
01354                 {
01355                     string strSubCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubCredentialID(strMyNymID, strCredID, nCurrentSubCred);
01356 
01357                     if (strInputID == strSubCredID)
01358                     {
01359                         return strCredID; // Returns the revoked master credential ID associated with the subcred passed in.
01360                     }
01361                 } // loop sub-credentials.
01362             }
01363         } // loop credentials
01364 
01365     }
01366     return "";
01367 }
01368 
01369 
01370 OT_COMMANDS_OT string OT_Command::find_masterID_for_subcred(const string & strMyNymID, const string & strInputID)
01371 {
01372     int32_t nCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_CredentialCount(strMyNymID);
01373 
01374     if (!VerifyIntVal(nCredCount))
01375     {
01376         return "";
01377     }
01378 
01379     else if (nCredCount >= 1)
01380     {
01381         for (int32_t nCurrent = 0; nCurrent < nCredCount; ++nCurrent)
01382         {
01383             string strCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_CredentialID(strMyNymID, nCurrent);
01384 
01385             int32_t nSubCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubcredentialCount(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01386 
01387             if (VerifyIntVal(nSubCredCount) && (nSubCredCount >= 1))
01388             {
01389                 for (int32_t nCurrentSubCred = 0; nCurrentSubCred < nSubCredCount; ++nCurrentSubCred)
01390                 {
01391                     string strSubCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubCredentialID(strMyNymID, strCredID, nCurrentSubCred);
01392 
01393                     if (strInputID == strSubCredID)
01394                     {
01395                         return strCredID; // Returns the master credential ID associated with the subcred passed in.
01396                     }
01397                 } // loop sub-credentials.
01398             }
01399         } // loop credentials
01400 
01401     }
01402     return "";
01403 }
01404 
01405 
01406 // Takes a Nym ID and a credential ID and displays the contents
01407 // for the credential.
01408 // The credential might be a master credential, or a subcredential.
01409 // It also might be a revoked credential.
01410 // Handle all cases.
01411 //
01412 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::details_show_credential(const string & strMyNymID, const string & strCredID)
01413 {
01414     string strCredContents = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_CredentialContents(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01415 
01416     if (VerifyStringVal(strCredContents))
01417     {
01418         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Master Credential contents:\n");
01419         print(strCredContents);
01420         return true;
01421     }
01422 
01423     strCredContents = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_RevokedCredContents(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01424 
01425     if (VerifyStringVal(strCredContents))
01426     {
01427         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Revoked Credential contents:\n");
01428         print(strCredContents);
01429         return true;
01430     }
01431 
01432     // It MUST be a subcredential by this point, either for a master
01433     // or revoked master credential.
01434     //
01435     bool bIsRevoked = false;
01436     string strMasterID = find_masterID_for_subcred(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01437 
01438     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMasterID))
01439     {
01440         strMasterID = find_revokedID_for_subcred(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01441         bIsRevoked = true;
01442     }
01443 
01444     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMasterID))
01445     {
01446         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, unable to find any credentials associated with that ID.\n");
01447     }
01448     else
01449     {
01450         strCredContents = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubCredentialContents(strMyNymID, strMasterID, strCredID);
01451 
01452         if (!VerifyStringVal(strCredContents))
01453         {
01454             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error retrieving sub-credential contents.\n");
01455             return false;
01456         }
01457 
01458         if (bIsRevoked)
01459         {
01460             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Revoked Subcredential contents:\n");
01461         }
01462         else
01463         {
01464             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Subcredential contents:\n");
01465         }
01466         print(strCredContents); // Great success!
01467         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
01468         return true;
01469     }
01470     return false;
01471 }
01472 
01473 
01474 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_credential()
01475 {
01476     string strUsage = "Usage:   opentxs showcred --mynym NYM_ID --args \"id CREDENTIAL_ID\"\n\nThis command displays the contents of a given credential (for a given Nym.)\n\n";
01477     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
01478 
01479     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
01480     {
01481         string strCredID = "";
01482 
01483         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
01484         {
01485             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
01486             //                                  const std::string str_key)
01487             //
01488             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
01489             // EXAMPLE:  --args "index 1"
01490             //
01491             string strTempCredID = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "id");
01492 
01493             if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempCredID))
01494             {
01495                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the ID for the credential: ");
01496                 string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
01497 
01498                 if (VerifyStringVal(strInput))
01499                 {
01500                     strCredID = strInput;
01501                 }
01502             }
01503             else
01504             {
01505                 strCredID = strTempCredID;
01506             }
01507         } // VerifyExists("Args")
01508 
01509         if (VerifyStringVal(strCredID) && details_show_credential(MyNym, strCredID))
01510         {
01511             return 1;
01512         }
01513     }
01514 
01515     return -1;
01516 }
01517 
01518 
01519 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_show_credentials(const string & strMyNymID)
01520 {
01521     int32_t nReturnVal = -1;
01522 
01523     int32_t nCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_CredentialCount(strMyNymID);
01524 
01525     if (!VerifyIntVal(nCredCount))
01526     {
01527         return -1;
01528     }
01529 
01530     if (nCredCount >= 1)
01531     {
01532         nReturnVal = 1;
01533 
01534         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Idx     Credential ID\n---------------------------\n");
01535 
01536         for (int32_t nCurrent = 0; nCurrent < nCredCount; ++nCurrent)
01537         {
01538             string strCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_CredentialID(strMyNymID, nCurrent);
01539             print(to_string(nCurrent) + ":      " + strCredID);
01540 
01541             int32_t nSubCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubcredentialCount(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01542 
01543             if (VerifyIntVal(nSubCredCount) && (nSubCredCount >= 1))
01544             {
01545 
01546                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "        ---------------------------\n        Idx     Subcredential ID\n        ---------------------------\n");
01547 
01548                 for (int32_t nCurrentSubCred = 0; nCurrentSubCred < nSubCredCount; ++nCurrentSubCred)
01549                 {
01550                     string strSubCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubCredentialID(strMyNymID, strCredID, nCurrentSubCred);
01551                     print("        " + to_string(nCurrentSubCred) + ":      " + strSubCredID);
01552                 }
01553             }
01554         } // credentials
01555 
01556         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
01557     }
01558 
01559     else { nReturnVal = 0; }
01560 
01561     // Next: REVOKED credentials.
01562 
01563     nCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_RevokedCredCount(strMyNymID);
01564 
01565     if (!VerifyIntVal(nCredCount))
01566     {
01567         return -1;
01568     }
01569 
01570     if (nCredCount >= 1)
01571     {
01572         nReturnVal = 1;
01573 
01574         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Idx     Revoked Credential ID\n---------------------------\n");
01575 
01576         for (int32_t nCurrent = 0; nCurrent < nCredCount; ++nCurrent)
01577         {
01578             string strCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_RevokedCredID(strMyNymID, nCurrent);
01579             print(to_string(nCurrent) + ":      " + strCredID);
01580 
01581             int32_t nSubCredCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubcredentialCount(strMyNymID, strCredID);
01582 
01583             if (VerifyIntVal(nSubCredCount) && (nSubCredCount >= 1))
01584             {
01585 
01586                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "        ---------------------------\n        Idx     Revoked Subcredential ID\n        ---------------------------\n");
01587 
01588                 for (int32_t nCurrentSubCred = 0; nCurrentSubCred < nSubCredCount; ++nCurrentSubCred)
01589                 {
01590                     string strSubCredID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_SubCredentialID(strMyNymID, strCredID, nCurrentSubCred);
01591                     print("        " + to_string(nCurrentSubCred) + ":      " + strSubCredID);
01592                 }
01593             }
01594         } // credentials
01595 
01596         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
01597     }
01598 
01599     return nReturnVal;
01600 }
01601 
01602 
01603 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_credentials()
01604 {
01605     string strUsage = "Usage:   opentxs credentials --mynym NYM_ID\n\nThis command displays the list of credentials for a given Nym.\n\n";
01606     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
01607 
01608     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
01609     {
01610         return details_show_credentials(MyNym);
01611     }
01612 
01613     return -1;
01614 }
01615 
01616 
01617 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::stat_partyagent(const string & strSmartContract, const string & strPartyName, const string & strAgentName, const int32_t nIndex)
01618 {
01619     string strDisplayIndex = "*";
01620 
01621     if (VerifyIntVal(nIndex))
01622     {
01623         strDisplayIndex = to_string(nIndex);
01624     }
01625 
01626     string strAgentID = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAgentID(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAgentName);
01627 
01628     if (VerifyStringVal(strAgentID))
01629     {
01630         print("--------------------\n " + strDisplayIndex + " : Agent '" + strAgentName + "' (party '" + strPartyName + "') has NymID: " + strAgentID + " ('" + OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_Name(strAgentID) + "')");
01631     }
01632     else
01633     {
01634         print(" " + strDisplayIndex + " : Agent '" + strAgentName + "' (party '" + strPartyName + "') has no NymID assigned (yet.)");
01635     }
01636 
01637     return true;
01638 }
01639 
01640 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::stat_partyagent_index(const string & strSmartContract, const string & strPartyName, const int32_t nCurrentAgent)
01641 {
01642     string strAgentName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAgentNameByIndex(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nCurrentAgent);
01643 
01644     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAgentName))
01645     {
01646         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Failed retrieving Agent Name from party '" + strPartyName + "' at agent index: " + to_string(nCurrentAgent) + "\n");
01647         return false;
01648     }
01649     return stat_partyagent(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAgentName, nCurrentAgent);
01650 }
01651 
01652 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::stat_partyagents(const string & strSmartContract, const string & strPartyName, const int32_t nDepth)
01653 {
01654     int32_t nAgentCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAgentCount(strSmartContract, strPartyName);
01655 
01656     if (!VerifyIntVal(nAgentCount) || (nAgentCount < 0))
01657     {
01658         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Party '" + strPartyName + "' has bad value for number of authorized agents.\n");
01659         return false;
01660     }
01661 
01662     if (nDepth > 0)
01663     {
01664         // Iterate the agents for this party.
01665         //
01666         for (int32_t nCurrentAgent = 0; nCurrentAgent < nAgentCount; ++nCurrentAgent)
01667         {
01668             if (!stat_partyagent_index(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nCurrentAgent)) { return false; }
01669         }
01670     }
01671     else
01672     {
01673         print("Party '" + strPartyName + "' has " + to_string(nAgentCount) + ((1 == nAgentCount) ? " agent." : " agents."));
01674     }
01675 
01676     return true;
01677 }
01678 
01679 
01680 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::stat_partyaccount(const string & strSmartContract, const string & strPartyName, const string & strAcctName, const int32_t nCurrentAccount)
01681 {
