01682     string strAcctAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctAssetID(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
01683     string strAcctID = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctID(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
01684     string strAcctAgentName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctAgentName(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
01685 
01686     if (VerifyStringVal(strAcctAssetID))
01687     {
01688         print("-------------------\nAccount '" + strAcctName + "' (index " + to_string(nCurrentAccount) + " on Party '" + strPartyName + "') has asset type: " + strAcctAssetID + " (" + OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Name(strAcctAssetID) + ")");
01689     }
01690     //  else
01691     //  {
01692     //      print("Account '"+strAcctName+"' (party '"+strPartyName+"') has no asset type (yet.)")
01693     //; }
01694 
01695     if (VerifyStringVal(strAcctID))
01696     {
01697         print("Account '" + strAcctName + "' (party '" + strPartyName + "') is confirmed as Account ID: " + strAcctID + " (" + OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_Name(strAcctID) + ")");
01698     }
01699     //  else
01700     //  {
01701     //      print("Account '"+strAcctName+"' (party '"+strPartyName+"') has no Account ID (yet.)")
01702     //; }
01703 
01704     if (VerifyStringVal(strAcctAgentName))
01705     {
01706         print("Account '" + strAcctName + "' (party '" + strPartyName + "') is managed by agent: " + strAcctAgentName);
01707     }
01708     //  else
01709     //  {
01710     //      print("Account '"+strAcctName+"' (party '"+strPartyName+"') has no managing agent (yet.)")
01711     //; }
01712     return true;
01713 }
01714 
01715 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::stat_partyaccount_index(const string & strSmartContract, const string & strPartyName, const int32_t nCurrentAccount)
01716 {
01717     string strAcctName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctNameByIndex(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nCurrentAccount);
01718 
01719     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctName))
01720     {
01721         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Failed retrieving Asset Account Name from party '" + strPartyName + "' at account index: " + to_string(nCurrentAccount) + "\n");
01722         return false;
01723     }
01724     return stat_partyaccount(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName, nCurrentAccount);
01725 }
01726 
01727 
01728 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::stat_partyaccounts(const string & strSmartContract, const string & strPartyName, const int32_t nDepth)
01729 {
01730     int32_t nAccountCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctCount(strSmartContract, strPartyName);
01731 
01732     if (!VerifyIntVal(nAccountCount) || (nAccountCount < 0))
01733     {
01734         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Party '" + strPartyName + "' has bad value for number of asset accounts.\n");
01735         return false;
01736     }
01737 
01738     if (nDepth > 0)
01739     {
01740         // Iterate the asset accounts for this party.
01741         //
01742         for (int32_t nCurrentAccount = 0; nCurrentAccount < nAccountCount; ++nCurrentAccount)
01743         {
01744             if (!stat_partyaccount_index(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nCurrentAccount)) { return false; }
01745         }
01746     }
01747     else
01748     {
01749         print("Party '" + strPartyName + "' has " + to_string(nAccountCount) + ((1 == nAccountCount) ? " asset account." : " asset accounts."));
01750     }
01751 
01752     return true;
01753 }
01754 
01755 
01756 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::show_unconfirmed_parties(const string & strSmartContract, int32_t & nPartyCount)
01757 {
01758     if (!VerifyIntVal(nPartyCount) || (0 == nPartyCount))
01759     {
01760         nPartyCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_GetPartyCount(strSmartContract);
01761         if (!VerifyIntVal(nPartyCount) || (nPartyCount < 0))
01762         {
01763             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: There are apparently no PARTIES to this smart contract.\n");
01764             return false;
01765         }
01766     }
01767 
01768     // See if the smart contract is already confirmed by all parties.
01769     //
01770     if (OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_AreAllPartiesConfirmed(strSmartContract))
01771     {
01772         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Looks like all the parties on this contract are already confirmed.\n(Perhaps you want to 'activate' it instead.)\n");
01773         return false;
01774     }
01775 
01776     int32_t nUnconfirmedPartyCount = 0;
01777 
01778     for (int32_t nCurrentParty = 0; nCurrentParty < nPartyCount; ++nCurrentParty)
01779     {
01780         string strPartyName = OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_GetPartyByIndex(strSmartContract, nCurrentParty);
01781 
01782         if (!VerifyStringVal(strPartyName))
01783         {
01784             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Unable to retrieve smart contract party's name at index: " + to_string(nCurrentParty) + "\n");
01785             return false;
01786         }
01787 
01788         bool bIsPartyConfirmed = OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_IsPartyConfirmed(strSmartContract, strPartyName);
01789         if (!bIsPartyConfirmed)
01790         {
01791             string strIndex = to_string(nCurrentParty);
01792             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strIndex + " : Unconfirmed party: " + strPartyName + "\n");
01793             ++nUnconfirmedPartyCount;
01794         }
01795     } // for
01796 
01797     if (nUnconfirmedPartyCount <= 0)
01798     {
01799         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN: OT_API_Smart_AreAllPartiesConfirmed was already verified as false, above.\nSo then why am I at the bottom of this loop and I haven't found any unconfirmed parties?\n");
01800         return false;
01801     }
01802 
01803     return true;
01804 }
01805 
01806 
01807 // The merchant (sender of proposal / payee of proposal) proposes the payment plan
01808 // to the customer (recipient of proposal / payer of proposal.) So this function is
01809 // called by the merchant.
01810 //
01811 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_propose_plan(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyNymID, const string & strMyAcctID, const string & strHisNymID, const string & strHisAcctID, const string & strDates, const string & strConsideration, const string & strInitialPayment, const string & strPaymentPlan, const string & strExpiry)
01812 {
01813     if (!VerifyStringVal(strConsideration))
01814     {
01815         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, but you must describe the consideration to create a recurring payment plan.\n");
01816         return -1;
01817     }
01818 
01819     // Make sure strMyNymID aka recipient of money (aka sender of payment plan instrument)
01820     // has enough transaction numbers to propose the plan in the first place.
01821     //
01822     if (!MadeEasy::insure_enough_nums(2, strServerID, strMyNymID)) // strMyNymID is Merchant.
01823     {
01824         return -1;
01825     }
01826 
01827     // OTAPI_Wrap::EasyProposePlan is a version of ProposePaymentPlan that compresses it into a
01828     // fewer number of arguments. (Then it expands them and calls ProposePaymentPlan.)
01829     // Basically this version has ALL the same parameters, but it stuffs two or three at a time into
01830     // a single parameter, as a comma-separated list in string form.
01831     // See details for each parameter, in the comment below.
01832     //
01833     string strPlan = OTAPI_Wrap::EasyProposePlan(strServerID, strDates, strHisAcctID, strHisNymID, strConsideration, strMyAcctID, strMyNymID, strInitialPayment, strPaymentPlan, strExpiry);
01834 
01835     // std::string EasyProposePlan(
01836     //    const std::string & SERVER_ID,
01837     //    // ----------------------------------------
01838     //    const std::string & DATE_RANGE,           // "from,to"  Default 'from' (0 or "") == NOW,
01839     //    // ---------------------------------------- // and default 'to' (0 or "") == no expiry / cancel anytime
01840     //    const std::string & SENDER_ACCT_ID,     // strHisAcctID. Mandatory parameters.
01841     //    const std::string & SENDER_USER_ID,     // strHisNymID. Both sender and recipient must sign before submitting.
01842     //    // ----------------------------------------
01843     //    const std::string & PLAN_CONSIDERATION, // Like a memo.
01844     //    // ----------------------------------------
01845     //    const std::string & RECIPIENT_ACCT_ID, // strMyAcctID. NOT optional.
01846     //    const std::string & RECIPIENT_USER_ID, // strMyNymID. Both sender and recipient must sign before submitting.
01847     //    // -------------------------------
01848     //    const std::string & INITIAL_PAYMENT, // "amount,delay"  Default 'amount' (0 or "") == no initial payment.
01849     //    // ------------------------------- // Default 'delay' (0 or NULL) is seconds from creation date.
01850     //    const std::string & PAYMENT_PLAN,   // "amount,delay,period" 'amount' is a recurring payment.
01851     //    // -------------------------------  // 'delay' and 'period' cause 30 days if you pass 0 or "".
01852     //    const std::string & PLAN_EXPIRY // "length,number" 'length' is maximum lifetime in seconds.
01853     //    );                              // 'number' is maximum number of payments in seconds. 0 or "" is unlimited (for both.)
01854 
01855 
01856     if (VerifyStringVal(strPlan))
01857     {
01858         // The "propose" step (performed by the merchant) includes the merchant's confirmation / signing.
01859         // (So there's no need for the merchant to additionally "confirm" the plan before sending it -- he
01860         // already has done that by this point, just as part of the proposal itself.)
01861 
01862         // Send the payment plan to the payer (the customer). If it fails, harvest the transaction numbers
01863         // back from the payment plan. Return 1 if success.
01864 
01865         string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_payment(strServerID, strMyNymID, strHisNymID, strPlan);
01866         int32_t nMessageSuccess = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
01867 
01868         if (!VerifyIntVal(nMessageSuccess) || (1 != nMessageSuccess))
01869         {
01870             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "For whatever reason, our attempt to send the payment plan on to the next user has failed.\n");
01871             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strPlan, strMyNymID,
01872                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a payment plan, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and thus we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
01873             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "details_propose: OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
01874             return -1;
01875         }
01876         // else success
01877         return nMessageSuccess;
01878     }
01879 
01880     return -1;
01881 }
01882 
01883 
01884 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_propose_plan() // payment plan -- called by recipient. (Who generates the proposal.)
01885 {
01886     string strUsage1 = "Usage: opentxs propose   (For a merchant to propose a payment plan to a customer.)\nMandatory: --server SERVER_ID --mynym PAYEE_NYM_ID --hisnym PAYER_NYM_ID\nMandatory: --myacct PAYEE_ACCT_ID --hisacct PAYER_NYM_ID\nAdditional arguments:\n Date Range: --args \" date_range \\\"from,to\\\" \"\nFROM should be in seconds from Jan 1970, and TO is added to that number.\nDefault FROM is the current time, and default TO is 'no expiry.'\n";
01887     string strUsage2 = concat(strUsage1, "Also: --args \" consideration \\\"like a memo\\\" \" \n");
01888     string strUsage3 = concat(strUsage2, "Also: --args \" initial_payment \\\"amount,delay\\\" \" \nDefault 'amount' (0 or \"\") == no initial payment. Default 'delay' (0 or \"\") is seconds from creation date.\n");
01889     string strUsage4 = concat(strUsage3, "Also: --args \" payment_plan \\\"amount,delay,period\\\" \" \n'amount' is a recurring payment. 'delay' and 'period' cause 30 days if you pass 0 or \"\".\n'delay' and 'period' are both measured in seconds. Period is time between\neach payment. Delay is time until first payment.\n");
01890     string strUsage = concat(strUsage4, "Also: --args \" plan_expiry \\\"length,number\\\" \" \n'length' is maximum lifetime in seconds. 'number' is maximum number of payments. 0 or \"\" is unlimited (for both.)\n\n");
01891 
01892     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
01893     // **************************************************************
01894     // recipient nym        // recipient acct        // sender nym             // sender acct
01895     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("MyAcct") && VerifyExists("HisNym") && VerifyExists("HisAcct"))
01896     {
01897         string strDates = "";
01898         string strConsideration = "";
01899         string strInitialPayment = "";
01900         string strPaymentPlan = "";
01901         string strExpiry = "";
01902 
01903         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
01904         {
01905             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
01906             //                                  const std::string str_key)
01907             //
01908             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
01909             // EXAMPLE:  --args "index 1"
01910             //
01911             string strTempDates = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "date_range"); // "from,to"  Default 'from' (0 or "") == NOW (otherwise pass the time in seconds), and default 'to' (0 or "") == no expiry / cancel anytime (otherwise pass this time in seconds as well.)
01912             string strTempConsideration = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "consideration"); // Like a memo.
01913             string strTempInitialPayment = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "initial_payment"); // "amount,delay"  Default 'amount' (0 or "") == no initial payment. Default 'delay' (0 or NULL) is seconds from creation date.
01914             string strTempPaymentPlan = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "payment_plan"); // "amount,delay,period" 'amount' is a recurring payment. 'delay' and 'period' cause 30 days if you pass 0 or "".
01915             string strTempExpiry = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "plan_expiry"); // "length,number" 'length' is maximum lifetime in seconds. 'number' is maximum number of payments. 0 or "" is unlimited (for both.)
01916 
01917             if (VerifyStringVal(strTempDates)) { strDates = strTempDates; }
01918             if (VerifyStringVal(strTempConsideration)) { strConsideration = strTempConsideration; }
01919             if (VerifyStringVal(strTempInitialPayment)) { strInitialPayment = strTempInitialPayment; }
01920             if (VerifyStringVal(strTempPaymentPlan)) { strPaymentPlan = strTempPaymentPlan; }
01921             if (VerifyStringVal(strTempExpiry)) { strExpiry = strTempExpiry; }
01922         }
01923         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); // stderr
01924         // ***************************************************************
01925 
01926         if (!VerifyStringVal(strConsideration))
01927         {
01928             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nDescribe the product or service being received in return for the\nrecurring payments, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
01929 
01930             strConsideration = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
01931 
01932             if (!VerifyStringVal(strConsideration))
01933             {
01934                 return -1;
01935             }
01936         }
01937 
01938         // ***************************************************************
01939         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "date_range (from,to): " + strDates + "\n"); // stderr
01940         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "consideration: " + strConsideration + "\n"); // stderr
01941         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "initial_payment (amount,delay): " + strInitialPayment + "\n"); // stderr
01942         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "payment_plan (amount,delay,period): " + strPaymentPlan + "\n"); // stderr
01943         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "plan_expiry (length,number): " + strExpiry + "\n"); // stderr
01944 
01945         return details_propose_plan(Server, MyNym, MyAcct, HisNym, HisAcct, strDates, strConsideration, strInitialPayment, strPaymentPlan, strExpiry);
01946     }
01947 
01948     return -1;
01949 }
01950 
01951 
01952 // NOTE: if nIndex is NOT -1, then it's in the payments inbox for Server and MyNym, and we
01953 // need to go ahead and
01954 // the serverID must be found on the instrument, or must be provided as Server, or we must ask
01955 // the user to enter it.
01956 //
01957 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_confirm_plan(const string & strPlan, const int32_t nIndex)
01958 {
01959     string strLocation = "details_confirm_plan";
01960 
01961     //    std::string ConfirmPaymentPlan(
01962     //       const std::string & SERVER_ID,
01963     //       const std::string & SENDER_USER_ID,
01964     //       const std::string & SENDER_ACCT_ID,
01965     //       const std::string & RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
01966     //       const std::string & PAYMENT_PLAN);
01967 
01968     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strPlan);
01969     string strSenderUserID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(strPlan);
01970     string strSenderAcctID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderAcctID(strPlan);
01971     string strRecipientUserID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(strPlan);
01972 
01973     if (VerifyStringVal(strServerID) && VerifyStringVal(strSenderUserID) && VerifyStringVal(strSenderAcctID) && VerifyStringVal(strRecipientUserID) && VerifyStringVal(strPlan))
01974     {
01975         //      OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Here's the payment plan, FYI:\n\n" + strPlan + "\n");
01976 
01977         // Make sure strSenderUserID aka sender of money (aka recipient of payment plan
01978         // instrument in his inbox, which if confirmed will have him sending money...)
01979         // has enough transaction numbers to confirm the plan.
01980         //
01981         if (!MadeEasy::insure_enough_nums(2, strServerID, strSenderUserID)) // strSenderUserID is Customer.
01982         {
01983             return -1;
01984         }
01985 
01986         string strConfirmed = OTAPI_Wrap::ConfirmPaymentPlan(strServerID, strSenderUserID, strSenderAcctID, strRecipientUserID, strPlan);
01987 
01988         if (VerifyStringVal(strConfirmed))
01989         {
01990             //          OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Here's the CONFIRMED payment plan, FYI:\n\n" + strConfirmed + "\n");
01991 
01992             // Below this point, inside this block, if we fail, then we need to harvest the transaction
01993             // numbers back from the payment plan that we confirmed (strConfirmed.)
01994             //
01995             string strResponse = MadeEasy::deposit_payment_plan(strServerID, strSenderUserID, strConfirmed);
01996             string strAttempt = "deposit_payment_plan";
01997             // ***************************************************************
01998             int32_t nMessageSuccess = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
01999 
02000             // These are cases where the transaction never even got to TRY to run, since the message itself
02001             // failed inside the server before it even got that far.
02002             //
02003             if (-1 == nMessageSuccess)
02004             {
02005                 // In this case, the server never even SAW the transaction, because its enveloping message already
02006                 // failed before we even got that far. So we can harvest, as though it was never attempted...
02007                 //
02008                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Message error: " + strAttempt + ".\n");
02009                 int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strConfirmed, strSenderUserID,
02010                     false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02011                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02012                 return -1;
02013             }
02014             else if (0 == nMessageSuccess)
02015             {
02016                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server reply (" + strAttempt + "): Message failure.\n");
02017                 int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strConfirmed, strSenderUserID,
02018                     false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02019                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02020                 return 0;
02021             }
02022             // (else 1: message was processed successfully -- though not necessarily the transaction inside it.)
02023 
02024             // BELOW THIS POINT, the transaction has definitely processed. It may have succeeded or failed,
02025             // but either way, we don't need to harvest any numbers, since OT will internally handle those
02026             // when it processes the server's reply to the transaction attempt.
02027             //
02028             int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServerID, strSenderUserID, strSenderAcctID, strAttempt, strResponse);
02029 
02030             if (1 == nInterpretReply) // Success.
02031             {
02032                 // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
02033                 // since they have probably changed from this operation.
02034                 //
02035                 bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServerID, strSenderUserID, strSenderAcctID, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
02036 
02037                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nServer response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS activating payment plan!\n");
02038                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
02039             }
02040             //
02041             // Return status to caller.
02042             //
02043             return nInterpretReply;
02044         }
02045     }
02046     return -1;
02047 }
02048 
02049 
02050 // NOTE: if nIndex is -1, then it's assumed the instrument was PASTED in, and therefore
02051 // the serverID must be found on the instrument, or must be provided as Server, or we must ask
02052 // the user to enter it. Then the Nym [and potentially AcctID] must be ascertained by walking
02053 // the user through the instrument, and by making him choose a Nym and Acct(s) for the party
02054 // he's confirming as.
02055 //
02056 // But if an index is provided, then it's ASSUMED the index goes to the payments inbox, and
02057 // that therefore Server and MyNym must have been provided at the command line already, or
02058 // otherwise that index could not logically have been matched up to the proper box.
02059 //
02060 // If SOME parties have already confirmed the contract before you, then it SHOULD already have
02061 // a serverID attached to it. If a Server is also provided at the command line, then the two must
02062 // match, since the ID cannot be changed after that point.
02063 //
02064 
02065 
02066 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_confirm_smart_contract(string & strSmartContract, const int32_t nIndex)
02067 {
02068     string strLocation = "details_confirm_smart_contract";
02069 
02070     int32_t nPartyCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_GetPartyCount(strSmartContract);
02071 
02072     if (!VerifyIntVal(nPartyCount) || (nPartyCount <= 0))
02073     {
02074         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed trying to confirm a smart contract: there are apparently no PARTIES to this contract!\n");
02075         return -1;
02076     }
02077 
02078     // We don't need MyAcct except when actually ACTIVATING the smart contract on the server.
02079     // This variable might get set later to MyAcct, if it matches one of the accounts being
02080     // confirmed. (Meaning if this variable is set by the time we reach the bottom, then we
02081     // can use it for activation, if/when needed.)
02082     //
02083     string strMyAcctID = "";
02084     string strMyAcctAgentName = "";
02085 
02086     string strServerID = "";
02087     string strNymID = "";
02088 
02089     map<string, string> map_ID; // We'll store the account IDs here, for each PartyAcct
02090     map<string, string> map_agent; // We'll store the agent names here, for each PartyAcct
02091 
02092     // By this point we know it's a smart contract, and there is at least
02093     // one party that is still unconfirmed on this contract.
02094     // Therefore let's loop through the parties and display the
02095     // unconfirmed ones.
02096     //
02097     if (show_unconfirmed_parties(strSmartContract, nPartyCount))
02098     {
02099 
02100         // By this point I know that nUnconfirmedPartyCount is larger than 0.
02101         // Therefore we displayed the unconfirmed ones...
02102         // Let's ask the user to choose one to confirm as....
02103         //
02104         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nWhich party are you? Enter the number, from the list above: ");
02105 
02106         string strPartyIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02107 
02108         if (VerifyStringVal(strPartyIndex))
02109         {
02110             int32_t nCurrentParty = to_int(strPartyIndex);
02111 
02112             if (VerifyIntVal(nCurrentParty) && (nCurrentParty >= 0) && (nCurrentParty < nPartyCount))
02113             {
02114                 string strPartyName = OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_GetPartyByIndex(strSmartContract, nCurrentParty);
02115 
02116                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strPartyName))
02117                 {
02118                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Unable to retrieve smart contract party's name at index: " + to_string(nCurrentParty) + "\n");
02119                     return -1;
02120                 }
02121 
02122                 if (OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_IsPartyConfirmed(strSmartContract, strPartyName))
02123                 {
02124                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: the party at that index is _already_ confirmed.\n");
02125                     return -1;
02126                 }
02127 
02128                 // At this point we know it's a valid index for an unconfirmed party.
02129                 // And we know that strPartyName is the party's name.
02130                 //
02131                 // So how many accounts does strPartyName have? We must confirm those, too.
02132                 //
02133                 int32_t nAccountCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctCount(strSmartContract, strPartyName);
02134 
02135                 if (!VerifyIntVal(nAccountCount) || (nAccountCount < 0))
02136                 {
02137                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Party '" + strPartyName + "' has a bad value for number of asset accounts.\n");
02138                     return -1;
02139                 }
02140 
02141                 // Confirm the accounts.
02142                 //
02143                 if (nAccountCount > 0)
02144                 {
02145                     // In the loop, if we have to devise the serverID, we store it in this var so we don't devise twice.
02146                     string strFoundServerID = "";
02147                     string strFoundMyNymID = "";
02148                     int32_t nCurrentAcctCount = nAccountCount;
02149 
02150                     while (nCurrentAcctCount > 0)
02151                     {
02152                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
02153                         stat_partyaccounts(strSmartContract, strPartyName, 2); //nDepth=2
02154 
02155                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n There are " + to_string(nCurrentAcctCount) + " asset accounts remaining to be confirmed.\nEnter the index for an UNconfirmed account: ");
02156 
02157                         string strAcctIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02158 
02159                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctIndex))
02160                         {
02161                             return -1;
02162                         }
02163 
02164                         int32_t nAcctIndex = to_int(strAcctIndex);
02165 
02166                         if (!VerifyIntVal(nAcctIndex) || (nAcctIndex < 0))
02167                         {
02168                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Bad Index: " + strAcctIndex + "\n");
02169                             return -1;
02170                         }
02171 
02172                         string strAcctName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctNameByIndex(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nAcctIndex);
02173 
02174                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctName))
02175                         {
02176                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Unable to retrieve account name at index " + strAcctIndex + " for Party: " + strPartyName + "\n");
02177                             return -1;
02178                         }
02179 
02180                         bool bAlreadyThere = false;
02181 
02182                         for (map<string, string>::iterator x = map_ID.begin(); x != map_ID.end(); x++)
02183                         {
02184                             if (x->first == strAcctName) { bAlreadyThere = true; }
02185                         }
02186 
02187                         string strAcctID = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctID(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
02188 
02189                         if (bAlreadyThere || VerifyStringVal(strAcctID))  // This account is ALREADY confirmed! It has an account ID already.
02190                         {
02191                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nSorry, but the account at index " + strAcctIndex + " is already confirmed with account ID: " + strAcctID + " \nYou are just going to have to pick a different account.\n");
02192                         }
02193                         else // The account is NOT already confirmed (so we can confirm it, once we select the Acct ID to use.)
02194                         {
02195 
02196                             string strServerOnContract = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strSmartContract);
02197                             bool bServerOnContract = VerifyStringVal(strServerOnContract);
02198 
02199                             // Now we need to ascertain the server and Nym ID...
02200 
02201                             if (-1 != nIndex) // The instrument was selected from the payments inbox at a given index.
02202                             {
02203                                 strServerID = Server;  // These match up to the payments inbox that was used.
02204                                 strNymID = MyNym;
02205 
02206                                 // If there's a server listed on the contract (there may not be, if this is the FIRST
02207                                 // confirmation) AND if that Server ID doesn't match the one passed in on the command line...
02208                                 //
02209                                 if (bServerOnContract && (strServerID != strServerOnContract))
02210                                 {
02211                                     string strServerName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetServer_Name(strServerOnContract);
02212                                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerName)) { strServerName = ""; }
02213                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The server ID on the smart contract, " + strServerOnContract + " (" + strServerName + ") doesn't match the server selected at the command line with the --server option.\n");
02214                                     return -1;
02215                                 }
02216                             }
02217                             else // the instrument was pasted in.
02218                             {
02219                                 if (bServerOnContract)
02220                                 {
02221                                     strServerID = strServerOnContract;
02222                                 }
02223                                 else if (VerifyExists("Server", false))
02224                                 {
02225                                     strServerID = Server;
02226                                 }
02227                                 else if (VerifyStringVal(strFoundServerID)) // We might have already figured it out. (The block after this one should only happen once, if at all.)
02228                                 {
02229                                     strServerID = strFoundServerID;
02230                                 }
02231                                 else // There's no server on the contract, AND there's no server chosen at the command line.
02232                                 {
02233                                     int32_t nServerCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetServerCount();
02234 
02235                                     if (nServerCount < 1)
02236                                     {
02237                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, there aren't any server contracts in this wallet. Try 'opentxs addserver'\n");
02238                                         return -1;
02239                                     }
02240 
02241                                     OT_Command::main_stat_servers();
02242 
02243                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Paste a server ID: ");
02244 
02245                                     string strServerIDInput = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02246 
02247                                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerIDInput))
02248                                     {
02249                                         return -1;
02250                                     }
02251 
02252                                     strServerID = strServerIDInput;
02253                                     strFoundServerID = strServerIDInput; // So we're not forced to select the server EVERY iteration...
02254                                 }
02255 
02256                                 if (VerifyExists("MyNym", false))
02257                                 {
02258                                     strNymID = MyNym;
02259                                 }
02260                                 else if (VerifyStringVal(strFoundMyNymID))
02261                                 {
02262                                     strNymID = strFoundMyNymID;
02263                                 }
02264                                 else
02265                                 {
02266                                     int32_t nNymCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNymCount();
02267 
02268                                     if (nNymCount < 1)
02269                                     {
02270                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "There are apparently no Nyms in this wallet. Try 'opentxs newnym'\n");
02271                                         return -1;
02272                                     }
02273                                     while (true) // Choose a Nym.
02274                                     {
02275                                         print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
02276                                         print(" ** PSEUDONYMS (filtered by serverID: " + strServerID + "): " + "\n");
02277 
02278                                         bool bFoundANym = false;
02279 
02280                                         for (int32_t i = 0; i < nNymCount; ++i)
02281                                         {
02282                                             string strIndex = to_string(i);
02283                                             string strLoopNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_ID(i);
02284 
02285                                             if (OTAPI_Wrap::IsNym_RegisteredAtServer(strLoopNymID, strServerID))
02286                                             {
02287                                                 bFoundANym = true;
02288                                                 string strName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_Name(strLoopNymID);
02289                                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strIndex + ": " + strLoopNymID + " ---  " + strName + "\n");
02290                                             }
02291                                         }
02292 
02293                                         if (!bFoundANym)
02294                                         {
02295                                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unfortunately, didn't find ANY Nyms registered at server: " + strServerID + "\n");
02296                                             return -1;
02297                                         }
02298 
02299                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Select a Nym by index: ");
02300 
02301                                         string strNymIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02302 
02303                                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strNymIndex))
02304                                         {
02305                                             return -1;
02306                                         }
02307 
02308                                         int32_t nNymIndex = to_int(strNymIndex);
02309                                         if (!VerifyIntVal(nNymIndex) || (nNymIndex < 0))
02310                                         {
02311                                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Bad index: " + strNymIndex + "\n");
02312                                             return -1;
02313                                         }
02314 
02315                                         string strTempNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_ID(nNymIndex);
02316 
02317                                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTempNymID))
02318                                         {
02319                                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error retrieving NymID from wallet at index: " + strNymIndex + "\n");
02320                                             return -1;
02321                                         }
02322 
02323                                         if (OTAPI_Wrap::IsNym_RegisteredAtServer(strTempNymID, strServerID))
02324                                         {
02325                                             strNymID = strTempNymID;
02326                                             strFoundMyNymID = strTempNymID;
02327                                             break;
02328                                         }
02329                                         else
02330                                         {
02331                                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, that Nym isn't registered at server: " + strServerID + "\nPlease choose another Nym\n");
02332                                         }
02333                                     } // while (selecting a Nym)
02334                                 } // Determining NymID
02335                             } // else instrument was pasted in.
02336 
02337 
02338                             // By this point, we definitely have strServerID and strNymID
02339 
02340                             // Loop through all the accounts for that Server/Nym, display them, allow the user to
02341                             // choose one and then store it in a list somewhere for the actual confirmation.
02342                             // (Which we will do only after ALL accounts have been selected.) We will also make sure
02343                             // to prevent from selecting an account that already appears on that list.
02344                             //
02345                             // Also, when we actually add an Acct ID to the list, we need to decrement nCurrentAcctCount,
02346                             // so that we are finished once all the accounts from the smart contract template have had
02347                             // actual acct IDs selected for each.
02348                             //
02349                             string strTemplateAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctAssetID(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
02350                             bool bFoundTemplateAssetID = VerifyStringVal(strTemplateAssetID);
02351 
02352                             bool bFoundAccounts = false;
02353                             int32_t nCountAcctsWallet = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountCount();
02354 
02355                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nAccounts by index (filtered by serverID and nymID):\n\n");
02356 
02357                             for (int32_t i = 0; i < nCountAcctsWallet; ++i)
02358                             {
02359                                 string strWalletAcctID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ID(i);
02360 
02361                                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strWalletAcctID))
02362                                 {
02363                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error reading account ID based on index: " + to_string(i) + "\n");
02364                                     return -1;
02365                                 }
02366 
02367                                 string strAcctServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strWalletAcctID);
02368                                 string strAcctNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strWalletAcctID);
02369                                 string strAcctAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strWalletAcctID);
02370 
02371                                 bool bAlreadyOnTheMap = false;
02372 
02373 
02374                                 for (map<string, string>::iterator x = map_ID.begin(); x != map_ID.end(); x++)
02375                                 {
02376                                     if (x->second == strWalletAcctID) { bAlreadyOnTheMap = true; }
02377                                 }
02378 
02379                                 if ((strServerID == strAcctServerID) && (strNymID == strAcctNymID))
02380                                 {
02381                                     // If the smart contract doesn't specify the asset type ID of the account, or if
02382                                     // it DOES specify, AND they match, then it's a viable choice. Display it.
02383                                     //
02384                                     if (!bFoundTemplateAssetID || (bFoundTemplateAssetID && (strTemplateAssetID == strAcctAssetID)))
02385                                     {
02386 
02387                                         if (!bAlreadyOnTheMap)  // DO NOT display any accounts that have already been selected! (Search the temp map where we've been stashing them.)
02388                                         {
02389                                             bFoundAccounts = true;
02390                                             string strAccountName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_Name(strWalletAcctID);
02391                                             if (!VerifyStringVal(strAccountName)) { strAccountName = ""; }
02392                                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, to_string(i) + " : " + strWalletAcctID + " (" + strAccountName + ")\n");
02393                                         }
02394                                     }
02395                                 }
02396                             } // for
02397 
02398                             if (!bFoundAccounts)
02399                             {
02400                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unfortunately, looks like there are no accounts matching the specified Nym (" + strNymID + ") and Server (" + strServerID + ")\nTry:  opentxs newacct --mynym " + strNymID + " --server " + strServerID + " \n");
02401                                 return -1;
02402                             }
02403 
02404                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nChoose an account by index (for '" + strAcctName + "'): ");
02405 
02406                             string strSelectedAcctIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02407 
02408                             if (!VerifyStringVal(strSelectedAcctIndex))
02409                             {
02410                                 return -1;
02411                             }
02412 
02413                             int32_t nSelectedAcctIndex = to_int(strSelectedAcctIndex);
02414 
02415                             if (!VerifyIntVal(nSelectedAcctIndex) || (nSelectedAcctIndex < 0) || (nSelectedAcctIndex >= nCountAcctsWallet))
02416                             {
02417                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Bad index: " + strSelectedAcctIndex + "\n");
02418                                 return -1;
02419                             }
02420 
02421                             string strWalletAcctID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ID(nSelectedAcctIndex);
02422 
02423                             if (!VerifyStringVal(strWalletAcctID))
02424                             {
02425                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error reading account ID based on index: " + to_string(nSelectedAcctIndex) + "\n");
02426                                 return -1;
02427                             }
02428 
02429                             string strAcctServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strWalletAcctID);
02430                             string strAcctNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strWalletAcctID);
02431                             string strAcctAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strWalletAcctID);
02432 
02433                             if ((strServerID == strAcctServerID) && (strNymID == strAcctNymID))
02434                             {
02435                                 // If the smart contract doesn't specify the asset type ID of the account, or if
02436                                 // it DOES specify, AND they match, then it's a viable choice. Allow it.
02437                                 //
02438                                 if (!bFoundTemplateAssetID || (bFoundTemplateAssetID && (strTemplateAssetID == strAcctAssetID)))
02439                                 {
02440 
02441                                     bool bAlreadyOnIt = false;
02442 
02443                                     for (map<string, string>::iterator x = map_ID.begin(); x != map_ID.end(); x++)
02444                                     {
02445                                         if (x->second == strWalletAcctID) { bAlreadyOnIt = true; }
02446                                     }
02447 
02448                                     if (bAlreadyOnIt)  // make sure it's not already on the map of selected accounts.
02449                                     {
02450                                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Sorry, you already selected this account. Choose another.\n");
02451                                     }
02452                                     else
02453                                     {
02454                                         // strWalletAcctID has been selected for strPartyName's account, strAcctName.
02455                                         // Add these to a map or whatever, to save them until this loop is complete.
02456                                         //
02457 
02458                                         string strAgentName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctAgentName(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
02459 
02460                                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAgentName))
02461                                         {
02462                                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
02463 
02464                                             if (stat_partyagents(strSmartContract, strPartyName, 3))
02465                                             {
02466                                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n (This choice is arbitrary, but you must pick one.)\nEnter the index for an agent, to have authority over that account: ");
02467 
02468                                                 string strAgentIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02469 
02470                                                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strAgentIndex))
02471                                                 {
02472                                                     return -1;
02473                                                 }
02474 
02475                                                 int32_t nAgentIndex = to_int(strAgentIndex);
02476 
02477                                                 if (!VerifyIntVal(nAgentIndex) || (nAgentIndex < 0))
02478                                                 {
02479                                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Bad Index: " + strAgentIndex + "\n");
02480                                                     return -1;
02481                                                 }
02482 
02483                                                 strAgentName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAgentNameByIndex(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nAgentIndex);
02484 
02485                                                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strAgentName))
02486                                                 {
02487                                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Unable to retrieve agent name at index " + strAgentIndex + " for Party: " + strPartyName + "\n");
02488                                                     return -1;
02489                                                 }
02490 
02491                                             }
02492                                             else
02493                                             {
02494                                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed finding the agent's name for party: " + strPartyName + " Account: " + strAcctName + " \n And then failed finding any agents on this smart contract at ALL.\n");
02495                                                 return -1;
02496                                             }
02497                                         }
02498 
02499                                         map_ID[strAcctName] = strWalletAcctID;
02500                                         map_agent[strAcctName] = strAgentName;
02501 
02502                                         nCurrentAcctCount -= 1;
02503 
02504                                     }
02505                                 }
02506                             }
02507                         } // else the account is NOT already confirmed (so we can confirm it.)
02508                     } // while (nCurrentAcctCount > 0)
02509 
02510 
02511                     for (map<string, string>::iterator x = map_ID.begin(); x != map_ID.end(); x++)
02512                     {
02513                         int32_t numCountNeeded = OTAPI_Wrap::SmartContract_CountNumsNeeded(strSmartContract, map_agent[x->first]) + 1;
02514 
02515                         if (!MadeEasy::insure_enough_nums(numCountNeeded, strServerID, strNymID)) // Someday there might be a different NymID based on which agent it is...
02516                         {
02517                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n** Sorry -- Nym (" + strNymID + ") doesn't have enough transaction numbers to confirm this smart contract. Come back when you have more.\n");
02518                             return -1;
02519                         }
02520                     }
02521 
02522                     // CONFIRM THE ACCOUNTS HERE
02523                     //
02524                     // By this point we KNOW we have enough transaction numbers
02525                     //
02526                     // Note: Any failure below this point needs to harvest back ALL transaction numbers.
02527                     // Because we haven't even TRIED to activate it, therefore ALL numbers on the contract
02528                     // are still good (even the opening number.)
02529                     //
02530                     // Whereas after a failed activation, we'd need to harvest only the closing numbers, and
02531                     // not the opening numbers. But in here, this is confirmation, not activation.
02532                     //
02533                     for (map<string, string>::iterator x = map_ID.begin(); x != map_ID.end(); x++)
02534                     {
02535                         // Here we check to see if MyAcct exists -- if so we compare it to the current acctID
02536                         // and if they match, we set strMyAcctID. Later on, if/when activating, we can just use
02537                         // strMyAcctID to activate. (Otherwise we will have to pick one from the confirmed accounts.)
02538                         //
02539                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyAcctID) && VerifyExists("MyAcct", false) && (MyAcct == x->second))
02540                         {
02541                             strMyAcctID = MyAcct; // Now we can use it later, for activation.
02542                             strMyAcctAgentName = map_agent[x->first];
02543                         }
02544 
02545                         // CONFIRM A THEORETICAL ACCT BY GIVING IT A REAL ACCT ID.
02546                         string strTempSmart = OTAPI_Wrap::SmartContract_ConfirmAccount(strSmartContract, strNymID, strPartyName,
02547 
02548                             x->first,             // Acct name.
02549                             map_agent[x->first], // The agent name for this asset account.
02550                             x->second);           // AcctID for the asset account. (For acct_name).
02551                         if (VerifyStringVal(strTempSmart))
02552                         {
02553                             strSmartContract = strTempSmart;
02554                         }
02555                         else
02556                         {
02557                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure while calling OT_API_SmartContract_ConfirmAccount. Acct Name: " + x->first + "  Agent Name: " + map_agent[x->first] + "  Acct ID: " + x->second + " \n");
02558                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02559                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02560                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02561                             return -1;
02562                         }
02563                     }
02564 
02565                 } // if (nCurrentAcctCount > 0)
02566 
02567                 // CONFIRM THE NYM HERE.
02568                 //
02569                 // NOTE: confirming the Party will drop a copy into the outpayments box.
02570                 // After that, if you are not the last party, you will send it on to
02571                 // the next party. This will also drop it into the outpayments box, but
02572                 // when that happens, it will automatically first remove the prior
02573                 // one that had been dropped. This way there is only one copy in
02574                 // the outbox, not two.
02575                 //
02576                 // If you ARE the last party, then we will activate it here, and
02577                 // when the server reply is received, it will be removed from the
02578                 // outbox and moved to the record box.
02579                 //
02580                 // Also, whether it succeeds or fails activation, either way, a notice
02581                 // will be dropped to all the parties, informing them of this fact.
02582                 // The activating party will ignore this, since he already processes
02583                 // the server reply directly when he receives it. (And there's a copy of
02584                 // that in his nymbox to make SURE he receives it, so he DEFINITELY
02585                 // received it already.)
02586                 // But each of the other parties will then move the notice from their
02587                 // outbox to their record box. (And harvest the transaction numbers
02588                 // accordingly.)
02589                 // A party can "reject" a smart contract by activating it without signing
02590                 // it. That way it will fail activation, and all the other parties will get
02591                 // the failure notice, and harvest their numbers back as appropriate. But if
02592                 // he is "rude" and simply discards the contract WITHOUT rejecting it, then
02593                 // they will never get the failure notice. However, they will also never
02594                 // get the activation notice, since it was never activated in that case, and
02595                 // thus they will be safe to harvest their numbers back when it expires.
02596                 // (A well-designed wallet will do this automatically.)
02597                 //
02598 
02599                 string strTempSmart = OTAPI_Wrap::SmartContract_ConfirmParty(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strNymID);
02600 
02601                 if (VerifyStringVal(strTempSmart))
02602                 {
02603                     strSmartContract = strTempSmart;
02604                 }
02605                 else
02606                 {
02607                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure while calling OT_API_SmartContract_ConfirmParty. Party Name: " + strPartyName + "  NymID: " + strNymID + "\n");
02608                     int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02609                         false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02610                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02611                     return -1;
02612                 }
02613 
02614                 // If you are the last party to sign, then ACTIVATE THE SMART CONTRACT.
02615 
02616                 // NOTE: No matter which party you are (perhaps you are the middle one), when you confirm
02617                 // the contract, you will send it on to the NEXT UNCONFIRMED ONE. This means you don't know
02618                 // which party it will be, since all the unconfirmed parties have no NymID (yet.) Rather,
02619                 // it's YOUR problem to provide the NymID you're sending the contract on to. And then it's HIS
02620                 // problem to decide which party he will sign on as. (Unless you are the LAST PARTY to confirm,
02621                 // in which case YOU are the activator.)
02622                 //
02623                 if (OTAPI_Wrap::Smart_AreAllPartiesConfirmed(strSmartContract))
02624                 {
02625                     // The logic: If all the parties are confirmed, then just activate the thing. I must be the activator.
02626                     // We need the ACCT_ID that we're using to activate it with, and we need the AGENT NAME for that account.
02627                     // strMyAcctID and strMyAcctAgentName might ALREADY be set -- otherwise we need to set those.
02628                     //
02629                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyAcctID) || !VerifyStringVal(strMyAcctAgentName)) // Both will be valid or invalid, if one is. (But we check anyway.)
02630                     {
02631                         // We can't just use ANY account ID, but we must use one that is listed as one of the accounts for
02632                         // the party activating the contract. So we have to display those accounts, and the user must choose
02633                         // which one it's going to be. From there we can get the account ID and the agent name and call
02634                         // activate_smart_contract.
02635                         //
02636                         stat_partyaccounts(strSmartContract, strPartyName, 2); //nDepth=2
02637 
02638                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Enter the index for the account you'll use to ACTIVATE the smart contract: ");
02639 
02640                         string strAcctIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02641 
02642                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctIndex))
02643                         {
02644                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02645                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02646                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02647                             return -1;
02648                         }
02649 
02650                         int32_t nAcctIndex = to_int(strAcctIndex);
02651 
02652                         if (!VerifyIntVal(nAcctIndex) || (nAcctIndex < 0) || (nAcctIndex >= nAccountCount))
02653                         {
02654                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Bad Index: " + strAcctIndex + " (Acceptable values are 0 through " + to_string(nAccountCount - 1) + ")\n");
02655                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02656                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02657                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02658                             return -1;
02659                         }
02660 
02661                         string strAcctName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctNameByIndex(strSmartContract, strPartyName, nAcctIndex);
02662 
02663                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctName))
02664                         {
02665                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error: Unable to retrieve account name at index " + strAcctIndex + " for Party: " + strPartyName + "\n");
02666                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02667                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02668                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02669                             return -1;
02670                         }
02671 
02672                         string strAcctID = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctID(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
02673 
02674                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctID))
02675                         {
02676                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange: the account at index " + strAcctIndex + " is not yet confirmed with any account ID. (Failure.)\n");
02677                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02678                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02679                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02680                             return -1;
02681                         }
02682                         strMyAcctID = strAcctID; // <============
02683 
02684                         string strAcctAgentName = OTAPI_Wrap::Party_GetAcctAgentName(strSmartContract, strPartyName, strAcctName);
02685 
02686                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctAgentName))
02687                         {
02688                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Strange: the account named: '" + strAcctName + "' doesn't seem to have any agent confirmed to it. (Failure.)\n");
02689                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02690                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02691                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02692                             return -1;
02693                         }
02694                         strMyAcctAgentName = strAcctAgentName;  // <============
02695 
02696                     } // strMyAcctID wasn't set already, so the above block sets it.
02697 
02698                     // NOTE: Above, you see us harvesting the transaction numbers if any error occurs, since we haven't even tried
02699                     // to send the instrument yet.
02700                     //
02701                     // But in this next section, we only want to do that if the transaction was definitely not processed by the server.
02702                     // (Whether that processing succeeded or failed being a separate question.)
02703                     //
02704                     string strResponse = MadeEasy::activate_smart_contract(strServerID, strNymID, strMyAcctID, strMyAcctAgentName, strSmartContract);
02705                     string strAttempt = "activate_smart_contract";
02706                     // ***************************************************************
02707                     int32_t nMessageSuccess = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
02708 
02709                     if (-1 == nMessageSuccess)
02710                     {
02711                         // In this case, the server never even SAW the transaction, because its enveloping message already
02712                         // failed before we even got that far. So we can harvest, as though it was never attempted...
02713                         //
02714                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Message error: " + strAttempt + ".\n");
02715                         int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02716                             false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02717                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02718                         return -1;
02719                     }
02720                     else if (0 == nMessageSuccess)
02721                     {
02722                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server reply (" + strAttempt + "): Message failure.\n");
02723                         int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02724                             false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02725                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02726                         return 0;
02727                     }
02728                     // (else 1: message was processed successfully -- though not necessarily the transaction inside it.)
02729 
02730                     // BELOW THIS POINT, the transaction has definitely processed. It may have succeeded or failed,
02731                     // but either way, we don't need to harvest any numbers, since OT will internally handle those
02732                     // when it processes the server's reply to the transaction attempt.
02733                     //
02734                     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServerID, strNymID, strMyAcctID, strAttempt, strResponse);
02735 
02736                     if (1 == nInterpretReply) // Success.
02737                     {
02738                         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
02739                         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
02740                         //
02741                         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServerID, strNymID, strMyAcctID, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
02742 
02743                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nServer response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS activating smart contract!\n");
02744                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
02745                     }
02746                     //
02747                     // Return status to caller.
02748                     //
02749                     return nInterpretReply;
02750                 } // if (all parties are confirmed)
02751                 // ***************************************************************
02752                 else // SEND INSTRUMENT TO NEXT PARTY.
02753                 {
02754                     // But if all the parties are NOT confirmed, then we need to send it to the next guy. In that case:
02755                     // If HisNym is provided, and it's different than strNymID, then use it. He's the next receipient.
02756                     // If HisNym is NOT provided, then display the list of NymIDs, and allow the user to paste one. We can
02757                     // probably select him based on abbreviated ID or Name as well (I think there's an API call for that...)
02758                     //
02759                     string strHisNymID = "";
02760 
02761                     if (VerifyExists("HisNym", false))
02762                     {
02763                         strHisNymID = HisNym;
02764                     }
02765 
02766                     // If strHisNymID doesn't exist, or it's the same as strNymID, then ask the user to select
02767                     // a NymID for the recipient.
02768                     //
02769                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strHisNymID) || (strHisNymID == strNymID))
02770                     {
02771                         OT_Command::main_stat_nyms(); // Display the NymIDs
02772 
02773                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nOnce you confirm this contract, then we need to send it on to the\nnext party so he can confirm it, too.\n\nPlease PASTE a recipient Nym ID (the next party): ");
02774                         string strRecipientNymID = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02775                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strRecipientNymID))
02776                         {
02777                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02778                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02779                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02780                             return -1;
02781                         }
02782 
02783                         string strHisNymParam = strRecipientNymID;
02784 
02785                         // IF we are able to resolve the HisNymId from a partial, then we
02786                         // replace the partial with the full version.
02787                         // (Otherwise we assume it's already a full ID and we don't mess with it.)
02788                         //
02789                         string strHisNymFromPartial = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetNymIDFromPartial(strRecipientNymID);
02790 
02791                         if (VerifyStringVal(strHisNymFromPartial))
02792                         {
02793                             strHisNymParam = strHisNymFromPartial;
02794                         }
02795 
02796                         strHisNymID = strHisNymParam;
02797 
02798                         if (strHisNymID == strNymID)
02799                         {
02800                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nSorry, but YOU cannot simultaneously be the SENDER _and_ the RECIPIENT. Choose another nym for one or the other.\n");
02801                             int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02802                                 false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02803                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02804                             return -1;
02805                         }
02806                     }
02807 
02808                     // Send it to the next user!
02809                     //
02810                     string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_payment(strServerID, strNymID, strHisNymID, strSmartContract);
02811 
02812                     int32_t nMessageSuccess = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
02813 
02814                     if (!VerifyIntVal(nMessageSuccess) || (1 != nMessageSuccess))
02815                     {
02816                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nFor whatever reason, our attempt to send the instrument on to the next user has failed.\n");
02817                         int32_t nHarvested = OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strSmartContract, strNymID,
02818                             false, false, false, false, false); // NOTE: all the 'false's here are unused in this case. (Since we're passing a smart contract, instead of a message, it means we are harvesting before the message even had a CHANCE to get sent. Meaning we didn't even TRY to send it, and we're harvesting ALL numbers. Period.)
02819                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": OT_API_Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers: " + to_string(nHarvested) + "\n");
02820                     }
02821                     else // Success. (Remove the payment instrument we just successfully sent, from our payments inbox.)
02822                     {
02823                         // In the case of smart contracts, it might be sent on to a chain of 2 or 3 users,
02824                         // before finally being activated by the last one in the chain. All of the users in
02825                         // the chain (except the first one) will thus have a copy of the smart contract in
02826                         // their payments inbox AND outbox.
02827                         //
02828                         // But once the smart contract has successfully been sent on to the next user, and
02829                         // thus a copy of it is in my outbox already, then there is definitely no reason for
02830                         // a copy of it to stay in my inbox as well. Might as well remove that copy.
02831                         //
02832                         // We can't really expect to remove the payments inbox copy inside OT itself, when we
02833                         // receive the server's atSendUserInstrument reply message, without opening up the
02834                         // (encrypted) contents. (Although that would actually be ideal, since it would cover
02835                         // all cases included dropped messages...) But we CAN easily remove it RIGHT HERE.
02836                         // Perhaps in the future I WILL move this code to the atSendUserInstrument reply processing,
02837                         // but that will require it to be encrypted to my own key as well as the recipient's,
02838                         // which we already do for sending cash, but which we up until now have not done for
02839                         // the other instruments. So perhaps we'll start doing that sometime in the future, and
02840                         // then move this code.
02841                         //
02842                         // In the meantime, this is good enough.
02843                         //
02844 
02845                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success sending the agreement on to the next party.\n");
02846 
02847                         if (-1 != nIndex) // If the instrument was in the payments inbox (versus just being pasted in.)
02848                         {
02849                             OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(strServerID, strNymID, true, // true == payments inbox. false == outpayments box.
02850                                 nIndex, false); //bSaveCopy = false (it's already in my payments outbox, no need to save inbox copy too)
02851                         }
02852                     }
02853                     return nMessageSuccess;
02854 
02855                 }
02856             }
02857         }
02858     } // ---------------------------------------
02859     // else there aren't any unconfirmed parties, and it already displayed an error message related to that.
02860 
02861     return -1;
02862 }
02863 
02864
