02865 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_confirm() // smart contract and payment plan
02866 {
02867     int32_t nIndex = -1;
02868 
02869     if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
02870     {
02871         // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
02872         //                                  const std::string str_key)
02873         //
02874         // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
02875         // EXAMPLE:  --args "index 1"
02876         //
02877         string strIndex = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "index"); // any integer value
02878 
02879         if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
02880         {
02881             int32_t nTempIndex = to_int(strIndex);
02882 
02883             if (VerifyIntVal(nTempIndex) && (nTempIndex >= 0))
02884             {
02885                 nIndex = nTempIndex;
02886             }
02887         }
02888     }
02889     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr
02890     // ***************************************************************
02891     string strInstrument = "";
02892 
02893     if (-1 == nIndex) // No index provided, so they need to paste the smart contract...
02894     {
02895         if (VerifyExists("Server", false) && VerifyExists("MyNym", false))
02896         {
02897             OT_Command::main_show_payments_inbox();
02898 
02899             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "If this is in reference to a smart contract or payment plan in your payments\ninbox, please enter the index to confirm it (or just hit enter, to paste a contract): ");
02900             string strIndex = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
02901 
02902             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
02903             {
02904                 int32_t nTempIndex = to_int(strIndex);
02905 
02906                 if (VerifyIntVal(nTempIndex) && (nTempIndex >= 0))
02907                 {
02908                     nIndex = nTempIndex;
02909 
02910                     strInstrument = MadeEasy::get_payment_instrument(Server, MyNym, nIndex, "");
02911 
02912                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
02913                     {
02914                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Unable to get instrument from payments inbox, based on index: " + to_string(nIndex) + ".\n");
02915                         return -1;
02916                     }
02917                 }
02918                 else
02919                 {
02920                     return -1;
02921                 }
02922             }
02923             else
02924             {
02925                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nPlease paste the smart contract or payment plan,\nfollowed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
02926 
02927                 strInstrument = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
02928 
02929                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
02930                 {
02931                     return -1;
02932                 }
02933             }
02934         }
02935         else
02936         {
02937             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nPlease paste the smart contract or payment plan,\nfollowed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
02938 
02939             strInstrument = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
02940 
02941             if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
02942             {
02943                 return -1;
02944             }
02945         }
02946     }
02947 
02948     else // nIndex is NOT -1 (an index was specified.)
02949     {
02950         if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
02951         {
02952             strInstrument = MadeEasy::get_payment_instrument(Server, MyNym, nIndex, "");
02953 
02954             if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
02955             {
02956                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Unable to get instrument from payments inbox, based on index: " + to_string(nIndex) + ".\n");
02957                 return -1;
02958             }
02959         }
02960         else
02961         {
02962             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Since you specified an index, make sure to also specify --server and --mynym,\nso you use that index on the right payments inbox.\n");
02963             return -1; // VerifyExists logs already.
02964         }
02965     }
02966 
02967     string strInstrumentType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strInstrument);
02968 
02969     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrumentType))
02970     {
02971         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine instrument type. Expected SMART CONTRACT or PAYMENT PLAN.\n");
02972         return -1;
02973     }
02974 
02975     // Is the instrument yet valid, or is it expired?
02976     // Handle both those cases here...
02977     time64_t tFrom = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidFrom(strInstrument);
02978     time64_t tTo = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidTo(strInstrument);
02979     time64_t tTime = OTAPI_Wrap::GetTime();
02980 
02981     if (tTime < tFrom)
02982     {
02983         if (-1 == nIndex) { OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument is not yet within its valid date range. (Skipping.)\n"); }
02984         else { OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument at index " + to_string(nIndex) + " is not yet within its valid date range. (Skipping.)\n"); }
02985         return 0;
02986     }
02987     if ((tTo > OT_TIME_ZERO) && (tTime > tTo))
02988     {
02989         if (-1 == nIndex)
02990         {
02991             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument is expired. (Harvesting the transaction numbers.)\n");
02992             if (OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strInstrument, MyNym, false, false, false, false, false))
02993             {
02994                 return 0;
02995             }
02996         }
02997         else // there's an index.
02998         {
02999             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument at index " + to_string(nIndex) + " is expired. (Moving it to the record box.)\n");
03000 
03001             // Since this instrument is expired, remove it from the payments inbox, and move to record box.
03002 
03003 
03004             // Note: this harvests.
03005             if (OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(Server, MyNym, true, // bIsInbox=true
03006                 nIndex, true)) // bSaveCopy=true. (Will be saved in expired box, since it's expired.)
03007             {
03008                 return 0;
03009             }
03010         } // there's an index.
03011         return -1;
03012     }
03013 
03014     if ("SMARTCONTRACT" == strInstrumentType)
03015     {
03016         // Success! (It's a smart contract for sure.)
03017         //
03018         // BY this point, we know that strInstrument contains a string.
03019         // We also know that it came from the payments inbox at nIndex, or
03020         // that it was pasted in and nIndex is -1. We also know that if nIndex
03021         // is NOT -1, that means Server and MyNym are set, because that's the
03022         // box we must have gotten the smart contract out of (because someone
03023         // else sent it to us for confirmation...)
03024         //
03025         return details_confirm_smart_contract(strInstrument, nIndex);
03026 
03027     }
03028     else if ("PAYMENT PLAN" == strInstrumentType)
03029     {
03030         // Success! (It's a payment plan for sure.)
03031         //
03032         return details_confirm_plan(strInstrument, nIndex);
03033     }
03034     else  // CHEQUE VOUCHER INVOICE PURSE
03035     {
03036         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nFailure: Instrument is not a smart contract or payment plan, but rather a: " + strInstrumentType + "\n");
03037         return -1;
03038     }
03039 
03040     return -1;
03041 }
03042 
03043 
03044 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_encode()
03045 {
03046     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter multiple lines of input to be encoded, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03047 
03048     // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
03049     // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
03050     // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
03051     // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
03052 
03053     string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03054 
03055     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n--------------------------------------\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
03056 
03057     string strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::Encode(strInput, true);  // bLineBreaks=true
03058 
03059     // stderr
03060     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------- \n Encoded:\n\n");
03061 
03062     // stdout
03063     if (VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
03064     {
03065         print(strOutput);
03066         // stderr
03067         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03068         return 1;
03069     }
03070 
03071     // stderr
03072     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03073 
03074     return -1;
03075 }
03076 
03077 
03078 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_decode()
03079 {
03080     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter multiple lines of OT-armored text to be decoded, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03081 
03082     // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
03083     // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
03084     // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
03085     // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
03086 
03087     string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03088 
03089     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n--------------------------------------\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
03090 
03091     string strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::Decode(strInput, true);  // bLineBreaks=true
03092 
03093     // stderr
03094     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "--------------------------------------\n Decoded:\n\n");
03095 
03096     // stdout
03097     if (VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
03098     {
03099         print(strOutput);
03100         // stderr
03101         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03102         return 1;
03103     }
03104 
03105     // stderr
03106     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03107 
03108     return -1;
03109 }
03110 
03111 
03112 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_encrypt()
03113 {
03114     if (VerifyExists("HisNym"))
03115     {
03116 
03117         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter multiple lines of input to be encrypted,\nfollowed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03118 
03119         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
03120         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
03121         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
03122         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
03123 
03124         string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03125 
03126         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n--------------------------------------\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
03127 
03128         string strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::Encrypt(HisNym, strInput);  // bLineBreaks=true
03129 
03130         // stdout
03131         if (VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
03132         {
03133             // stderr
03134             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------- \n Encrypted:\n\n");
03135 
03136             print(strOutput);
03137             // stderr
03138             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03139             return 1;
03140         }
03141     }
03142 
03143     // "return value"
03144     return -1;
03145 }
03146 
03147 
03148 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_decrypt()
03149 {
03150     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
03151     {
03152 
03153         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter multiple lines of input to be decrypted, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03154 
03155         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
03156         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
03157         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
03158         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
03159 
03160         string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03161 
03162         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n--------------------------------------\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
03163 
03164         string strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::Decrypt(MyNym, strInput);  // bLineBreaks=true
03165 
03166         // stdout
03167         if (VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
03168         {
03169             // stderr
03170             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------- \n Decrypted:\n\n");
03171 
03172             print(strOutput);
03173             // stderr
03174             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03175             return 1;
03176         }
03177     }
03178 
03179     // "return value"
03180     return -1;
03181 }
03182 
03183 
03184 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_password_encrypt()
03185 {
03186     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter a symmetric key, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03187 
03188     // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
03189     // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
03190     // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
03191     // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
03192 
03193     string strKey = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03194 
03195     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the plaintext, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03196 
03197     string strPlaintext = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03198 
03199     if (VerifyStringVal(strKey) && VerifyStringVal(strPlaintext))
03200     {
03201         string strCiphertext = OTAPI_Wrap::SymmetricEncrypt(strKey, strPlaintext);
03202 
03203         // stdout
03204         if (VerifyStringVal(strCiphertext))
03205         {
03206             // stderr
03207             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------- \n strCiphertext:\n\n");
03208 
03209             print(strCiphertext);
03210             // stderr
03211             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03212             return 1;
03213         }
03214     }
03215 
03216     // "return value"
03217     return -1;
03218 }
03219 
03220 
03221 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_password_decrypt()
03222 {
03223     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter a symmetric key, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03224 
03225     // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
03226     // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
03227     // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
03228     // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
03229 
03230     string strKey = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03231 
03232     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the symmetrically-encrypted ciphertext, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03233 
03234     string strCiphertext = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03235 
03236     if (VerifyStringVal(strKey) && VerifyStringVal(strCiphertext))
03237     {
03238         string strPlaintext = OTAPI_Wrap::SymmetricDecrypt(strKey, strCiphertext);
03239 
03240         // stdout
03241         if (VerifyStringVal(strPlaintext))
03242         {
03243             // stderr
03244             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------- \n Plaintext:\n\n");
03245 
03246             print(strPlaintext);
03247             // stderr
03248             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
03249             return 1;
03250         }
03251     }
03252 
03253     // "return value"
03254     return -1;
03255 }
03256 
03257 
03258 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::details_import_nym(const string & strNymImportFile, string & strOutNymID)
03259 {
03260     strOutNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ImportNym(strNymImportFile);
03261 
03262     bool bVerified = VerifyStringVal(strOutNymID);
03263 
03264     return bVerified;
03265 }
03266 
03267 
03268 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_import_nym()
03269 {
03270     string strUsage = "\n\n USAGE: importnym\n";
03271 
03272     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03273 
03274 
03275     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Paste your exported Nym here (for import), followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line: \n");
03276 
03277     string strNymFile = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03278 
03279     if (!VerifyStringVal(strNymFile))
03280     {
03281         return -1;
03282     }
03283 
03284     string strOutNymID;
03285     bool bDone = details_import_nym(strNymFile, strOutNymID);
03286 
03287     if (!bDone)
03288     {
03289         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILED trying to import Nym.\n");
03290         return -1;
03291     }
03292     else
03293     {
03294         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS importing Nym: " + strOutNymID + "\n\n");
03295         return 1;
03296     }
03297 
03298     return -1;
03299 }
03300 
03301 
03302 OT_COMMANDS_OT string OT_Command::details_export_nym(const string & strNymID)
03303 {
03304     string strExportedNym = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ExportNym(strNymID);
03305 
03306     return strExportedNym;
03307 }
03308 
03309 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_export_nym()
03310 {
03311     string strUsage = "\n\n USAGE: exportnym --mynym NYM_ID\n";
03312 
03313     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03314 
03315     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
03316     {
03317         string strExportedNym = details_export_nym(MyNym);
03318 
03319         if (!VerifyStringVal(strExportedNym))
03320         {
03321             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILED trying to export Nym: " + MyNym + "\n");
03322             return -1;
03323         }
03324         else
03325         {
03326             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS exporting Nym: " + MyNym + "\n\n"); //stderr
03327             print(strExportedNym); // stdout
03328             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); //stderr
03329             return 1;
03330         }
03331     }
03332 
03333     return -1;
03334 }
03335 
03336 
03337 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_change_passphrase()
03338 {
03339     if (OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ChangePassphrase())
03340     {
03341         return 1;
03342     }
03343 
03344     return -1;
03345 }
03346 
03347 
03348 //
03349 // SEND TRANSFER (From one asset account to another.)
03350 //
03351 
03352 
03353 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_send_transfer(const string & strMyAcctID, const string & strHisAcctID, const string & strAmount, const string & strNote)
03354 {
03355     // Look up the NymID based on strMyAcctID
03356     //
03357     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
03358 
03359     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
03360     {
03361         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID (for sender) based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
03362         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
03363         return -1;
03364     }
03365     if (VerifyExists("MyNym", false) && !(MyNym == strMyNymID))
03366     {
03367         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: MyNym was provided (" + MyNym + "), but didn't match the Nym who owns MyAcct. To override, use: --mynym " + strMyNymID + "\n\n");
03368         return -1;
03369     }
03370 
03371     // Look up the ServerID based on strMyAcctID
03372     //
03373     string strMyServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strMyAcctID);
03374 
03375     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyServerID))
03376     {
03377         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find ServerID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
03378         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Server based on the account.\n\n");
03379         return -1;
03380     }
03381     if (VerifyExists("Server", false) && !(Server == strMyServerID))
03382     {
03383         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Server was provided (" + Server + "), but didn't match the Server where MyAcct is based. To override, use: --server " + strMyServerID + "\n\n");
03384         return -1;
03385     }
03386 
03387     // NEXT, we get the Server based on HIS account.
03388     //
03389     // That way, we can make sure both accounts are on the same server, before
03390     // we go riding off into the sunset sending transfer requests to the server.
03391     //
03392     string strHisServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strHisAcctID);
03393 
03394     if (!VerifyStringVal(strHisServerID))
03395     {
03396         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "HisAcct is not in the wallet, so I'm assuming it's on the same server as MyAcct. (Proceeding.)\n");
03397 
03398         strHisServerID = strMyServerID;
03399     }
03400 
03401     if (!(strMyServerID == strHisServerID))
03402     {
03403         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: HisAcct is not on the same server as MyAcct (he's on " + strHisServerID + " but MyAcct is on " + strMyServerID + "). You must choose either a different sender account (using --myacct ACCT_ID) or a different recipient account (using --hisacct ACCT_ID)\n\n");
03404         return -1;
03405     }
03406     // ***************************************************************
03407 
03408     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcctID);
03409 
03410     // HERE, WE SEND THE TRANSFER REQUEST TO THE SERVER
03411     //
03412     int64_t lAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount);
03413     //  int64_t lAmount = to_long(strAmount)
03414     string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_transfer(strMyServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strHisAcctID, lAmount, strNote);
03415     string strAttempt = "send_transfer";
03416     /*
03417     int32_t notarizeTransfer(   const std::string SERVER_ID,
03418     const std::string USER_ID,
03419     const std::string ACCT_FROM,
03420     const std::string ACCT_TO,
03421     const std::string AMOUNT,
03422     const std::string NOTE);
03423     */
03424     // ***************************************************************
03425 
03426     // HERE, WE INTERPRET THE SERVER REPLY, WHETHER SUCCESS, FAIL, OR ERROR...
03427 
03428     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strMyServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strAttempt, strResponse);
03429 
03430     if (1 == nInterpretReply)
03431     {
03432         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
03433         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
03434         //
03435         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strMyServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
03436 
03437         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS sending transfer!\n");
03438         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
03439     }
03440 
03441     // ***************************************************************
03442     //
03443     // Return status to caller.
03444     //
03445     return nInterpretReply;
03446 }
03447 
03448 
03449 // HERE, WE GET ALL THE ARGUMENTS TOGETHER,
03450 // and then call the above function.
03451 //
03452 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_transfer()
03453 {
03454     string strUsage1 = concat("\n\n  USAGE: transfer --myacct YOUR_ASSET_ACCT --hisacct RECIPIENT_ASSET_ACCT\n\n",
03455         "Also NECESSARY: --args \"amount PUT_AMOUNT_HERE\"\n");
03456     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1,
03457         "And OPTIONALLY: --args \"memo \\\"Just a memo for the transfer.\\\"\"\n\n");
03458 
03459     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03460 
03461 
03462     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct") && VerifyExists("HisAcct"))
03463     {
03464         // strAmount and strNote...
03465         //
03466         string strAmount = "0"; // must be >= 1
03467         string strNote = ""; // can be blank
03468 
03469         string strDefaultAmount = "10"; // must be >= 1
03470         string strDefaultNote = "(blank memo field)"; // can be blank
03471 
03472         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
03473         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
03474         // at the command line.
03475         //
03476         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
03477         {
03478             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
03479             //                                  const std::string str_key)
03480             //
03481             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
03482             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 1"
03483             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 15 note \"Just a memo for the transfer.\""
03484             //
03485             string strNewAmount = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "amount"); // any integer value
03486             string strNewNote = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "memo");     // optional memo field
03487 
03488 
03489             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
03490             //
03491             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount))
03492             {
03493                 strAmount = strNewAmount;
03494             }
03495             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewNote))
03496             {
03497                 strNote = strNewNote;
03498             }
03499         }
03500 
03501 
03502         string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
03503 
03504         // If the transfer parameters aren't provided, then we
03505         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
03506         //
03507         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
03508             //      if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (to_int(strAmount) < 1))
03509         {
03510             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the amount[" + strDefaultAmount + "]: ");
03511             strAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
03512         }
03513         if (!VerifyStringVal(strNote))
03514         {
03515             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter a memo on a single line[" + strDefaultNote + "]: ");
03516             strNote = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
03517         }
03518 
03519         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
03520             //      if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (to_int(strAmount) < 1))
03521         {
03522             strAmount = strDefaultAmount;
03523         }
03524         if (!VerifyStringVal(strNote))
03525         {
03526             strNote = strDefaultNote;
03527         }
03528 
03529 
03530         return details_send_transfer(MyAcct, HisAcct, strAmount, strNote);
03531     }
03532 
03533     return -1;
03534 }
03535 
03536 
03537 // SET NAME!!
03538 
03539 
03540 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_edit_nym()
03541 {
03542     string strUsage = concat("\n\n USAGE: editnym --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n",
03543         "Also optionally:         --args \"label \\\"PUT LABEL HERE\\\"\"\n");
03544 
03545     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03546 
03547 
03548     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
03549     {
03550         string strLabel = "";
03551 
03552         string strDefaultLabel = "(blank label)"; // can be blank
03553 
03554         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
03555         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
03556         // at the command line.
03557         //
03558         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
03559         {
03560             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
03561             //                                  const std::string str_key)
03562             //
03563             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
03564             // EXAMPLE:  --args "label \"FT's test Nym\""
03565             //
03566             string strNewLabel = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "label");  // optional label field
03567 
03568             // Set the value based on the custom argument.
03569             //
03570             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLabel))
03571             {
03572                 strLabel = strNewLabel;
03573             }
03574         }
03575 
03576         // If the label isn't provided, then we ask the
03577         // user to supply it at the command line.
03578         //
03579         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03580         {
03581             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter MyNym's new label [" + strDefaultLabel + "]: ");
03582             strLabel = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
03583         }
03584 
03585         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03586         {
03587             strLabel = strDefaultLabel;
03588         }
03589 
03590 
03591         bool bSet = OTAPI_Wrap::SetNym_Name(MyNym, MyNym, strLabel);
03592 
03593         if (!bSet)
03594         {
03595             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILED trying to set MyNym's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03596             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyNym ID: " + MyNym + "\n\n");
03597             return -1;
03598         }
03599         else
03600         {
03601             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS setting MyNym's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03602             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyNym ID: " + MyNym + "\n\n");
03603             return 1;
03604         }
03605     }
03606 
03607     return -1;
03608 }
03609 
03610 
03611 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_edit_account()
03612 {
03613     string strUsage = concat("\n\n USAGE: editacct --myacct YOUR_ACCT_ID\n",
03614         "Also optionally:          --args \"label \\\"PUT LABEL HERE\\\"\"\n");
03615 
03616     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03617 
03618 
03619     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
03620     {
03621 
03622         // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
03623         //
03624         string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
03625 
03626         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
03627         {
03628             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
03629             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
03630             return -1;
03631         }
03632         if (VerifyExists("MyNym") && !(MyNym == strMyNymID))
03633         {
03634             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: MyNym was provided, but didn't match the Nym who owns MyAcct. To override, use: --mynym " + strMyNymID + "\n\n");
03635             return -1;
03636         }
03637         // ***************************************************************
03638         //
03639         string strLabel = "";
03640 
03641         string strDefaultLabel = "(blank label)"; // can be blank
03642 
03643         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
03644         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
03645         // at the command line.
03646         //
03647         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
03648         {
03649             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
03650             //                                  const std::string str_key)
03651             //
03652             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
03653             // EXAMPLE:  --args "label \"FT's issuer account\""
03654             //
03655             string strNewLabel = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "label");  // optional label field
03656 
03657             // Set the value based on the custom argument.
03658             //
03659             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLabel))
03660             {
03661                 strLabel = strNewLabel;
03662             }
03663         }
03664 
03665         // If the label isn't provided, then we ask the
03666         // user to supply it at the command line.
03667         //
03668         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03669         {
03670             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter MyAcct's new label [" + strDefaultLabel + "]: ");
03671             strLabel = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
03672         }
03673 
03674         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03675         {
03676             strLabel = strDefaultLabel;
03677         }
03678 
03679 
03680         bool bSet = OTAPI_Wrap::SetAccountWallet_Name(MyAcct, strMyNymID, strLabel);
03681 
03682         if (!bSet)
03683         {
03684             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILED trying to set MyAcct's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03685             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyAcct ID: " + MyAcct + "\n");
03686             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, " MyNym ID: " + strMyNymID + "\n\n");
03687             return -1;
03688         }
03689         else
03690         {
03691             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS setting MyAcct's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03692             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyAcct ID: " + MyAcct + "\n");
03693             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, " MyNym ID: " + strMyNymID + "\n\n");
03694             return 1;
03695         }
03696     }
03697 
03698     return -1;
03699 }
03700 
03701 
03702 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_edit_asset()
03703 {
03704     string strUsage = concat("\n\n USAGE: editasset --mypurse ASSET_TYPE_ID\n",
03705         "Also optionally:           --args \"label \\\"PUT LABEL HERE\\\"\"\n");
03706 
03707     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03708 
03709 
03710     if (VerifyExists("MyPurse"))
03711     {
03712         string strLabel = "";
03713 
03714         string strDefaultLabel = "(blank label)"; // can be blank
03715 
03716         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
03717         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
03718         // at the command line.
03719         //
03720         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
03721         {
03722             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
03723             //                                  const std::string str_key)
03724             //
03725             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
03726             // EXAMPLE:  --args "label \"Silver Grams\""
03727             //
03728             string strNewLabel = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "label");  // optional label field
03729 
03730             // Set the value based on the custom argument.
03731             //
03732             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLabel))
03733             {
03734                 strLabel = strNewLabel;
03735             }
03736         }
03737 
03738         // If the label isn't provided, then we ask the
03739         // user to supply it at the command line.
03740         //
03741         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03742         {
03743             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter MyPurse's new label [" + strDefaultLabel + "]: ");
03744             strLabel = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
03745         }
03746 
03747         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03748         {
03749             strLabel = strDefaultLabel;
03750         }
03751 
03752 
03753         bool bSet = OTAPI_Wrap::SetAssetType_Name(MyPurse, strLabel);
03754 
03755         if (!bSet)
03756         {
03757             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILED trying to set MyPurse's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03758             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyPurse (AssetTypeID): " + MyPurse + "\n\n");
03759             return -1;
03760         }
03761         else
03762         {
03763             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS setting MyPurse's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03764             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "MyPurse (AssetTypeID): " + MyPurse + "\n\n");
03765             return 1;
03766         }
03767     }
03768 
03769     return -1;
03770 }
03771 
03772 
03773 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_edit_server()
03774 {
03775     string strUsage = concat("\n\n USAGE: editserver --server SERVER_ID\n",
03776         "Also optionally:            --args \"label \\\"PUT LABEL HERE\\\"\"\n");
03777 
03778     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03779 
03780 
03781     if (VerifyExists("Server"))
03782     {
03783         string strLabel = "";
03784 
03785         string strDefaultLabel = "(blank label)"; // can be blank
03786 
03787         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
03788         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
03789         // at the command line.
03790         //
03791         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
03792         {
03793             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
03794             //                                  const std::string str_key)
03795             //
03796             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
03797             // EXAMPLE:  --args "label \"localhost server\""
03798             //
03799             string strNewLabel = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "label");  // optional label field
03800 
03801             // Set the value based on the custom argument.
03802             //
03803             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLabel))
03804             {
03805                 strLabel = strNewLabel;
03806             }
03807         }
03808 
03809         // If the label isn't provided, then we ask the
03810         // user to supply it at the command line.
03811         //
03812         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03813         {
03814             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter Server's new label [" + strDefaultLabel + "]: ");
03815             strLabel = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
03816         }
03817 
03818         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLabel))
03819         {
03820             strLabel = strDefaultLabel;
03821         }
03822 
03823 
03824         bool bSet = OTAPI_Wrap::SetServer_Name(Server, strLabel);
03825 
03826         if (!bSet)
03827         {
03828             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILED trying to set Server's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03829             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server ID: " + Server + "\n\n");
03830             return -1;
03831         }
03832         else
03833         {
03834             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS setting Server's label to: " + strLabel + "\n");
03835             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server ID: " + Server + "\n\n");
03836             return 1;
03837         }
03838     }
03839 
03840     return -1;
03841 }
03842 
03843 
03844 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_sendmsg()
03845 {
03846     // Just to show how easy it is, let's try a "send_user_message" message.
03847     //
03848     string strUsage = "\n\n FYI, USAGE: sendmsg --mynym <YOUR_NYM_ID> --hisnym <RECIPIENT_NYM_ID>\n\n";
03849 
03850     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
03851 
03852     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("HisNym"))
03853     {
03854         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter your message on multiple lines, optionally beginning with a \"Subject: \" line.\n");
03855         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Use Ctrl-C to cancel, otherwise finish your message with an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
03856 
03857         string strMessage = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
03858 
03859         // Send the request.
03860         //
03861         string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_msg(Server, MyNym, HisNym, strMessage);
03862 
03863         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
03864         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
03865         // handled at a lower level!
03866         //
03867         // Instead, simply check for success or failure:
03868         //
03869         if (1 != VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse))
03870         {
03871             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "send_user_msg: Failed.\n");
03872         }
03873         else
03874         {
03875             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in send_user_msg! Server response:\n\n");
03876             print(strResponse);
03877             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nSuccess in send_user_msg.\n\n");
03878             return 1;
03879         }
03880     }
03881 
03882     return -1;
03883 }
03884 
03885 
03886 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_write_cheque(string & strCheque, const bool bIsInvoice) // strCheque is output.
03887 {
03888     Utility MsgUtil;
03889 
03890     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
03891     {
03892 
03893         // Look up the NymID based on MyAcct
03894         //
03895         string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
03896 
03897         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
03898         {
03899             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID (for sender) based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
03900             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
03901             return -1;
03902         }
03903         if (VerifyExists("MyNym", false) && !(MyNym == strMyNymID))
03904         {
03905             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: MyNym was provided (" + MyNym + "), but didn't match the Nym who owns MyAcct. To override, use: --mynym " + strMyNymID + "\n\n");
03906             return -1;
03907         }
03908 
03909         // Look up the ServerID based on MyAcct
03910         //
03911         string strMyServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(MyAcct);
03912 
03913         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyServerID))
03914         {
03915             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find ServerID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
03916             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Server based on the account.\n\n");
03917             return -1;
03918         }
03919         if (VerifyExists("Server", false) && !(Server == strMyServerID))
03920         {
03921             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Server was provided (" + Server + "), but didn't match the Server where MyAcct is based. To override, use: --server " + strMyServerID + "\n\n");
03922             return -1;
03923         }
03924         // ***************************************************************
03925         //
03926         // When we pass in HisNym at the command line, using this option:  --hisnym HIS_NYM_ID
03927         // then OT internally TRIES to look it up on the wallet (and someday on the address
03928         // book as well) in abbreviated or name form, in order to substitute it with the ACTUAL
03929         // full NymID, before passing it into the script where we are now. If nothing is found,
03930         // then it just passes through the ID so we have a chance to download the pubkey and
03931         // verify that it actually exists.
03932         //
03933         // Therefore, if the full "HisNym" ID hasn't ALREADY been found by now, that means we
03934         // already couldn't find it via abbreviation or name, and therefore we will HAVE to download
03935         // it from the server since we don't have it already. (And therefore we will NEED to know the
03936         // FULL ID, since we cannot download a pubkey from a server based on a partial ID.)
03937         //
03938         // The point is that when we get here, there's no need to worry about searching for a partial
03939         // or abbreviated version, and no need to ask load_or_retrieve_pubkey to somehow translate HisNym
03940         // to a full ID. That would have already happened by now, if one were available. So at this point
03941         // we basically have to assume the user passed the full and correct ID, and if it's not in the
03942         // wallet already, then load_or_retrieve_pubkey can go ahead and try to download it as if it is
03943         // the full and correct ID. If it fails, it fails.
03944         //
03945         string strRecipientPubkey = "";
03946         string strHisNymID = "";
03947 
03948         if (VerifyExists("HisNym", false))
03949         {
03950             strRecipientPubkey = MadeEasy::load_or_retrieve_encrypt_key(strMyServerID, strMyNymID, HisNym);
03951             // Note: even thogh send_user_payment already calls load_or_retrieve_pubkey, we do it
03952             // here anyway, BEFORE trying to write the cheque. (No point writing a cheque to HisNym until
03953             // we're sure it's real...)
03954             //
03955             if (!VerifyStringVal(strRecipientPubkey))
03956             {
03957                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to load or download pubkey for HisNym based on given value (" + HisNym + "). To override, use: --hisnym HIS_NYM_ID\n\n");
03958                 return -1;
03959             }
03960 
03961             strHisNymID = HisNym;
03962         }
03963 
03964         // Make sure we have at least one transaction number (to write the cheque...)
03965         //
03966         if (!MadeEasy::insure_enough_nums(10, strMyServerID, strMyNymID))
03967         {
03968             return -1;
03969         }
03970 
03971         // - At this point we have MyAcct writing a cheque to HisNym.
03972         // - We have strMyServerID and strMyNymID and we know they match MyAcct.
03973         // (And we know they match --server and --mynym as well, otherwise the
03974         // user would have been be forced to override at the command line before
03975         // allowing him to continue.)
03976         // - We know that HisNym is a valid enough ID that we were able to load
03977         // his public key, or download it and THEN load it up. By this point it was
03978         // successful either way.
03979         // - We know that the Nym has at least 1 valid transaction number, with
03980         // which to write the cheque. (If he didn't, we would have downloaded it in
03981         // the above block.)
03982         // - Therefore let's collect all the other cheque-related data, and write
03983         // the actual cheque, and return it to the caller.
03984 
03985         string strDefaultAmount = "1"; // smallest possible amount.
03986         string strDefaultMemo = "(memo field)";
03987         int64_t nDefaultLength = OTTimeGetSecondsFromTime(OT_TIME_MONTH_IN_SECONDS);   // 30 days
03988 
03989         string strAmount = "0";
03990         string strMemo = ""; // empty
03991         int64_t nLength = OTTimeGetSecondsFromTime(OT_TIME_ZERO);
03992 
03993 
03994         string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
03995 
03996         if (VerifyExists("Args"))
03997         {
03998             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
03999             //                                  const std::string str_key)
04000             //
04001             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
04002             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 100 memo \"my share for the BBQ\""
04003             //
04004             string strNewAmount = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "amount");
04005             string strNewMemo = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "memo");
04006             string strNewLength = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "validfor");
04007 
04008             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewMemo))
04009             {
04010                 strMemo = strNewMemo;
04011             }
04012 
04013             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount) && (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strNewAmount) > 0))
04014                 //          if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount) && (to_int(strNewAmount) > 0))
04015             {
04016                 strAmount = strNewAmount;
04017             }
04018 
04019             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLength) && (to_int(strNewLength) > 0))
04020             {
04021                 nLength = to_int(strNewLength);
04022             }
04023         }
04024 
04025 
04026         // If the transfer parameters aren't provided, then we
04027         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
04028         //
04029         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
04030         {
04031             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the amount[" + strDefaultAmount + "]: ");
04032             strAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04033         }
04034         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemo))
04035         {
04036             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter a note on a single line[" + strDefaultMemo + "]: ");
04037             strMemo = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04038         }
04039         if (!VerifyIntVal(nLength) || (nLength < 1))
04040         {
04041             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the 'valid for' time period, in seconds (default is 30 days.) [" + to_string(nDefaultLength) + "]: ");
04042             string strTemp = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04043 
04044             if (VerifyStringVal(strTemp) && (to_int(strTemp) > 0))
04045             {
04046                 nLength = to_int(strTemp);
04047             }
04048         }
04049 
04050         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
04051         {
04052             strAmount = strDefaultAmount;
04053         }
04054 
04055         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemo))
04056         {
04057             strMemo = strDefaultMemo;
04058         }
04059 
04060         if (!VerifyIntVal(nLength) || (nLength < 1))
04061         {
04062             nLength = nDefaultLength;
04063         }
04064 
04065 
04066         // Todo: use Args feature here to allow an option to override nLength.
04067         // If it's not used, go with the default of 30 days (above.)
04068 
04069         string strLength = to_string(nLength);
04070 
04071         time64_t tFrom = OTAPI_Wrap::GetTime();
04072         int64_t tLength = to_long(strLength);
04073         time64_t tTo = OTTimeAddTimeInterval(tFrom, tLength);
04074 
04075         if (bIsInvoice)
04076         {
04077             int64_t lTempAmount = (int64_t(-1) * OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount));
04078             strAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::FormatAmount(strAssetTypeID, lTempAmount);
04079         }
04080 
04081         int64_t lAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount);
04082 
04083         strCheque = OTAPI_Wrap::WriteCheque(strMyServerID,
04084             lAmount,
04085             tFrom,
04086             tTo,
04087             MyAcct,
04088             strMyNymID,
04089             strMemo,
04090             strHisNymID);
04091 
04092         // Record it in the records?
04093         // Update: We wouldn't record that here. Instead, OTAPI_Wrap::WriteCheque should drop a notice
04094         // into the payments outbox, the same as it does when you "sendcheque" (after all, the same
04095         // resolution would be expected once it is cashed.)
04096 
04097         return 1;
04098     }
04099 
04100     // "return value"
04101     return -1;
04102 }
04103 
04104 
04105 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_write_cheque()
04106 {
04107     string strUsage1 = "Usage:  writecheque  --myacct <MY_ACCT_ID> --hisnym <HIS_NYM_ID>\n";
04108     string strUsage2 = "This command WRITES but DOES NOT SEND the cheque. (Use sendcheque for that.)\n\n";
04109     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "Optionally: --args \"memo \\\"one-line memo allowed here.\\\" amount AMOUNT\"\n",
04110         "Additionally: --args \"validfor IN_SECONDS\" \n" + strUsage2);
04111 
04112     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
04113 
04114     string strCheque = "";
04115     int32_t nReturnVal = details_write_cheque(strCheque, false); //bIsInvoice=false
04116 
04117     if ((1 == nReturnVal) && VerifyStringVal(strCheque))
04118     {
04119         // stderr
04120         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n-------------------------------------------\n the cheque:\n\n");
04121         // stdout
04122         print(strCheque);
04123         // stderr
04124         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
04125     }
04126 
04127     return nReturnVal;
04128 }
04129 
04130 
04131 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_write_invoice()
04132 {
04133     string strUsage1 = "Usage:  writeinvoice  --myacct <MY_ACCT_ID> --hisnym <HIS_NYM_ID>\n";
04134     string strUsage2 = "This command WRITES but DOES NOT SEND the invoice. (Use sendinvoice for that.)\n";
04135     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "Optionally: --args \"memo \\\"one-line memo allowed here.\\\" amount AMOUNT\"\n",
04136         "Additionally: --args \"validfor IN_SECONDS\" \n" + strUsage2);
04137     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
04138 
04139     string strCheque = "";
04140     int32_t nReturnVal = details_write_cheque(strCheque, true); //bIsInvoice=true
04141 
04142     if ((1 == nReturnVal) && VerifyStringVal(strCheque))
04143     {
04144         // stderr
04145         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n-------------------------------------------\n the invoice:\n\n");
04146         // stdout
04147         print(strCheque);
04148         // stderr
04149         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
04150     }
04151 
04152     return nReturnVal;
04153 }
04154 
04155 
04156 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_sendcash()
04157 {
04158 
04159     string strUsage1 = "Usage:  sendcash  --[myacct|mypurse] <ID> --hisnym <RECIPIENT_NYM_ID>\nFor mypurse, the server and nym are also required: --server <SERVER_ID> --mynym <NYM_ID> \n";
04160     string strUsage2 = concat(strUsage1, "Optionally: --args \"passwd true\"  (To send a password-protected purse.)\n");
04161     string strUsage3 = concat(strUsage2, "Optionally: --args \"memo \\\"one-line memo allowed here.\\\" amount AMOUNT\"\n");
04162     string strUsage = concat(strUsage3, "This command sends cash to the recipient, from your purse if specified, and withdrawing first from your account, if necessary.\n\n");
04163 
04164     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
04165 
04166     string strServerID = "";
04167     string strMyAcctID = "";
04168     string strMyNymID = "";
04169     string strAssetTypeID = "";
04170 
04171     bool bServerExists = VerifyExists("Server", false);
04172     bool bMyPurseExists = VerifyExists("MyPurse", false);
04173     bool bMyAcctExists = VerifyExists("MyAcct", false);
04174     bool bMyNymExists = VerifyExists("MyNym", false);
04175 
04176     if (!bMyPurseExists && !bMyAcctExists)
04177     {
04178         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n You must provide EITHER --myacct <ACCT_ID> OR --mypurse <ASSET_TYPE_ID>\nFor mypurse, the server and nym are also required: --server <SERVER_ID> --mynym <NYM_ID> \n");
04179         return -1;
04180     }
04181 
04182     if (bMyPurseExists)
04183     {
04184         strAssetTypeID = MyPurse;
04185 
04186         if (bServerExists && bMyNymExists)
04187         {
04188             strServerID = Server;
04189             strMyNymID = MyNym;
04190         }
04191         else
04192         {
04193             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n MyPurse was specified, but you must also specify a server and nym:  --server <SERVER_ID> --mynym <NYM_ID>\nMaybe we can find them using MyAcct...\n");
04194         }
04195     }
04196     // NOTE: If MyNym and Server are not provided here, but MyAcct IS, the nym and server can still be derived from MyAcct.
04197     // The purse will still be used, but only if it has the same asset type ID as MyAcct does. (Meaning there was no point,
04198     // then, in specifying the purse at all, since all the info was derived from the account in that case.)
04199 
04200     if (bMyAcctExists)
04201     {
04202         string strAcctServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(MyAcct);
04203         string strAcctAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
04204         string strAcctNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
04205 
04206         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctServerID))
04207         {
04208             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Failed trying to retrieve ServerID based on MyAcct: " + MyAcct + "\n");
04209             return -1;
04210         }
04211 
04212         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctAssetID))
04213         {
04214             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Failed trying to retrieve AssetTypeID based on MyAcct: " + MyAcct + "\n");
04215             return -1;
04216         }
04217 
04218         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAcctNymID))
04219         {
04220             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Failed trying to retrieve NymID based on MyAcct: " + MyAcct + "\n");
04221             return -1;
04222         }
04223 
04224         if (VerifyStringVal(strServerID) && (strAcctServerID != strServerID))
04225         {
04226             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Server ID provided on the command line doesn't match the Server ID for MyAcct. Expected: " + strAcctServerID + "\n Try adding: --server " + strAcctServerID + "\n");
04227             return -1;
04228         }
04229 
04230         if (VerifyStringVal(strAssetTypeID) && (strAcctAssetID != strAssetTypeID))
04231         {
04232             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Asset Type ID provided on the command line doesn't match the Asset Type ID of MyAcct. Expected: " + strAcctAssetID + "\n Try adding: --mypurse " + strAcctAssetID + "\n");
04233             return -1;
04234         }
04235 
04236         if (VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID) && (strAcctNymID != strMyNymID))
04237         {
04238             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Nym ID provided on the command line doesn't match the Nym ID for MyAcct. Expected: " + strAcctNymID + "\n Try adding: --mynym " + strAcctNymID + "\n");
04239             return -1;
04240         }
04241 
04242         strServerID = strAcctServerID;
04243         strAssetTypeID = strAcctAssetID;
04244         strMyNymID = strAcctNymID;
04245         strMyAcctID = MyAcct;
04246 
04247     }
04248 
04249     // Since MyPurse might have been specified with NO server or Nym, and with MyAcct NOT specified,
04250     // we could potentially end up down here without a server or Nym still. This is only possible because
04251     // we allow the purse to fall through, in case those values are picked up from the account instead.
04252     // But by this point, we have to MAKE SURE we have a server and Nym. So let's do that now:
04253     //
04254 
04255     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
04256     {
04257         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Failed: Missing Server ID. Try adding: --server <SERVER_ID>\n");
04258         return -1;
04259     }
04260 
04261     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
04262     {
04263         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Failed: Missing MyNym ID. Try adding: --mynym <NYM_ID>\n");
04264         return -1;
04265     }
04266 
04267     // Below this point, we KNOW there's EITHER a purse OR account (or both.)
04268     // We know if there is only a purse specified, that it properly also has
04269     // a serverID and nymID. (MyPurse itself being the asset type ID.)
04270     //
04271     // We know that if a purse AND account are both specified, that they have
04272     // matching asset types, AND matching server and nym IDs. You might think
04273     // there'd be no point in doing that, since you could just not specify the
04274     // purse at all, and only specify the account. And you'd be right! Either way,
04275     // we'll try to pay it first out of the cash purse, and only withdraw from
04276     // the account if we're unable to pay it solely through the purse first.
04277     //
04278     // We know that strServerID is correct, strAssetTypeID is correct, and strMyNymID
04279     // is correct, whether we're using an account or a purse. And we know that if
04280     // we're using an account, we know that strMyAcctID is correct as well.
04281     //
04282     // Below this point we can just try to pay it from the purse, and if unable to,
04283     // try to get the remaining funds from the account, IF that's available.
04284     //
04285     int32_t nReturnVal = -1;
04286 
04287     if (VerifyExists("HisNym"))
04288     {
04289 
04290         // strAmount
04291         //
04292         string strAmount = "0"; // must be >= 1
04293         string strMemo = ""; // can be blank
04294 
04295         string strDefaultAmount = "1"; // must be >= 1
04296         string strDefaultMemo = "(blank memo field)"; // can be blank
04297 
04298         string strIndices = ""; // If indices are not specified, we derive them from the amount. Otherwise we go with the selected indices.
04299         bool bPasswordProtected = false;
04300 
04301         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
04302         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
04303         // at the command line.
04304         //
04305         if (VerifyExists("Args", false)) // displayErrorMsg=false
04306         {
04307             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
04308             //                                  const std::string str_key)
04309             //
04310             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
04311             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 1"
04312             //
04313             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices \"all\" "
04314             //
04315             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
04316 
04317             string strPasswordProtected = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "passwd");
04318 
04319             string strNewAmount = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "amount"); // any integer value
04320             string strNewMemo = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "memo"); // optional memo field
04321 
04322             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
04323             //
04324             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount))
04325             {
04326                 strAmount = strNewAmount;
04327             }
04328             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewMemo))
04329             {
04330                 strMemo = strNewMemo;
04331             }
04332             if (VerifyStringVal(strPasswordProtected) && ("true" == strPasswordProtected))
04333             {
04334                 bPasswordProtected = true;
04335             }
04336         }
04337 
04338         // If the withdrawal parameters aren't provided, then we
04339         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
04340         //
04341         if ((!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1)) && !VerifyStringVal(strIndices)) // If no indices are selected, then we NEED to know the amount...
04342         {
04343             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the amount[" + strDefaultAmount + "]: ");
04344             strAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04345         }
04346 
04347         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
04348         {
04349             strAmount = strDefaultAmount;
04350         }
04351 
04352         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemo))
04353         {
04354             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter a memo on a single line[" + strDefaultMemo + "]: ");
04355             strMemo = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04356         }
04357 
04358         string strResponse = "";
04359 
04360         nReturnVal = details_send_cash(strResponse, strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, HisNym, strMemo, strAmount, strIndices, bPasswordProtected); // <=======
04361 
04362         if (1 != nReturnVal)
04363         {
04364             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "main_sendcash: Failed in details_send_cash.\n");
04365         }
04366         else
04367         {
04368             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in sendcash! Server response:\n\n");
04369             print(strResponse);
04370             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "(Success in sendcash)\n");
04371         }
04372     }
04373 
04374     return nReturnVal;
04375 }
04376 
04377 
04378 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_sendcheque()
04379 {
04380     string strUsage1 = "Usage:  sendcheque  --myacct <MY_ACCT_ID> --hisnym <RECIPIENT_NYM_ID>\n";
04381     string strUsage2 = "This command WRITES AND SENDS the cheque.\n(Use 'writecheque', not 'sendcheque', if you don't want it to be immediately SENT.)\n";
04382     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "Optionally: --args \"memo \\\"one-line memo allowed here.\\\" amount AMOUNT\"\n",
04383         "Additionally: --args \"validfor IN_SECONDS\" \n" + strUsage2);
04384 
04385     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
04386 
04387     string strCheque = "";
04388     int32_t nReturnVal = details_write_cheque(strCheque, false); //bIsInvoice=false
04389 
04390     if ((1 == nReturnVal) && VerifyStringVal(strCheque))
04391     {
04392         // stderr
04393         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n-------------------------------------------\n the cheque:\n\n");
04394         // stdout
04395         print(strCheque);
04396         // stderr
04397         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
04398 
04399         // TODO: Store a copy in outpayments box (OR VERIFY THAT IT'S ALREADY BEING DONE, WHICH I BELIEVE THAT IT IS.)
04400 
04401         string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strCheque);
04402         string strSenderNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(strCheque);
04403         string strRecipientNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(strCheque);
04404 
04405         if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
04406         {
04407             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve a Server ID from this cheque! Very strange. (Failure.)\n");
04408             return -1;
04409         }
04410         if (!VerifyStringVal(strSenderNymID))
04411         {
04412             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve a Sender Nym ID from this cheque! Very strange. (Failure.)\n");
04413             return -1;
04414         }
04415         if (!VerifyStringVal(strRecipientNymID))
04416         {
04417             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, concat("Unable to retrieve a Recipient Nym ID from this cheque! Very strange. (Failure.)\n",
04418                 "(Although it's fine to WRITE a cheque with no recipient, still need the ID to SEND one.)\n"));
04419             return -1;
04420         }
04421 
04422 
04423         string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_payment(strServerID, strSenderNymID, strRecipientNymID, strCheque);
04424 
04425         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
04426         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
04427         // handled at a lower level!
04428         //
04429         // Instead, simply check for success or failure:
04430         //
04431         nReturnVal = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
04432 
04433         if (1 != nReturnVal)
04434         {
04435             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "sendcheque: Failed.\n");
04436 
04437             if (VerifyStringVal(strResponse))
04438             {
04439                 OTAPI_Wrap::Msg_HarvestTransactionNumbers(strResponse, strSenderNymID, false, false, false, false, false);
04440             }
04441         }
04442         else
04443         {
04444             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in sendcheque! Server response:\n\n");
04445             print(strResponse);
04446             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "(Success in sendcheque)\n");
04447             return 1;
04448         }
04449     }
04450 
04451     return nReturnVal;
04452 }
04453 
04454 
04455 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_sendinvoice()
04456 {
04457     string strUsage1 = "Usage:  sendinvoice  --myacct <MY_ACCT_ID> --hisnym <RECIPIENT_NYM_ID>\n";
04458     string strUsage2 = "This command WRITES AND SENDS the invoice. (Use 'writeinvoice', not 'sendinvoice',\nif you don't want it to be immediately SENT.)\n";
04459     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "Optionally: --args \"memo \\\"one-line memo allowed here.\\\" amount AMOUNT\"\n",
04460         "Additionally: --args \"validfor IN_SECONDS\" \n" + strUsage2);
04461 
04462     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
04463 
04464     string strCheque = "";
04465     int32_t nReturnVal = details_write_cheque(strCheque, true); //bIsInvoice=true
04466 
04467     if ((1 == nReturnVal) && VerifyStringVal(strCheque))
04468     {
04469         // stderr
04470         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n-------------------------------------------\n the invoice:\n\n");
04471         // stdout
04472         print(strCheque);
04473         // stderr
04474         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
04475 
04476         // TODO: Store a copy in outpayments box (OR VERIFY THAT IT'S ALREADY BEING DONE, WHICH I BELIEVE THAT IT IS.)
04477 
04478         string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strCheque);
04479         string strSenderNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(strCheque);
04480         string strRecipientNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(strCheque);
04481 
04482         if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
04483         {
04484             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve a Server ID from this invoice! Very strange. (Failure.)\n");
04485             return -1;
04486         }
04487         if (!VerifyStringVal(strSenderNymID))
04488         {
04489             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve a Sender Nym ID from this invoice! Very strange. (Failure.)\n");
04490             return -1;
04491         }
04492         if (!VerifyStringVal(strRecipientNymID))
04493         {
04494             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, concat("Unable to retrieve a Recipient Nym ID (Endorsee) from this invoice! Very strange. (Failure.)\n",
04495                 "(Although it's fine to WRITE a invoice with no endorsee, still need the ID to SEND it.)\n"));
04496             return -1;
04497         }
04498 
04499         string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_payment(strServerID, strSenderNymID, strRecipientNymID, strCheque);
04500 
04501         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
04502         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
04503         // handled at a lower level!
04504         //
04505         // Instead, simply check for success or failure:
04506         //
04507         nReturnVal = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
04508 
04509         if (1 != nReturnVal)
04510         {
04511             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "sendinvoice: Failed.\n");
04512         }
04513         else
04514         {
04515             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in sendinvoice! Server response:\n\n");
04516             print(strResponse);
04517             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "(Success in sendinvoice)\n");
04518             return 1;
04519         }
04520     }
04521 
04522     return nReturnVal;
04523 }
04524 
04525 
04526 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_create_offer(const string & strScale, const string & strMinIncrement, const string & strQuantity, const string & strPrice, const bool bSelling, const string & strLifespan)
04527 {
04528     // NOTE: The top half of this function has nothing to do with placing a new offer.
04529     // Instead, as a convenience for knotwork, it first checks to see if there are any
04530     // existing offers within certain parameters based on this new one, and removes them
04531     // if so. Only then, after that is done, does it actually place the new offer.
04532     // (Meaning: most of the code you see here at first is not actually necessary for
04533     // placing offers, but was done at the request of a server operator.)
04534     //
04535     string strLocation = "details_create_offer";
04536 
04537     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
04538     string strMyNymID2 = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(HisAcct);
04539 
04540     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID) || !VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID2) || (strMyNymID != strMyNymID2))
04541     {
04542         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "You must supply myacct as your asset account, and hisacct as your currency account.\n");
04543         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Also, both accounts must be owned by the same Nym (you.)\n\n");
04544         return -1;
04545     }
04546 
04547     string strMyServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(MyAcct);
04548     string strMyServerID2 = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(HisAcct);
04549 
04550     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyServerID) || !VerifyStringVal(strMyServerID2) || (strMyServerID != strMyServerID2))
04551     {
04552         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Both accounts must be on the same server.\n");
04553         return -1;
04554     }
04555     // Below this point we're safe to use Server.
04556 
04557 
04558     // We're about to load up the Nym's market offers so we can see if there are
04559     // any we should cancel before placing this new offer.
04560     //
04561     // Therefore, I'm going to download the Nym's market offers before loading them
04562     // up, in case we don't even have the current list of them.
04563 
04564     OT_Command::details_get_nym_market_offers(strMyServerID, strMyNymID);
04565 
04566     /*
04567     me: How about this — when you do "opentxs newoffer" I can alter that
04568     script to automatically cancel any sell offers for a lower amount
04569     than my new buy offer, if they're on the same market at the same scale.
04570     and vice versa. Vice versa meaning, cancel any bid offers for a higher
04571     amount than my new sell offer.
04572 
04573     knotwork: yeah that would work.
04574 
04575     So when placing a buy offer, check all the other offers I already have at the same scale,
04576     same asset and currency ID. (That is, the same "market" as denoted by strMapKey in "opentxs showmyoffers")
04577     For each, see if it's a sell offer and if so, if the amount is lower than the amount on
04578     the new buy offer, then cancel that sell offer from the market. (Because I don't want to buy-high, sell low.)
04579 
04580     Similarly, if placing a sell offer, then check all the other offers I already have at the
04581     same scale, same asset and currency ID, (the same "market" as denoted by strMapKey....) For
04582     each, see if it's a buy offer and if so, if the amount is higher than the amount of my new
04583     sell offer, then cancel that buy offer from the market. (Because I don't want some old buy offer
04584     for $10 laying around for the same stock that I'm SELLING for $8! If I dump 100 shares, I'll receive
04585     $800--I don't want my software to automatically turn around and BUY those same shares again for $1000!
04586     That would be a $200 loss.)
04587 
04588     This is done here:
04589     */
04590 
04591     OTDB::OfferListNym & offerList = *loadNymOffers(strMyServerID, strMyNymID);
04592 
04593     if (!VerifyStorable(&offerList, "OTDB::OfferListNym"))
04594     {
04595         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to load up a (nym) offerList from local storage. Probably doesn't exist.\n");
04596     }
04597 
04598     else
04599     {
04600         // LOOP THROUGH THE OFFERS and sort them into a map_of_maps, key is: scale-assetID-currencyID
04601         // the value for each key is a sub-map, with the key: transaction ID and value: the offer data itself.
04602         //
04603         int32_t nCount = offerList.GetOfferDataNymCount(); // size_t
04604         if (VerifyIntVal(nCount) && (nCount > 0))
04605         {
04606             MapOfMaps * map_of_maps = convert_offerlist_to_maps(offerList);
04607 
04608             if (!VerifyType(map_of_maps, "Map"))
04609             {
04610                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to convert offer list to map of offers. Perhaps it's empty?\n");
04611             }
04612             else
04613             {
04614                 // find_strange_offers is called for each offer, for this nym,
04615                 // as it iterates through the maps. When it's done, extra_vals.the_vector
04616                 // will contain a vector of all the transaction numbers for offers that we
04617                 // should cancel, before placing the new offer. (Such as an offer to sell for
04618                 // 30 clams when our new offer buys for 40...)
04619                 //
04620                 the_lambda_struct extra_vals;
04621 
04622                 extra_vals.the_asset_acct = MyAcct;
04623                 extra_vals.the_currency_acct = HisAcct;
04624                 extra_vals.the_scale = strScale;
04625                 extra_vals.the_price = strPrice;
04626                 extra_vals.bSelling = bSelling;
04627 
04628                 int32_t nIterated = iterate_nymoffers_maps(*map_of_maps, find_strange_offers, extra_vals);
04629 
04630                 if (-1 == nIterated)
04631                 {
04632                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error trying to iterate nym's offers.\n");
04633                     return -1;
04634                 }
04635 
04636                 // Okay -- if there are any offers we need to cancel, extra_vals.the_vector now contains
04637                 // the transaction number for each one. Let's remove them from the market before
04638                 // starting up the new offer...
04639                 //
04640 
04641                 if (extra_vals.the_vector.size() > 0)
04642                 {
04643                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": FYI, about to cancel at least one market offer, before placing the new one, due to price inconsistencies between the two...\n");
04644                 }
04645 
04646                 for (size_t i = 0; i < extra_vals.the_vector.size(); i++)
04647                 {
04648                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Canceling market offer with transaction number: " + extra_vals.the_vector[i] + "\n");
04649 
04650                     OT_Command::details_kill_offer(strMyServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, extra_vals.the_vector[i]);
04651                 }
04652                 extra_vals.the_vector.clear();
04653             }
04654         }
04655         else
04656         {
04657             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": FYI, there don't seem to be any existing offers for this nym, so I won't be erasing any older ones.\n");
04658         }
04659     }
04660     // ********************************************************************
04661 
04662     // OKAY! Now that we've cleaned out any undesirable offers, let's place the
04663     // the offer itself!
04664 
04665 
04666     //
04667     // Send the "create offer" transaction.
04668     //
04669     string strResponse = MadeEasy::create_market_offer(MyAcct, HisAcct, strScale, strMinIncrement, strQuantity, strPrice, bSelling, strLifespan, "", "0"); // lifespan of "0" results in "86400" == 1 day. Last two params are stop sign and stop price.
04670     string strAttempt = "create_market_offer";
04671 
04672     // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
04673     // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
04674     // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
04675 
04676     // ***************************************************************
04677 
04678     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strMyServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strAttempt, strResponse);
04679 
04680     if (1 == nInterpretReply)
04681     {
04682         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS placing market offer!\n\n");
04683     }
04684 
04685     return nInterpretReply;
04686 }
04687 
04688 
04689 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_create_offer()
04690 {
04691     string strUsage = concat("\n\n USAGE: newoffer --myacct <YOUR_ASSET_ACCT> --hisacct <YOUR_CURRENCY_ACCT>\n\n",
