04692         " Optional: --args \"type <bid|ask> scale 1 quantity 100 price 101\"\n Optional: --args \"lifespan 86400\"   (in seconds: 86400 is 1 day--the default.)\n\nWARNING: a price of 0 is a market order, which means 'purchase/sell at ANY price'\n\n");
04693 
04694     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
04695 
04696 
04697     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct") && VerifyExists("HisAcct"))
04698     {
04699         string strScale = "0"; // must be 1, 10, 100, etc
04700         string strMinIncrement = "0"; // must be 1, 2, 3, etc
04701         string strQuantity = "0"; // must be >= 1
04702         string strPrice = "0"; // must be >= 0
04703         string strType = ""; // must be bid or ask
04704         string strLifespan = "0";
04705 
04706         string strDefaultScale = "1"; // must be 1, 10, 100, etc
04707         string strDefaultMinIncrement = "1"; // must be 1, 2, 3, etc
04708         string strDefaultQuantity = "100"; // must be >= 1
04709         string strDefaultPrice = "101"; // must be >= 1
04710         string strDefaultType = "bid"; // must be bid or ask
04711         string strDefaultLifespan = "86400"; // even if we put "0" here, OT would internally default this to 86400.
04712 
04713         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
04714         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
04715         // at the command line.
04716         //
04717         if (VerifyExists("Args"))
04718         {
04719             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
04720             //                                  const std::string str_key)
04721             //
04722             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
04723             // EXAMPLE:  --args "type bid scale 1 quantity 100 price 101"
04724             // EXAMPLE:  --args "type ask scale 1 quantity 100 price 101"
04725             //
04726             string strNewScale = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "scale"); // 1, 10, 100, 1000, etc
04727             string strNewMinInc = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "min_inc"); // 1, 2, 3, 4, etc. Usually 1.
04728             string strNewQuantity = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "quantity"); // quantity for sale/purchase.
04729             string strNewPrice = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "price"); // per scale
04730             string strNewType = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "type"); // bid / ask
04731             string strNewLifespan = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "lifespan"); // "0" defaults to "86400" which is 1 day.
04732 
04733 
04734             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
04735             //
04736             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewScale))
04737             {
04738                 strScale = strNewScale;
04739             }
04740             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewMinInc))
04741             {
04742                 strMinIncrement = strNewMinInc;
04743             }
04744             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewQuantity))
04745             {
04746                 strQuantity = strNewQuantity;
04747             }
04748             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewPrice))
04749             {
04750                 strPrice = strNewPrice;
04751             }
04752             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewType))
04753             {
04754                 strType = strNewType;
04755             }
04756             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLifespan))
04757             {
04758                 strLifespan = strNewLifespan;
04759             }
04760         }
04761 
04762         // If the offer parameters aren't satisfied yet, then
04763         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
04764         //
04765         if (!VerifyStringVal(strScale) || (to_int(strScale) < 1))
04766         {
04767             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the market scale (1, 10, 100, etc)[" + strDefaultScale + "]: ");
04768             strScale = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04769         }
04770         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMinIncrement) || (to_int(strMinIncrement) < 1))
04771         {
04772             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the minimum increment[" + strDefaultMinIncrement + "]: ");
04773             strMinIncrement = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04774         }
04775         if (!VerifyStringVal(strQuantity) || (to_int(strQuantity) < 1))
04776         {
04777             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the quantity being purchased/sold[" + strDefaultQuantity + "]: ");
04778             strQuantity = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04779         }
04780         if (!VerifyStringVal(strPrice) || (to_int(strPrice) < 0))
04781         {
04782             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the price per scale[" + strDefaultPrice + "]: ");
04783             strPrice = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04784         }
04785         if (!VerifyStringVal(strType) || ((strType != "bid") && (strType != "ask")))
04786         {
04787             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the order type (bid/ask) [" + strDefaultType + "]: ");
04788             strType = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04789         }
04790         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLifespan) || (to_int(strLifespan) < 1))
04791         {
04792             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "(1 hour == 3600, 1 day == 86400)\n Enter the lifespan of the offer, in seconds[" + strDefaultLifespan + "]: ");
04793             strLifespan = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
04794         }
04795 
04796         if (!VerifyStringVal(strScale) || (to_int(strScale) < 1))
04797         {
04798             strScale = strDefaultScale;
04799         }
04800         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMinIncrement) || (to_int(strMinIncrement) < 1))
04801         {
04802             strMinIncrement = strDefaultMinIncrement;
04803         }
04804         if (!VerifyStringVal(strQuantity) || (to_int(strQuantity) < 1))
04805         {
04806             strQuantity = strDefaultQuantity;
04807         }
04808         if (!VerifyStringVal(strPrice) || (to_int(strPrice) < 1))
04809         {
04810             strPrice = strDefaultPrice;
04811         }
04812         if (!VerifyStringVal(strType) || ((strType != "bid") && (strType != "ask")))
04813         {
04814             strType = strDefaultType;
04815         }
04816         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLifespan) || (to_int(strLifespan) < 1))
04817         {
04818             strLifespan = strDefaultLifespan;
04819         }
04820 
04821         //
04822         // false == buying    bid
04823         // true  == selling   ask
04824         //
04825         bool bType = ((strType == "bid") ? false : true);
04826 
04827         return details_create_offer(strScale, strMinIncrement, strQuantity, strPrice, bType, strLifespan);
04828     }
04829 
04830     return -1;
04831 }
04832 
04833 
04834 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_create_server_contract()
04835 {
04836     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
04837     {
04838         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the XML contents for the contract, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
04839 
04840         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
04841         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
04842         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
04843         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
04844 
04845         string strXML = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
04846 
04847         if (VerifyStringVal(strXML))
04848         {
04849             string strContractID = OTAPI_Wrap::CreateServerContract(MyNym, strXML);
04850 
04851             if (VerifyStringVal(strContractID))
04852             {
04853                 // stderr
04854                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------------\nNew server ID: " + strContractID + "\n\n");
04855 
04856                 string strContract = OTAPI_Wrap::GetServer_Contract(strContractID);
04857 
04858                 if (VerifyStringVal(strContract))
04859                 {
04860                     // stderr
04861                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------------\nNew server contract:\n\n");
04862 
04863                     // stdout
04864                     print(strContract);
04865 
04866                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
04867 
04868                     return 1;
04869                 }
04870             }
04871         }
04872     }
04873 
04874     // "return value"
04875     return -1;
04876 }
04877 
04878 
04879 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_create_asset_contract()
04880 {
04881     // bool OTContract::CreateContract(OTString & strContract, OTPseudonym & theSigner)
04882 
04883     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
04884     {
04885         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter the XML contents for the contract, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
04886 
04887         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
04888         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
04889         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
04890         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
04891 
04892         string strXML = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
04893 
04894         if (VerifyStringVal(strXML))
04895         {
04896             string strContractID = OTAPI_Wrap::CreateAssetContract(MyNym, strXML);
04897 
04898             if (VerifyStringVal(strContractID))
04899             {
04900                 // stderr
04901                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------------\nNew asset ID: " + strContractID + "\n\n");
04902 
04903                 string strContract = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Contract(strContractID);
04904 
04905                 if (VerifyStringVal(strContract))
04906                 {
04907                     // stderr
04908                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------------\nNew asset contract:\n\n");
04909 
04910                     // stdout
04911                     print(strContract);
04912 
04913                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
04914 
04915                     return 1;
04916                 }
04917             }
04918         }
04919     }
04920 
04921     // "return value"
04922     return -1;
04923 }
04924 
04925 
04926 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_create_acct()
04927 {
04928     // Just to show how easy it is now, let's try a "create_asset_acct" message.
04929     // (It sends a NymID to the server, and downloads that Nym's public key.)
04930 
04931     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("MyPurse"))
04932     {
04933         if (!OTAPI_Wrap::IsNym_RegisteredAtServer(MyNym, Server))
04934         {
04935             // If the Nym's not registered at the server, then register him first.
04936             OT_Command::main_register_nym();
04937         }
04938 
04939         // Send the request.
04940         //
04941         string strResponse = MadeEasy::create_asset_acct(Server, MyNym, MyPurse); // Send the 'create_asset_acct' message to the server.
04942 
04943         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
04944         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
04945         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
04946 
04947         // -1 error, 0 failure, 1 success.
04948         //
04949         if (1 != VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse))
04950         {
04951             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\ncreate_asset_acct: Failed.\n\n");
04952             return -1;
04953         }
04954         else
04955         {
04956             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in create_asset_acct! Server response:\n\n"); // stderr
04957             print(strResponse); // stdout
04958             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n (Success in create_asset_acct)\n\n"); //stderr
04959             return 1;
04960         }
04961     }
04962 
04963     // Done!
04964     return -1;
04965 }
04966 
04967 
04968 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_add_signature()
04969 {
04970     // SignContract erases all signatures and affixes a new one alone.
04971     // But AddSignature, on the other hand, leaves all signatures in place, and simply adds yours to the list.
04972 
04973     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
04974     {
04975 
04976         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter an already-signed contract you wish to add your signature to, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
04977 
04978         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
04979         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
04980         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
04981         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
04982 
04983         string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
04984 
04985         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
04986 
04987         string strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::AddSignature(MyNym, strInput);
04988 
04989         // stderr
04990         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------------\nSigned:\n\n");
04991 
04992         // stdout
04993         print(strOutput);
04994 
04995         // stderr
04996         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
04997 
04998         return 1;
04999     }
05000 
05001     // "return value"
05002     return -1;
05003 }
05004 
05005 
05006 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_sign_contract()
05007 {
05008     // SignContract erases all signatures and affixes a new one alone.
05009     // But AddSignature, on the other hand, leaves all signatures in place, and simply adds yours to the list.
05010 
05011     string strUsage = concat("\n\n FYI, USAGE: sign \n",
05012         " Optionally, you may specify a contract type:  sign --args \"type LEDGER\"\nIn that example, the output would start with the bookend: -----BEGIN OT SIGNED LEDGER-----\n(You don't need to specify the type if the bookend is already present on the input string.)\n\n");
05013 
05014     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05015 
05016     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
05017     {
05018         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter a contract to be signed, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
05019 
05020         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
05021         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
05022         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
05023         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
05024 
05025         string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
05026 
05027         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
05028 
05029         string strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::SignContract(MyNym, strInput);
05030 
05031         if (!VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
05032         {
05033             // Maybe we need to flat sign (maybe it wasn't already a signed contract...)
05034             //
05035             string strContractType;
05036 
05037             if (VerifyExists("Args"))
05038             {
05039                 strContractType = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "type");
05040             }
05041 
05042             if (VerifyStringVal(strContractType))
05043             {
05044                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "A properly-formed-and-signed contract was not provided, but a 'type' was... so we'll try flatsigning the input text...\n\n");
05045                 strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::FlatSign(MyNym, strInput, strContractType);
05046             }
05047             else
05048             {
05049                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "A properly-formed-and-signed contract was not provided, and neither was a 'type' in order to form one. (Failure.)\n");
05050                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05051                 return -1;
05052             }
05053         }
05054 
05055 
05056         int32_t nReturnVal = -1;
05057 
05058         if (VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
05059         {
05060             // stderr
05061             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "-------------------------------------------\nSigned:\n\n");
05062 
05063             // stdout
05064             print(strOutput);
05065 
05066             nReturnVal = 1;
05067         }
05068         else
05069         {
05070             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nSorry, but OT was unable to sign. Oh well.");
05071         }
05072 
05073         // stderr
05074         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
05075 
05076         return nReturnVal;
05077     }
05078 
05079     // "return value"
05080     return -1;
05081 }
05082 
05083 
05084 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_kill_offer(const string & strServerID, const string & strNymID, const string & strAcctID, const string & strTransNum)
05085 {
05086     // Just to show how easy it is now, let's try a "kill_market_offer" message.
05087     // (It kills a market offer.)
05088 
05089     if (VerifyStringVal(strServerID) && VerifyStringVal(strNymID) && VerifyStringVal(strAcctID) && VerifyStringVal(strTransNum))
05090     {
05091         // Send the transaction.
05092         //
05093         string strResponse = MadeEasy::kill_market_offer(strServerID, strNymID, strAcctID, strTransNum);
05094 
05095         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
05096         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
05097         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
05098 
05099         if (1 != VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse))
05100         {
05101             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n killoffer: Failed.\n");
05102         }
05103         else if (1 != VerifyMsgBalanceAgrmntSuccess(strServerID, strNymID, strAcctID, strResponse))
05104         {
05105             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n killoffer: Balance agreement failed.\n");
05106         }
05107         else if (1 != VerifyMsgTrnxSuccess(strServerID, strNymID, strAcctID, strResponse))
05108         {
05109             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n killoffer: Balance agreement succeeded, but transaction failed.\n");
05110         }
05111         else
05112         {
05113             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nSuccess in killoffer! Server response:\n\n");
05114             print(strResponse); // stdout
05115             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); // stderr
05116             return 1;
05117         }
05118     }
05119 
05120     // Done!
05121     return -1;
05122 }
05123 
05124 
05125 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_kill_offer()
05126 {
05127 
05128 
05129     string strUsage = "\n\n FYI, used for killing an active market offer.\nUSAGE: killoffer --args \"transnum <transaction_number>\"\n\n";
05130 
05131     // Just to show how easy it is now, let's try a "kill_market_offer" message.
05132     // (It kills a market offer.)
05133 
05134     if (!VerifyExists("Server") || !VerifyExists("MyNym") || !VerifyExists("MyAcct") || !VerifyExists("Args"))
05135     {
05136         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05137     }
05138     else
05139     {
05140         string strTransactionNum = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "transnum");
05141 
05142         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTransactionNum))
05143         {
05144             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n\nYou need to provide a transaction number...\n\n");
05145             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05146         }
05147         else
05148         {
05149             return details_kill_offer(Server, MyNym, MyAcct, strTransactionNum);
05150         }
05151     }
05152 
05153     // Done!
05154     return -1;
05155 }
05156 
05157 
05158 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_kill_plan()
05159 {
05160     // string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, str_key)
05161 
05162     string strUsage = "\n\n FYI, used for stopping an active payment plan.\nUSAGE: killplan --args \"transnum <transaction_number>\"\n\n";
05163 
05164     // Just to show how easy it is now, let's try a "kill_payment_plan" message.
05165     // It kills an active (already running) payment plan.
05166 
05167     if (!VerifyExists("Server") || !VerifyExists("MyNym") || !VerifyExists("MyAcct") || !VerifyExists("Args"))
05168     {
05169         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05170     }
05171     else
05172     {
05173         string strTransactionNum = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "transnum");
05174 
05175         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTransactionNum))
05176         {
05177             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n\nYou need to provide a transaction number...\n\n");
05178             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05179         }
05180         else
05181         {
05182             // Send the transaction.
05183             //
05184             string strResponse = MadeEasy::kill_payment_plan(Server, MyNym, MyAcct, strTransactionNum);
05185 
05186             // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
05187             // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
05188             // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
05189 
05190             if (1 != VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse))
05191             {
05192                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nkill_payment_plan: Failed.\n");
05193             }
05194             else if (1 != VerifyMsgBalanceAgrmntSuccess(Server, MyNym, MyAcct, strResponse))
05195             {
05196                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nkill_payment_plan: Balance agreement failed.\n");
05197             }
05198             else if (1 != VerifyMsgTrnxSuccess(Server, MyNym, MyAcct, strResponse))
05199             {
05200                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nkill_payment_plan: Balance agreement succeeded, but transaction failed.\n");
05201             }
05202             else
05203             {
05204                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nSuccess in kill_payment_plan! Server response:\n\n");
05205                 print(strResponse); // stdout
05206                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr
05207                 return 1;
05208             }
05209         }
05210     }
05211 
05212     // Done!
05213     return -1;
05214 }
05215 
05216 
05217 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_verify_signature()
05218 {
05219     if (VerifyExists("HisNym"))
05220     {
05221         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please enter a contract you wish to verify with HisNym, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
05222 
05223         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
05224         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
05225         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
05226         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
05227 
05228         string strInput = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
05229 
05230         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n--------------------------------------\n You entered:\n" + strInput + "\n\n");
05231 
05232         bool bSuccess = false;
05233 
05234         bSuccess = OTAPI_Wrap::VerifySignature(HisNym, strInput);
05235 
05236         if (bSuccess)
05237         {
05238             print("\n\n *** Verified! ***\n\n");
05239             return 1;
05240         }
05241         else
05242         {
05243             print("Failed!\n\n");
05244         }
05245     }
05246 
05247     // return value;
05248     return -1;
05249 }
05250 
05251 
05252 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_stat_nyms()
05253 {
05254     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
05255     print(" ** PSEUDONYMS: \n");
05256 
05257     int32_t nNymCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNymCount();
05258 
05259     for (int32_t i = 0; i < nNymCount; ++i)
05260     {
05261         string strIndex = to_string(i);
05262         string strID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_ID(i);
05263         string strName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_Name(strID);
05264 
05265         print(strIndex + ": " + strID + " ---  " + strName);
05266     }
05267 
05268     return 1;
05269 }
05270 
05271 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_stat_servers()
05272 {
05273     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
05274     print(" ** SERVERS: \n");
05275     int32_t nServerCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetServerCount();
05276 
05277     for (int32_t i = 0; i < nServerCount; ++i)
05278     {
05279         string strIndex = to_string(i);
05280         string strID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetServer_ID(i);
05281         string strName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetServer_Name(strID);
05282 
05283         print(strIndex + ": " + strID + " ---  " + strName);
05284     }
05285 
05286     return 1;
05287 }
05288 
05289 
05290 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_stat_assets()
05291 {
05292     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
05293     print(" ** ASSET TYPES: \n");
05294     int32_t nAssetTypeCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetTypeCount();
05295 
05296     for (int32_t i = 0; i < nAssetTypeCount; ++i)
05297     {
05298         string strID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_ID(i);
05299         string strName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAssetType_Name(strID);
05300 
05301         print(strID + " ---  " + strName);
05302     }
05303 
05304     return 1;
05305 }
05306 
05307 
05308 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_stat_accounts()
05309 {
05310     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
05311     print(" ** ACCOUNTS: \n");
05312 
05313     int32_t nAccountCount = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountCount();
05314 
05315     for (int32_t i = 0; i < nAccountCount; ++i)
05316     {
05317         if ((i > 0) && (i != (nAccountCount))) { print("-------------------------------------"); }
05318         string strID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ID(i);
05319         string strStatAcct = MadeEasy::stat_asset_account(strID);
05320         bool bSuccess = VerifyStringVal(strStatAcct);
05321         if (bSuccess)
05322         {
05323             print(strStatAcct);
05324         }
05325         else
05326         {
05327             print("Error trying to stat an asset account: " + strID);
05328         }
05329         // stderr
05330         print("");
05331     }
05332     print("------------------------------------------------------------------");
05333 
05334     return 1;
05335 }
05336 
05337 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_stat()
05338 {
05339     print("");
05340 
05341     OT_Command::main_stat_nyms();
05342     OT_Command::main_stat_servers();
05343     OT_Command::main_stat_assets();
05344     OT_Command::main_stat_accounts();
05345 
05346     return 1;
05347 }
05348 
05349 
05350 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_stat_account(const string & strID)
05351 {
05352     // stderr
05353     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
05354 
05355     string strStatAcct = MadeEasy::stat_asset_account(strID);
05356 
05357     bool bSuccess = VerifyStringVal(strStatAcct);
05358     int32_t nSuccess = (bSuccess ? 1 : -1);
05359 
05360     if (bSuccess)
05361     {
05362         print(strStatAcct);
05363     }
05364     else
05365     {
05366         print("Error trying to stat an asset account: " + strID + "\n");
05367     }
05368     // stderr
05369     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
05370 
05371     return nSuccess;
05372 }
05373 
05374 
05375 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_stat_acct()
05376 {
05377     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05378     {
05379         return details_stat_account(MyAcct);
05380     }
05381     return -1;
05382 }
05383 
05384 
05385 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_account_balance(const string & strID)
05386 {
05387     string strName = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_Name(strID);
05388     string strAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strID);
05389     int64_t lBalance = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_Balance(strID);
05390 
05391     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n    Balance: "); //stderr
05392     print(OTAPI_Wrap::FormatAmount(strAssetID, lBalance)); // stdout
05393     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strID + "   (" + strName + ")\n\n"); //stderr
05394 
05395     return 1;
05396 }
05397 
05398 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_balance()
05399 {
05400     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05401     {
05402         return details_account_balance(MyAcct);
05403     }
05404     return -1;
05405 }
05406 
05407 
05408 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_nym_stat(const string & strID)
05409 {
05410     //  string strName    = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_Name(strID)
05411     string strStats = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_Stats(strID);
05412 
05413     print(strStats); // stdout
05414 
05415     return 1;
05416 }
05417 
05418 
05419 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_nym_stat()
05420 {
05421     if (VerifyExists("MyNym"))
05422     {
05423         return details_nym_stat(MyNym);
05424     }
05425     return -1;
05426 }
05427 
05428 
05429 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_mint()
05430 {
05431     // SHOW MINT
05432     //
05433     // (Load a public mint from local storage and display it on the screen.
05434     // If necessary, download it from the server.)
05435     //
05436 
05437     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("MyPurse"))
05438     {
05439         // Just to show how easy it is now, let's load up a mint and display it.
05440         // If this function is unable to load it, it will download the mint from
05441         // the server.
05442         //
05443         string strMint = MadeEasy::load_or_retrieve_mint(Server, MyNym, MyPurse); // <=====
05444 
05445         // NOTICE -- there's no need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number, synching
05446         // transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all handled interally.
05447         //
05448         // Simply "verify" the return value:
05449         //
05450         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMint))
05451         {
05452             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n load_or_retrieve_mint: Failed.\n\n");
05453             return -1;
05454         }
05455         else // Success!
05456         {
05457             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr
05458             print(strMint); // stdout
05459             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr
05460             return 1;
05461         }
05462     }
05463 
05464     // Done!
05465     return -1;
05466 }
05467 
05468 
05469 // Creates a new Pseudonym and adds it to the wallet.
05470 // (And sets the display name for the new Nym, in the wallet.)
05471 // Prints the new NymID to stdout.
05472 //
05473 // Returns 1 for success, 0 for failure.
05474 //
05475 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_create_nym(const int32_t nKeybits, const string & strName, const string & strSourceForNymID, const string & strAltLocation)
05476 {
05477     string strNymID = MadeEasy::create_pseudonym(nKeybits, strSourceForNymID, strAltLocation); // returns new Nym ID
05478 
05479     if (!VerifyStringVal(strNymID))
05480     {
05481         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "details_create_nym: Failed in OT_ME::create_pseudonym(keybits == " + to_string(nKeybits) + ")\n");
05482         return -1;
05483     }
05484     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success creating! " + to_string(nKeybits) + " keybits, new ID: "); // stderr
05485     print(strNymID); // stdout
05486     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); //stderr
05487 
05488     bool bSetName = OTAPI_Wrap::SetNym_Name(strNymID, // subject
05489         strNymID, // signer
05490         strName);
05491     if (!bSetName)
05492     {
05493         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed in OT_API_SetNym_Name(name == " + strName + ")\n");
05494         return -1;
05495     }
05496 
05497     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success setting name to: " + strName + "\n\n"); // stderr
05498     return 1;
05499 }
05500 
05501 
05502 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_create_nym()
05503 {
05504     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:    newnym --args \"keybits 1024 name \\\"Bob's New Nym\\\"\"  \n";
05505     string strUsage2 = "Optional: newnym --args \"source \\\"http://test.com/credential_IDs\\\" \"  \n";
05506     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "FYI, a source can be a URL, a Bitcoin address, a Namecoin address, a public key,\nor the unique DN info from a traditionally-issued cert. Hashing the source should\n produce the NymID. Also, the source should always (somehow) validate the\ncredential IDs, if they are to be trusted for their purported Nym.\nAnother optional parameter is 'altlocation' which, in the case of DN info as a source, would be the \ndownload location where a Cert should be found with that DN info, or a PKI where the Cert can be found.\n\nNOTE: If you leave the source BLANK, then OT will just generate a public key to serve as the source. The\npublic key will be hashed to form the NymID, and all credentials for that Nym will need to be signed by\nthe corresponding private key. That's the only way they can be 'verified by their source.'\n\n";
05507 
05508     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05509 
05510     int32_t nKeybits = 1024;
05511     string strName = "New Nym";
05512     string strSourceForNymID = ""; // Leave this blank to use a key-based Nym. Otherwise provide a source to hash (to form the NymID. All credentials must somehow verify through this source.)
05513     string strAltLocation = "";
05514 
05515     if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
05516     {
05517         // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
05518         //                                  const std::string str_key)
05519         //
05520         // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
05521         //
05522         // EXAMPLE:  --args "keybits 1024"
05523         //
05524         string strKeybits = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "keybits");
05525         string strNewName = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "name");
05526         string strNewSource = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "source");
05527         string strNewLocation = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "location");
05528 
05529         if (VerifyStringVal(strKeybits) && (to_int(strKeybits) > 0))
05530         {
05531             nKeybits = to_int(strKeybits);
05532         }
05533 
05534         if (VerifyStringVal(strNewName))
05535         {
05536             strName = strNewName;
05537         }
05538 
05539         if (VerifyStringVal(strNewSource))
05540         {
05541             strSourceForNymID = strNewSource;
05542         }
05543 
05544         if (VerifyStringVal(strNewLocation))
05545         {
05546             strAltLocation = strNewLocation;
05547         }
05548     }
05549 
05550 
05551     return details_create_nym(nKeybits, strName, strSourceForNymID, strAltLocation);
05552 }
05553 
05554 
05555 /*
05556 call OTAPI_Wrap::LoadInbox() to load the inbox ledger from local storage.
05557 
05558 During this time, your user has the opportunity to peruse the inbox, and to decide which transactions therein he wishes to accept or reject. Usually the inbox is display on the screen, then the user selects various items to accept or reject, and then the user clicks “Process Inbox” and then you do this:
05559 Then call OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_CreateResponse() in order to create a ‘response’ ledger for that inbox, which will be sent to the server to signal your responses to the various inbox transactions.
05560 Then call OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetCount() (pass it the inbox) to find out how many transactions are inside of it. Use that count to LOOP through them…
05561 Use OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetTransactionByIndex() to grab each transaction as you iterate through the inbox. (There are various introspection functions you can use in the API here if you wish to display the inbox items on the screen for the user…)
05562 Next call OTAPI_Wrap::Transaction_CreateResponse() for each transaction in the inbox, to create a response to it, accepting or rejecting it. This function creates the response and adds it to the response ledger.
05563 Next, call OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_FinalizeResponse() which will create a Balance Agreement for the ledger.
05564 Finally, call OTAPI_Wrap::processInbox() to send your message to the server and process the various items.
05565 
05566 If the message was successful, then use OTAPI_Wrap::Message_GetBalanceAgreementSuccess() and OTAPI_Wrap::Message_GetTransactionSuccess() as described above in the deposit cash instructions.
05567 */
05568 
05569 
05570 // Done:  add options here for accept transfers, accept receipts, and accept all.
05571 // Done:  Then basically make a version for the payments inbox for accept payments, accept invoices, and accept all.
05572 //
05573 // (Accepting payments can basically be automated, but accepting invoices requires user permission.)
05574 //
05575 // Therefore add:
05576 //   acceptmoney    -- This accepts all incoming transfers and incoming payments
05577 //                     (Not receipts or invoices) for any designated accounts and nyms.
05578 //   acceptreceipts -- Accepts all inbox receipts (not transfers.)
05579 //   acceptinvoices -- Accepts all invoices (not payments.)
05580 //   acceptall      -- All of the above.
05581 //
05582 // Todo: Make the above functions also work with specific indices (vs "all")
05583 //
05584 
05585 
05586 //
05587 // PROCESS INBOX, ACCEPTING ALL ITEMS WITHIN...
05588 //
05589 // Load an asset account's inbox from local storage and iterate through
05590 // the items inside, and fire off a server message accepting them all.
05591 //
05592 // nItemType  == 0 for all, 1 for transfers only, 2 for receipts only.
05593 // strIndices == "" for "all indices"
05594 //
05595 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::accept_inbox_items(const string & strMyAcctID, const int32_t nItemType, const string & strIndices)
05596 {
05597     Utility MsgUtil;
05598 
05599     // Look up the Nym ID based on the Account ID.
05600     //
05601     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
05602 
05603     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
05604     {
05605         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on the specified account ( " + strMyAcctID + " ).\n");
05606         return -1;
05607     }
05608 
05609     if (VerifyExists("MyNym", false) && (MyNym != strMyNymID))
05610     {
05611         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Try again: MyNym is specified, but it's not the owner of the specified account ( " + strMyAcctID + " ).\n");
05612         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "To override with the nym for this account, add: --mynym " + strMyNymID + " \n\n");
05613         return -1;
05614     }
05615 
05616     // Look up the Server ID based on the Account ID.
05617     //
05618     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strMyAcctID);
05619 
05620     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
05621     {
05622         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find Server ID based on the specified account ( " + strMyAcctID + " ).\n");
05623         return -1;
05624     }
05625 
05626     if (VerifyExists("Server", false) && (Server != strServerID))
05627     {
05628         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Try again: Server is specified, but it's not the server for the specified account ( " + strMyAcctID + " ).\n");
05629         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "To override with the server for this account, add: --server " + strServerID + " \n\n");
05630         return -1;
05631     }
05632 
05633     // returns bool.
05634     //
05635     // User may have already chosen indices (passed in) so we don't want to
05636     // re-download the inbox unless we HAVE to. But if the hash has changed, that's
05637     // one clear-cut case where we _do_ have to. Otherwise our balance agreement
05638     // will fail anyway. So hopefully we can let OT "be smart about it" here instead
05639     // of just forcing it to download every time even when unnecessary.
05640     //
05641     if (!MsgUtil.getIntermediaryFiles(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID)) // boolean bForceDownload=false
05642     {
05643         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to download necessary intermediary files for this inbox/account. (Failure.)\n");
05644         return -1;
05645     }
05646 
05647 
05648     // Make sure we have at least one transaction number (to process the inbox with.)
05649     //
05650     // NOTE: Normally we don't have to do this, because the high-level API is smart
05651     // enough, when sending server transaction requests, to grab new transaction numbers
05652     // if it is running low.
05653     // But in this case, we need the numbers available BEFORE sending the transaction
05654     // request, because the call to OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_CreateResponse is where the number
05655     // is first needed, and that call is made int64_t before the server transaction request
05656     // is actually sent.
05657     //
05658     if (!MadeEasy::insure_enough_nums(10, strServerID, strMyNymID))
05659     {
05660         return -1;
05661     }
05662 
05663     string strInbox = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadInbox(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID); // Returns NULL, or an inbox.
05664 
05665     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInbox))
05666     {
05667         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n OT_API_LoadInbox: Failed.\n\n");
05668         return -1;
05669     }
05670     else // Success!
05671     {
05672         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr
05673         //  print(strInbox)          // stdout
05674 
05675         int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetCount(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strInbox);
05676         if (VerifyIntVal(nCount) && (nCount > 0))
05677         {
05678             // NOTE!!! DO **NOT** create the response ledger until the FIRST iteration of the below loop that actually
05679             // creates a transaction response! If that "first iteration" never comes (due to receipts being skipped, etc)
05680             // then OTAPI_Wrap::Transaction_CreateResponse will never get called, and therefore Ledger_CreateResponse should
05681             // also not be called, either. (Nor should OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_FinalizeResponse, etc.)
05682             //
05683             string strResponseLEDGER = "";
05684 
05685             int32_t nIndicesCount = VerifyStringVal(strIndices) ? OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Count(strIndices) : 0;
05686 
05687             for (int32_t nIndex = 0; nIndex < nCount; ++nIndex)
05688             {
05689                 bool bContinue = false;  // I'm hacking my own "continue" since the language doesn't support it....
05690 
05691                 string strTrans = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetTransactionByIndex(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strInbox, nIndex);
05692 
05693                 // nItemType  == 0 for all, 1 for transfers only, 2 for receipts only.
05694                 // strIndices == "" for "all indices"
05695                 //
05696                 if (nItemType > 0) // 0 means "all", so we don't have to skip anything based on type, if it's 0.
05697                 {
05698                     string strTransType = OTAPI_Wrap::Transaction_GetType(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strTrans);
05699 
05700                     // incoming transfer
05701                     if (("pending" == strTransType) && (1 != nItemType))
05702                     {
05703                         // if it IS an incoming transfer, but we're doing receipts, then skip it.
05704                         //                      continue // language doesn't support this
05705                         bContinue = true;
05706                     }
05707                     // receipt
05708                     else if (!bContinue && ("pending" != strTransType) && (2 != nItemType))
05709                     {
05710                         // if it is NOT an incoming transfer, then it's a receipt. If we're not doing receipts, then skip it.
05711                         //                      continue // language doesn't support this
05712                         bContinue = true;
05713                     }
05714                 }
05715 
05716                 if (!bContinue)
05717                 {
05718 
05719                     // - If NO indices are specified, process them ALL.
05720                     //
05721                     // - If indices are specified, but the current index is not on
05722                     //   that list, then continue...
05723                     //
05724                     if ((nIndicesCount > 0) && !OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nIndex)))
05725                     {
05726                         //                      continue  // language doesn't support continue.
05727                         bContinue = true;
05728                     }
05729 
05730                     else if (!bContinue)
05731                     {
05732                         // By this point we know we actually have to call OTAPI_Wrap::Transaction_CreateResponse
05733                         // Therefore, if OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_CreateResponse has not yet been called (which it won't
05734                         // have been, the first time we hit this in this loop), then we call it here this one
05735                         // time, to get things started...
05736                         //
05737                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strResponseLEDGER))
05738                         {
05739                             strResponseLEDGER = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_CreateResponse(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strInbox);
05740 
05741                             if (!VerifyStringVal(strResponseLEDGER))
05742                             {
05743                                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: OT_API_Ledger_CreateResponse returned NULL.\n");
05744                                 return -1;
05745                             }
05746                         }
05747 
05748                         // By this point, we know the ledger response exists, and we know we have to create
05749                         // a transaction response to go inside of it, so let's do that next...
05750                         //
05751                         string strNEW_ResponseLEDGER = OTAPI_Wrap::Transaction_CreateResponse(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strResponseLEDGER, strTrans, true); // accept = true (versus rejecting a pending transfer, for example.)
05752 
05753                         if (!VerifyStringVal(strNEW_ResponseLEDGER))
05754                         {
05755                             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: OT_API_Transaction_CreateResponse returned NULL.\n");
05756                             return -1;
05757                         }
05758                         strResponseLEDGER = strNEW_ResponseLEDGER;
05759                     }
05760                 }
05761             } // for
05762 
05763             if (!VerifyStringVal(strResponseLEDGER))
05764             {
05765                 // This means there were receipts in the box, but they were skipped.
05766                 // And after the skipping was done, there were no receipts left.
05767                 // So we can't just say "the box is empty" because it's not. But nevertheless,
05768                 // we aren't actually processing any of them, so we return 0 AS IF the box
05769                 // had been empty. (Because this is not an error condition. Just a "no op".)
05770                 //
05771                 return 0;
05772             }
05773 
05774             // Below this point, we know strResponseLEDGER needs to be sent,
05775             // so let's finalize it.
05776             //
05777             string strFinalizedResponse = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_FinalizeResponse(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strResponseLEDGER);
05778 
05779             if (!VerifyStringVal(strFinalizedResponse))
05780             {
05781                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: OT_API_Ledger_FinalizeResponse returned NULL.\n");
05782                 return -1;
05783             }
05784             // ***************************************************************
05785 
05786             // Server communications are handled here...
05787             //
05788             string strResponse = MadeEasy::process_inbox(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strFinalizedResponse);
05789             string strAttempt = "process_inbox";
05790 
05791             // ***************************************************************
05792 
05793             int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strAttempt, strResponse);
05794 
05795             if (1 == nInterpretReply)
05796             {
05797                 // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
05798                 // since they have probably changed from this operation.
05799                 //
05800                 bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
05801 
05802                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nServer response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS processing/accepting inbox.\n");
05803                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
05804             }
05805 
05806             // ***************************************************************
05807             //
05808             // Success!
05809             //
05810             return nInterpretReply;
05811 
05812         } // VerifyIntVal (nCount) && nCount > 0
05813 
05814         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The asset account inbox is empty.\n\n");
05815     }
05816 
05817     return 0;
05818 }
05819 
05820 
05821 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_receipts()
05822 {
05823     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:  acceptreceipts --myacct FOR_ACCT --args \"indices 3,6,8\"  \n (Sample indices are shown.)\n";
05824     string strUsage2 = "If indices are not specified for myacct's inbox, then OT will\n";
05825     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "accept ALL receipts (but no pending transfers) in that box.\n\n";
05826 
05827     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05828 
05829     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05830     {
05831         string strIndices = "";
05832 
05833         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
05834         {
05835             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
05836             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
05837             //
05838             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
05839         }
05840 
05841         return accept_inbox_items(MyAcct, 2, strIndices);
05842     }
05843 
05844     return -1;
05845 }
05846 
05847 
05848 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_inbox()
05849 {
05850     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:  acceptinbox --myacct FOR_ACCT --args \"indices 3,6,8\"  \n (Sample indices are shown.)\n";
05851     string strUsage2 = "If indices are not specified for myacct's inbox, then OT will\n";
05852     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "accept ALL transfers and receipts in that box.\n\n";
05853 
05854     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05855 
05856     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05857     {
05858         string strIndices = "";
05859 
05860         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
05861         {
05862             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
05863             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
05864             //
05865             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
05866         }
05867 
05868         return accept_inbox_items(MyAcct, 0, strIndices);
05869     }
05870 
05871     return -1;
05872 }
05873 
05874 
05875 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_transfers()
05876 {
05877     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:  accepttransfers --myacct FOR_ACCT --args \"indices 3,6,8\"  \n (Sample indices are shown.)\n";
05878     string strUsage2 = "If indices are not specified for myacct's inbox, then OT will\n";
05879     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "accept ALL transfers (but no receipts) in that box.\n\n";
05880 
05881     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05882 
05883     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05884     {
05885         string strIndices = "";
05886 
05887         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
05888         {
05889             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
05890             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
05891             //
05892             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
05893         }
05894 
05895         return accept_inbox_items(MyAcct, 1, strIndices);
05896     }
05897 
05898     return -1;
05899 }
05900 
05901 
05902 // Accept incoming payments and transfers. (NOT receipts or invoices.)
05903 //
05904 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_money()
05905 {
05906     string strUsage = "\nUsage:  acceptmoney --myacct INTO_ACCT\n";
05907 
05908     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05909 
05910     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05911     {
05912         string strIndices = "";
05913 
05914         int32_t nAcceptedTransfers = accept_inbox_items(MyAcct, 1, strIndices); // accepts transfers only, leaves receipts.
05915 
05916         int32_t nAcceptedPurses = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "PURSE");
05917         // Voucher is already interpreted as a form of cheque, so this is redundant.
05918         //      int32_t nAcceptedVouchers = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "VOUCHER")
05919         int32_t nAcceptedCheques = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "CHEQUE");
05920 
05921         // If all five calls succeed, then the total here is 5.
05922         // So we return success as well (1).
05923         //
05924         if ((nAcceptedTransfers > -1) || (nAcceptedPurses > -1) || (nAcceptedCheques > -1))
05925         {
05926             return 1;
05927         }
05928     }
05929 
05930     return -1;
05931 }
05932 
05933 
05934 // Accept all incoming transfers, receipts, payments, and invoices.
05935 //
05936 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_all()
05937 {
05938     string strUsage = "\nUsage:  acceptall --myacct INTO_ACCT\n";
05939 
05940     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
05941 
05942     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
05943     {
05944         string strIndices = "";
05945 
05946         //  Incoming transfers and receipts (asset account inbox.)
05947         //
05948         int32_t nAcceptedInbox = accept_inbox_items(MyAcct, 0, strIndices); // accepts transfers AND receipts.
05949 
05950         // Incoming payments -- cheques, purses, vouchers (payments inbox for nym)
05951         //
05952         int32_t nAcceptedPurses = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "PURSE");
05953         // Voucher is already interpreted as a form of cheque, so this is redundant.
05954         //      int32_t nAcceptedVouchers = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "VOUCHER")
05955         int32_t nAcceptedCheques = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "CHEQUE");
05956 
05957         // Invoices LAST (so the MOST money is in the account before it starts paying out.)
05958         //
05959         int32_t nAcceptedInvoices = accept_from_paymentbox(MyAcct, strIndices, "INVOICE");
05960 
05961         // If all four calls succeed, then the total here is 4.
05962         // So we return success as well (1).
05963         //
05964         if (4 == (nAcceptedInbox + nAcceptedPurses + nAcceptedCheques + nAcceptedInvoices))
05965         {
05966             return 1;
05967         }
05968     }
05969 
05970     return -1;
05971 }
05972 
05973 
05974 // returns the server response string (or null.)
05975 // Use VerifyStringVal and/or VerifyMessageSuccess on it, for more info.
05976 //
05977 OT_COMMANDS_OT string OT_Command::details_check_user(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyNymID, const string & strHisNymID)
05978 {
05979     // Just to show how easy it is now, let's try a "check_user" message.
05980     // (It sends a NymID to the server, and downloads that Nym's public key.)
05981 
05982     string strServerParam = strServerID;
05983     string strMyNymParam = strMyNymID;
05984     string strHisNymParam = strHisNymID;
05985 
05986     string strResponse;
05987 
05988     // NOTE: If this were Server, MyNym, and HisNym, then we'd have already
05989     // translated the partials to read IDs (in OT itself) but we don't have that
05990     // guarantee in this function. Maybe strServerID was passed in from user input
05991     // directly, while inside another script. Partial IDs should still work, right?
05992     // So here, we translate them just in case.
05993     //
05994     if (VerifyStringVal(strServerID) && VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID) && VerifyStringVal(strHisNymID))
05995     {
05996         // IF we are able to resolve the HisNymId from a partial, then we
05997         // replace the partial with the full version.
05998         // (Otherwise we assume it's already a full ID and we don't mess with it.)
05999         //
06000         string strServerFromPartial = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetServerIDFromPartial(strServerID);
06001 
06002         if (VerifyStringVal(strServerFromPartial))
06003         {
06004             strServerParam = strServerFromPartial;
06005         }
06006 
06007         string strHisNymFromPartial = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetNymIDFromPartial(strHisNymID);
06008 
06009         if (VerifyStringVal(strHisNymFromPartial))
06010         {
06011             strHisNymParam = strHisNymFromPartial;
06012         }
06013 
06014         string strMyNymFromPartial = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetNymIDFromPartial(strMyNymID);
06015 
06016         if (VerifyStringVal(strMyNymFromPartial))
06017         {
06018             strMyNymParam = strMyNymFromPartial;
06019         }
06020 
06021         // Send the request.
06022         //
06023         strResponse = MadeEasy::check_user(strServerParam, strMyNymParam, strHisNymParam); // Send the 'check_user' message to the server.
06024     }
06025     else
06026     {
06027         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n details_check_user: Bad input... strServerID, strMyNymID, or strHisNymID \n");
06028     }
06029 
06030     // Done
06031     return strResponse;
06032 }
06033 
06034 
06035 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_check_user()
06036 {
06037     string strUsage = "Usage:   opentxs checknym --mynym MY_NYM_ID --hisnym HIS_NYM_ID \n Downloads the public key for HisNym.\n\n";
06038 
06039     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06040 
06041     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("HisNym") && VerifyExists("Args"))
06042     {
06043         //        string strHisNym = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey( Args, "hisnym" )
06044         //
06045         //        if (!VerifyStringVal(strHisNym))
06046         //        {
06047         //            OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Missing:  --args \"hisnym HIS_NYM_ID_GOES_HERE\"\n\n");
06048         //            return -1;
06049         //; }
06050 
06051         // Send the request.
06052         //
06053         string strResponse = details_check_user(Server, MyNym, HisNym);
06054 
06055 
06056         // -1 is error,
06057         //  0 is reply received: failure
06058         //  1 is reply received: success
06059         //
06060         if (1 == VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse))
06061         {
06062             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nSuccess in checknym! Server response:\n\n");
06063             print(strResponse); // stdout
06064             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); //stderr
06065             return 1;
06066         }
06067         else
06068         {
06069             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n checknym: Failed.\n\n");
06070         }
06071     }
06072 
06073     // Done
06074     return -1;
06075 }
06076 
06077 
06078 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::download_acct_files()
06079 {
06080     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
06081 
06082     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
06083     {
06084         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06085         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
06086         return -1;
06087     }
06088 
06089 
06090     // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
06091     // since they have probably changed from this operation.
06092     //
06093     bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(Server, strMyNymID, MyAcct, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
06094 
06095     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n" + string(bRetrieved ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED") + " retrieving intermediary files for account: " + MyAcct + "\n\n");
06096 
06097     return bRetrieved ? 1 : -1;
06098 }
06099 
06100 
06101 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_dl_acct_files()
06102 {
06103     string strUsage = "\n\n Usage:  refreshacct --server SERVER_ID --myacct YOUR_ACCT_ID\n\n";
06104 
06105     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06106 
06107     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
06108     {
06109         return download_acct_files();
06110     }
06111 
06112     return -1;
06113 }
06114 
06115 
06116 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_refresh_all()
06117 {
06118     string strUsage = "Usage:  refresh --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID --myacct YOUR_ACCT_ID\n\n";
06119 
06120     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06121 
06122     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
06123     {
06124         int32_t nSuccess = OT_Command::main_refresh_nym();   // <=======
06125 
06126         if (-1 == nSuccess)
06127         {
06128             return -1;
06129         }
06130 
06131         return OT_Command::main_dl_acct_files();  // <=======
06132     }
06133 
06134     return -1;
06135 }
06136 
06137 
06138 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_download_contract(const string & strServerID, const string & strNymID, const string & strContractID)
06139 {
06140     // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
06141     // since they have probably changed from this operation.
06142     //
06143     string strRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_contract(strServerID, strNymID, strContractID);
06144     int32_t nRetrieved = VerifyMessageSuccess(strRetrieved);
06145 
06146     string strSuccess = "ERROR";
06147 
06148     if (1 == nRetrieved)
06149     {
06150         strSuccess = "SUCCESS";
06151     }
06152     else if (0 == nRetrieved)
06153     {
06154         strSuccess = "FAILED";
06155     }
06156 
06157     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n " + strSuccess + " retrieving contract: " + strContractID + "\n\n");
06158 
06159     return (1 == nRetrieved) ? 1 : -1;
06160 }
06161 
06162 
06163 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_download_contract()
06164 {
06165     string strUsage = concat("\n\nUsage:  getcontract --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID \n",
06166         "                    --args \"contract_id CONTRACT_ID_HERE\"\n\n");
06167     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06168 
06169     string strContractID = "";
06170 
06171     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
06172     {
06173 
06174         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
06175         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
06176         // at the command line.
06177         //
06178         if (VerifyExists("Args"))
06179         {
06180             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
06181             //                                  const std::string str_key)
06182             //
06183             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
06184             // EXAMPLE:  --args "contract_id CvHGtfOOKzQKL5hFL7J4iF5yAodVKhS1rxPzME5R9XA"
06185             //
06186             string strNewContractID = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "contract_id");
06187 
06188 
06189             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
06190             //
06191             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewContractID))
06192             {
06193                 strContractID = strNewContractID;
06194             }
06195             else
06196             {
06197                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nMissing --args \"contract_id CONTRACT_ID_HERE\"\n\n");
06198                 return -1;
06199             }
06200 
06201             return details_download_contract(Server, MyNym, strContractID);
06202         }
06203 
06204     }
06205 
06206     return -1;
06207 }
06208 
06209 
06210 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_verify_last_receipt()
06211 {
06212     // SHOW INBOX
06213     //
06214     // Load an asset account's inbox from local storage and display it on the screen.
06215     //
06216 
06217     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
06218     {
06219 
06220         // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
06221         //
06222         string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
06223 
06224         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
06225         {
06226             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06227             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
06228             return -1;
06229         }
06230         // ***************************************************************
06231 
06232         bool bSuccess = OTAPI_Wrap::VerifyAccountReceipt(Server, strMyNymID, MyAcct);
06233 
06234         if (!bSuccess)
06235         {
06236             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n OT_API_VerifyAccountReceipt: Failed. Try using refreshacct and then try verifying again.\n\n");
06237             return -1;
06238         }
06239         else // Success!
06240         {
06241             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nVerify receipt:  success!\n\n"); // stderr
06242             return 1;
06243         }
06244     }
06245 
06246     // Done!
06247     return -1;
06248 }
06249 
06250 
06251 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_register_nym()
06252 {
06253     string strUsage = concat("\n\nUsage: register_nym.ot --server SERVER_ID --mynym NYM_ID\n\n",
06254         "(If you don't have a NymID, then use create_nym.ot first.)\n\n");
06255 
06256     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06257 
06258     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
06259     {
06260         string strResponse = MadeEasy::register_nym(Server, MyNym); // This also does getRequest internally, if success.
06261         int32_t nSuccess = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
06262 
06263         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
06264         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
06265         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
06266         //
06267         // -1 is error,
06268         //  0 is reply received: failure
06269         //  1 is reply received: success
06270         //
06271         switch (nSuccess)
06272         {
06273         case 1:
06274             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Server response:\n\n");
06275             print(strResponse); // stdout
06276             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS in register_nym!\n(Also, success syncronizing the request number.)\n\n");
06277             break;
06278         case 0:
06279             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILURE in register_nym! Server response:\n\n");
06280             print(strResponse); // stdout
06281             break;
06282         default:
06283             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nError in register_nym!\n");
06284 
06285             if (VerifyStringVal(strResponse))
06286             {
06287                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response:\n\n");
06288                 print(strResponse); // stdout
06289             }
06290             break;
06291         }
06292         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); //stderr
06293 
06294         return nSuccess;
06295     }
06296 
06297     return -1;
06298 }
06299 
06300 
06301 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::details_refresh_nym(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyNymID, bool & bWasMsgSent, const bool bForceDownload)
06302 {
06303     int32_t nGetAndProcessNymbox = MadeEasy::retrieve_nym(strServerID, strMyNymID, bWasMsgSent, bForceDownload);
06304 
06305     // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
06306     // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
06307     // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
06308     //
06309     // -1 is error,
06310     //  0 is reply received: failure
06311     //  1 is reply received: success
06312     //
06313     bool bReturnVal = false;
06314 
06315     switch (nGetAndProcessNymbox)
06316     {
06317     case 1:
06318         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n SUCCESS in refresh nym!\n");
06319         bReturnVal = true;
06320         break;
06321     case 0:
06322         if (bWasMsgSent) // the message was sent, and the server replied "failure".
06323         {
06324             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILURE in refresh nym!\n");
06325         }
06326         else // the message wasn't sent; the 0 in this case means "nymbox was empty."
06327         {
06328             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Success in refresh nym! (Skipped processing Nymbox, since it's empty.)\n");
06329             bReturnVal = true;
06330         }
06331         break;
06332     default:
06333         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nError in refresh nym! nGetAndProcessNymbox: " + to_string(nGetAndProcessNymbox) + "\n");
06334         break;
06335     }
06336 
06337     return bReturnVal;
06338 }
06339 
06340 
06341 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_refresh_nym()
06342 {
06343     string strUsage = concat("\n\nUsage: refreshnym --server SERVER_ID --mynym NYM_ID\n\n",
06344         "(If you don't have a NymID, then use the newnym command first.)\n\n");
06345     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06346 
06347     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
06348     {
06349         bool bWasMsgSent = false;
06350         bool bReturnVal = details_refresh_nym(Server, MyNym, bWasMsgSent, true);
06351 
06352         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n"); //stderr
06353 
06354         if (bReturnVal)
06355         {
06356             return 1;
06357         }
06358     }
06359 
06360     return -1;
06361 }
06362 
06363 
06364 // GET BOX RECEIPT          Note: from ot_made_easy.ot
06365 // Note: nBoxType is 0 for Nymbox, 1 for Inbox, and 2 for Outbox.
06366 // Also, if nBoxType is 0 (nymbox) then you have to pass the NymID in the ACCT_ID
06367 // argument, as well as the NYM_ID argument (you have to pass it twice...)
06368 // Otherwise for inbox/outbox, pass the actual ACCT_ID there as normal.
06369 //
06370 //def OT_ME::get_box_receipt(SERVER_ID, NYM_ID, ACCT_ID, nBoxType, STR_TRANS_NUM)
06371 //{
06372 //    var ot_Msg := OTAPI_Func()
06373 //    // -------------------------
06374 //    var theRequest := OTAPI_Func(ot_Msg.GET_BOX_RECEIPT, SERVER_ID, NYM_ID, ACCT_ID, nBoxType, STR_TRANS_NUM)
06375 //    string strResponse = theRequest.SendRequest(theRequest, "GET_BOX_RECEIPT")
06376 //
06377 //    return strResponse;
06378 //; }
06379 
06380 
06381 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_download_box_receipt(const string & strID, const int32_t nBoxType)
06382 {
06383     string strMyNymID = MyNym;
06384     string strAcctID;
06385 
06386     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
06387     //
06388     if (0 == nBoxType)  // It's a Nymbox he's after. (Use NymID for the AcctID, in this case.)
06389     {
06390         strAcctID = MyNym;
06391     }
06392     else // it's an inbox or outbox (needs an acct ID.)
06393     {
06394         if (!VerifyExists("MyAcct", false))
06395         {
06396             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find MyAcct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06397             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
06398             return -1;
06399         }
06400         else
06401         {
06402             strAcctID = MyAcct;
06403 
06404             // (After this point, MyNym contains the NymID, and strMyNymID contains
06405             // the NymID that corresponds to MyAcct -- they may not necessarily be
06406             // the same Nym...)
06407             //
06408             strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strAcctID);
06409 
06410             if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
06411             {
06412                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06413                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
06414                 return -1;
06415             }
06416 
06417             if (strMyNymID != MyNym)
06418             {
06419                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Found a NymID based on myacct, but MyNym is not the same ID.\n");
06420                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "To avoid any confusion, please be explicit with Nym ID:   --mynym NYM_ID \n\n");
06421                 return -1;
06422             }
06423         }
06424     }
06425     // ***************************************************************
06426 
06427     // HERE, WE SEND THE 'GET BOX RECEIPT' REQUEST TO THE SERVER
06428     //
06429     string strResponse = MadeEasy::get_box_receipt(Server, strMyNymID, strAcctID, nBoxType, strID);
06430     //  string strAttempt = "get_box_receipt"; // unused here.
06431 
06432     // ***************************************************************
06433     // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
06434     // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
06435     // handled at a lower level!
06436     //
06437     // Instead, simply check for success or failure:
06438     //
06439     int32_t nInterpretReply = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
06440 
06441     if (!VerifyIntVal(nInterpretReply) || (1 != nInterpretReply))
06442     {
06443         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "get_box_receipt: Failed. nInterpretReply is: " + to_string(nInterpretReply) + "\n");
06444         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "get_box_receipt: Perhaps that receipt is no longer in the box?\n");
06445     }
06446     else
06447     {
06448         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in get_box_receipt! Server response:\n\n");
06449         print(strResponse);
06450         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n");
06451         return 1;
06452     }
06453     // ***************************************************************
06454     //
06455     // Return status to caller.
06456     //
06457     return nInterpretReply;
06458 }
06459 
06460 
06461 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_get_box_receipt()
06462 {
06463     string strUsage = concat("\n\nUsage: getboxreceipt --server SERVER_ID --mynym NYM_ID\n\n",
06464         "Also:    --args \"box_type BOX_TYPE_ID_HERE id TRANSACTION_ID_HERE\"\nBox types are 0 (Nymbox), 1 (Inbox), 2 (Outbox)\n\n");
06465 
06466     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06467 
06468     string strID;
06469     int32_t nBoxType = 1;  // Inbox by default.
06470 
06471     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
06472     {
06473 
06474         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
06475         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
06476         // at the command line.
06477         //
06478         if (VerifyExists("Args"))
06479         {
06480             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
06481             //                                  const std::string str_key)
06482             //
06483             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
06484             // EXAMPLE:  --args "box_type 0 id 98"
06485             //
06486             string strNewID = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "id");
06487             string strNewType = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "box_type");
06488 
06489 
06490             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
06491             //
06492             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewID))
06493             {
06494                 strID = strNewID;
06495             }
06496             else
06497             {
06498                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nMissing --args \"id TRANSACTION_ID_HERE\"\n\n");
06499                 return -1;
06500             }
06501             // **************************************************************
06502             //
06503             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewType))
06504             {
06505                 nBoxType = to_int(strNewType);
06506             }
06507 
06508             if (!VerifyIntVal(nBoxType) || (nBoxType < 0) || (nBoxType > 2))
06509             {
06510                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n box_type cannot be <0 or >2. Try:  --args \"box_type 1\"\nBox types are 0 (Nymbox), 1 (Inbox), 2 (Outbox)\n\n");
06511                 return -1;
06512             }
06513 
06514             // If Inbox or Outbox, make sure we have an acct...
06515             //
06516             if ((nBoxType != 0) && !VerifyExists("MyAcct", false))
06517             {
06518                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n For inbox (1) or outbox (2) box types, need an account ID.\nMissing: --myacct ACCT_ID_HERE \n\n");
06519                 return -1;
06520             }
06521 
06522 
06523             return details_download_box_receipt(strID, nBoxType);
06524         }
06525 
06526     }
06527 
06528     return -1;
06529 }
06530 
06531 
06532 //
06533 // WITHDRAW CASH
06534 //
06535 // (from asset account on server to cash purse on client.)
06536 //
06537 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_withdraw_cash(const string & strMyAcctID, const int64_t lAmount)
06538 {
06539     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
06540     //
06541     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
06542 
06543     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
06544     {
06545         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06546         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
06547         return -1;
06548     }
06549 
06550     // MAKE SURE WE HAVE THE RIGHT ASSET CONTRACT
06551     //
06552     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcctID);
06553 
06554     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetTypeID))
06555     {
06556         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find Asset Type ID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06557         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the asset type based on the account.\n\n");
06558         return -1;
06559     }
06560 
06561     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strMyAcctID);
06562 
06563     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
06564     {
06565         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to find the server ID based on the account. Strange! Perhaps specify a different account? Use:  --myacct ACCT_ID \n");
06566         return -1;
06567     }
06568 
06569     if ((VerifyExists("Server", false) && !(strServerID == Server)))
06570     {
