06571         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "This account is on server ( " + strServerID + " -- the server is deduced based on the account), but the default server is ( " + Server + " ). To override it, use:  --server " + strServerID + " \n");
06572         return -1;
06573     }
06574 
06575     string assetContract = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadAssetContract(strAssetTypeID);
06576 
06577     if (!VerifyStringVal(assetContract))
06578     {
06579         string strResponse = MadeEasy::retrieve_contract(strServerID, strMyNymID, strAssetTypeID);
06580 
06581         if (1 != VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse))
06582         {
06583             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "details_withdraw_cash: Unable to retrieve contract for IDs: \n");
06584             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "  Server ID: " + strServerID + "\n");
06585             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "   Asset ID: " + strAssetTypeID + "\n");
06586             return -1;
06587         }
06588 
06589         assetContract = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadAssetContract(strAssetTypeID);
06590 
06591         if (!VerifyStringVal(assetContract))
06592         {
06593             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to load Asset contract even after retrieving it.\n");
06594             return -1;
06595         }
06596     }
06597     // By this point, we KNOW the appropriate asset contract is available.
06598 
06599     //
06600     // HERE, WE MAKE SURE WE HAVE THE PROPER MINT...
06601     //
06602     string strMint = MadeEasy::load_or_retrieve_mint(strServerID, strMyNymID, strAssetTypeID);
06603 
06604     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMint))
06605     {
06606         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to load or retrieve necessary mint file for withdrawal.\n");
06607         return -1;
06608     }
06609     // By this point, we know we can successfully load both:
06610     // 1. the proper asset contract.
06611     // 2. the proper (unexpired) mint file.
06612     // ***************************************************************
06613     // HERE, WE SEND THE WITHDRAWAL REQUEST TO THE SERVER
06614     //
06615 
06616     string strResponse = MadeEasy::withdraw_cash(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, lAmount);
06617     string strAttempt = "withdraw_cash";
06618     // ***************************************************************
06619 
06620     // HERE, WE INTERPRET THE SERVER REPLY, WHETHER SUCCESS, FAIL, OR ERROR...
06621 
06622     //VerifyMsgTrnxSuccess
06623     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strAttempt, strResponse);
06624 
06625     if (1 == nInterpretReply)
06626     {
06627         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
06628         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
06629         //
06630         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, false); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
06631 
06632         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nServer response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS withdrawing cash! (From account on server to local purse.) \n");
06633         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
06634     }
06635 
06636     // ***************************************************************
06637     //
06638     // Return status to caller.
06639     //
06640     return nInterpretReply;
06641 }
06642 
06643 
06644 // HERE, WE GET ALL THE ARGUMENTS TOGETHER,
06645 // and then call the above function.
06646 //
06647 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_withdraw_cash()
06648 {
06649     string strUsage = concat("\n\n  USAGE: withdraw --myacct YOUR_ASSET_ACCT \n",
06650         "You can provide an amount:  --args \"amount PUT_AMOUNT_HERE\"\n\n");
06651 
06652     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06653 
06654 
06655     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
06656     {
06657 
06658         // strAmount
06659         //
06660         string strAmount = "0"; // must be >= 1
06661 
06662         string strDefaultAmount = "1"; // must be >= 1
06663 
06664         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
06665         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
06666         // at the command line.
06667         //
06668         if (VerifyExists("Args", false)) // displayErrorMsg=false
06669         {
06670             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
06671             //                                  const std::string str_key)
06672             //
06673             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
06674             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 1"
06675             //
06676             string strNewAmount = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "amount"); // any integer value
06677 
06678 
06679             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
06680             //
06681             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount))
06682             {
06683                 strAmount = strNewAmount;
06684             }
06685         }
06686 
06687 
06688         string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
06689 
06690         // If the withdrawal parameters aren't provided, then we
06691         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
06692         //
06693         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
06694         {
06695             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the amount[" + strDefaultAmount + "]: ");
06696             strAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
06697         }
06698 
06699         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
06700         {
06701             strAmount = strDefaultAmount;
06702         }
06703 
06704         int64_t lAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount);
06705 
06706         return details_withdraw_cash(MyAcct, lAmount);   // <========================
06707     }
06708 
06709     return -1;
06710 }
06711 
06712 
06713 /*
06714 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetNymIDFromPartial),     "OT_API_Wallet_GetNymIDFromPartial")
06715 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetServerIDFromPartial),  "OT_API_Wallet_GetServerIDFromPartial")
06716 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetAssetIDFromPartial),   "OT_API_Wallet_GetAssetIDFromPartial")
06717 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetAccountIDFromPartial), "OT_API_Wallet_GetAccountIDFromPartial")
06718 
06719 */
06720 
06721 
06722 //
06723 // WITHDRAW VOUCHER
06724 //
06725 //(From asset account into instrument form,
06726 // like a cashier's cheque.)
06727 //
06728 
06729 
06730 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_withdraw_voucher(string & strOutput)
06731 {
06732     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID
06733     //
06734     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
06735 
06736     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
06737     {
06738         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06739         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
06740         return -1;
06741     }
06742 
06743     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE SERVER ID
06744     //
06745     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(MyAcct);
06746 
06747     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
06748     {
06749         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find the server ID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
06750         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the server ID based on the account.\n\n");
06751         return -1;
06752     }
06753 
06754     string strHisNymID;
06755 
06756     if (VerifyExists("HisNym")) // This ID is already validated in the C++ code (in this case.)
06757     {
06758         strHisNymID = HisNym;
06759 
06760         string strRecipientPubkey = MadeEasy::load_or_retrieve_encrypt_key(strServerID, strMyNymID, strHisNymID);
06761 
06762         if (!VerifyStringVal(strRecipientPubkey))
06763         {
06764             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to load or download pubkey for HisNym based on given value (" + strHisNymID + "). To override, use: --hisnym HIS_NYM_ID\n\n");
06765             return -1;
06766         }
06767 
06768     }
06769     else
06770     {
06771         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter recipient NymID (abbreviations accepted): ");
06772 
06773         string strHisPartialNymID = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
06774 
06775         if (VerifyStringVal(strHisPartialNymID)) // If the user typed something...
06776         {
06777             strHisNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetNymIDFromPartial(strHisPartialNymID); // Try to find the associated ID...
06778 
06779             if (!VerifyStringVal(strHisNymID)) // But if it returned NULL, failure (return.)
06780             {
06781                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find HisNym (Recipient) in your wallet. Use: --hisnym NYM_ID\n");
06782                 return -1;
06783             }
06784         }
06785 
06786         else // The user just hit "enter" so we'll default the recipient Nym to the user himself.
06787         {
06788             strHisNymID = strMyNymID;
06789         }
06790 
06791     }
06792 
06793     // ***************************************************************
06794     //
06795     // strAmount and strMemo...
06796     //
06797     string strAmount = "0"; // must ultimately be >= 1
06798     string strMemo = ""; // can be blank
06799 
06800     string strDefaultAmount = "1"; // must be >= 1
06801     string strDefaultMemo = "(blank memo field)"; // can be blank
06802 
06803     // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
06804     // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
06805     // at the command line.
06806     //
06807     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
06808 
06809     if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
06810     {
06811         // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
06812         //                                  const std::string str_key)
06813         //
06814         // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
06815         // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 1"
06816         // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 15 memo \"Just a memo for the voucher cheque.\""
06817         //
06818         string strNewAmount = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "amount"); // any integer value
06819         string strNewMemo = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "memo");     // optional memo field
06820 
06821 
06822         // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
06823         //
06824         if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount))
06825         {
06826             strAmount = strNewAmount;
06827         }
06828         if (VerifyStringVal(strNewMemo))
06829         {
06830             strMemo = strNewMemo;
06831         }
06832     }
06833 
06834     // If the transfer parameters aren't provided, then we
06835     // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
06836     //
06837     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
06838     {
06839         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the amount[" + strDefaultAmount + "]: ");
06840         strAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
06841     }
06842     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemo))
06843     {
06844         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter a memo on a single line[" + strDefaultMemo + "]: ");
06845         strMemo = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
06846     }
06847 
06848     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
06849     {
06850         strAmount = strDefaultAmount;
06851     }
06852     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMemo))
06853     {
06854         strMemo = strDefaultMemo;
06855     }
06856 
06857     // ***************************************************************
06858 
06859     // HERE, WE SEND THE VOUCHER WITHDRAWAL REQUEST TO THE SERVER
06860     //
06861     int64_t lAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount);
06862     string strResponse = MadeEasy::withdraw_voucher(strServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strHisNymID, strMemo, lAmount);
06863     string strAttempt = "withdraw_voucher";
06864     //  static int32_t withdrawVoucher(const std::string SERVER_ID,
06865     //                             const std::string USER_ID,
06866     //                             const std::string ACCT_ID,
06867     //                             const std::string RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
06868     //                             const std::string CHEQUE_MEMO,
06869     //                             const std::string AMOUNT)
06870     // ***************************************************************
06871     //
06872     // HERE, WE INTERPRET THE SERVER REPLY, WHETHER SUCCESS, FAIL, OR ERROR...
06873 
06874     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strAttempt, strResponse);
06875 
06876     if (1 == nInterpretReply) // Success!
06877     {
06878 
06879         string strLedger = OTAPI_Wrap::Message_GetLedger(strResponse);
06880 
06881         if (!VerifyStringVal(strLedger))
06882         {
06883             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n details_withdraw_voucher: Error: strLedger is null, returned by OT_API_Message_GetLedger.\n");
06884             return -1;
06885         }
06886 
06887         string strTransReply = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetTransactionByIndex(strServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strLedger, 0); // index 0.
06888 
06889         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTransReply))
06890         {
06891             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, concat("details_withdraw_voucher: Error: strTransReply is unexpectedly null, returned by ",
06892                 "OT_API_Ledger_GetTransactionByIndex, argument passed, index 0 and ledger:\n\n") + strLedger + "\n\n");
06893             return -1;
06894         }
06895 
06896 
06897         strOutput = OTAPI_Wrap::Transaction_GetVoucher(strServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strTransReply);
06898 
06899         if (!VerifyStringVal(strOutput))
06900         {
06901             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, concat("details_withdraw_voucher: Error: Voucher is unexpectedly null, returned by ",
06902                 "OT_API_Transaction_GetVoucher with strTransReply set to:\n\n") + strTransReply + "\n\n");
06903             return -1;
06904         }
06905         else
06906         {
06907             // Save a copy in my own outpayments box. I don't want to lose this voucher since it uses
06908             // one of my own transaction numbers. (If I later send the voucher to someone, OT is smart
06909             // enough to remove the first copy from outpayments, when adding the second copy.)
06910             //
06911             // Notice how I can send an instrument to myself. This doesn't actually send anything --
06912             // it just puts a copy into my outpayments box for safe-keeping.
06913             //
06914             MadeEasy::send_user_payment(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyNymID, strOutput);
06915         }
06916 
06917         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
06918         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
06919         //
06920         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServerID, strMyNymID, MyAcct, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
06921         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
06922 
06923         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "details_withdraw_voucher: Voucher returned by OT_API_Transaction_GetVoucher:\n\n"); // stderr
06924         print(strOutput); // stdout
06925         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr.
06926 
06927         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nServer response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS withdrawing voucher (cashier's cheque)!\n");
06928 
06929         return 1;
06930     }
06931 
06932     // ***************************************************************
06933     //
06934     // Return status to caller.
06935     //
06936     return nInterpretReply;
06937 }
06938 
06939 
06940 //  static int32_t withdrawVoucher(const std::string SERVER_ID,
06941 //                             const std::string USER_ID,
06942 //                             const std::string ACCT_ID,
06943 //                             const std::string RECIPIENT_USER_ID,
06944 //                             const std::string CHEQUE_MEMO,
06945 //                             const std::string AMOUNT)
06946 
06947 // HERE, WE GET ALL THE ARGUMENTS TOGETHER,
06948 // and then call the above function.
06949 //
06950 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_withdraw_voucher()
06951 {
06952     string strUsage1 = concat("\n\n  USAGE: buyvoucher --myacct YOUR_ASSET_ACCT --hisnym RECIPIENT_NYM_ID\n\n",
06953         "Also NECESSARY: --args \"amount PUT_AMOUNT_HERE\"\n");
06954     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1,
06955         "And OPTIONALLY: --args \"memo \\\"Just a memo for the voucher cheque.\\\"\"\n\n");
06956 
06957     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06958 
06959 
06960     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
06961     {
06962         string strVoucher = "";
06963         return details_withdraw_voucher(strVoucher);
06964     }
06965 
06966     return -1;
06967 }
06968 
06969 
06970 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_sendvoucher()
06971 {
06972     string strUsage1 = "Usage:  sendvoucher  --myacct MY_ASSET_ACCT --hisnym RECIPIENT_NYM_ID\n";
06973     string strUsage2 = "Server is deduced from MyAcct. This command withdraws AND SENDS the\nvoucher. (Use 'buyvoucher', not 'sendvoucher', if you don't want it to be immediately SENT.)\n";
06974     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "Optionally: --args \"memo \\\"one-line memo allowed here.\\\" amount AMOUNT\"\n", strUsage2);
06975 
06976     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
06977 
06978     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
06979     {
06980         string strCheque = "";
06981         int32_t nReturnVal = details_withdraw_voucher(strCheque);
06982 
06983         //
06984         if ((1 == nReturnVal) && VerifyStringVal(strCheque))
06985         {
06986             // stderr
06987             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n-------------------------------------------\n the voucher:\n\n");
06988             // stdout
06989             print(strCheque);
06990             // stderr
06991             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
06992 
06993             // TODO: Store a copy in outpayments box (OR VERIFY THAT IT'S ALREADY BEING DONE, WHICH I BELIEVE THAT IT IS.)
06994 
06995             string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strCheque);
06996             string strSenderNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
06997             string strRecipientNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(strCheque);
06998 
06999             if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
07000             {
07001                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve a Server ID from this voucher! Very strange. (Failure.)\n");
07002                 return -1;
07003             }
07004             if (!VerifyStringVal(strSenderNymID))
07005             {
07006                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve a Sender Nym ID from this voucher! Very strange. (Failure.)\n");
07007                 return -1;
07008             }
07009             if (!VerifyStringVal(strRecipientNymID))
07010             {
07011                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, concat("Unable to retrieve a Recipient Nym ID from this voucher! Very strange. (Failure.)\n(Although ",
07012                     "it's fine to WITHDRAW a voucher with no recipient, still need the recipient ID to SEND one.)\n"));
07013                 return -1;
07014             }
07015 
07016             string strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_payment(strServerID, strSenderNymID, strRecipientNymID, strCheque);
07017 
07018             // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
07019             // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
07020             // handled at a lower level!
07021             //
07022             // Instead, simply check for success or failure:
07023             //
07024             nReturnVal = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
07025 
07026             if (1 != nReturnVal)
07027             {
07028                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "sendvoucher: Failed.\n");
07029             }
07030             else
07031             {
07032                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success in sendvoucher! Server response:\n\n");
07033                 print(strResponse);
07034                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "(Success in sendvoucher)\n");
07035                 return 1;
07036             }
07037         }
07038 
07039         return nReturnVal;
07040     }
07041 
07042     return -1;
07043 }
07044 
07045 
07046 OT_COMMANDS_OT OTDB::MarketList * OT_Command::loadMarketList(const string & serverID)
07047 {
07048     if (!OTDB::Exists("markets", serverID, "market_data.bin", ""))
07049     {
07050         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The market list file doesn't exist.\n");
07051         return NULL;
07052     }
07053 
07054     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(1, "Markets file exists...Querying list of markets...\n");
07055 
07056     OTDB::Storable * storable = OTDB::QueryObject(OTDB::STORED_OBJ_MARKET_LIST, "markets", serverID, "market_data.bin", "");
07057     if (!VerifyStorable(storable, "OTDB::Storable"))
07058     {
07059         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed to verify storable object. Probably doesn't exist.\n");
07060         return NULL;
07061     }
07062 
07063     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(1, "QueryObject worked. Now dynamic casting from storable to marketlist...\n");
07064 
07065     OTDB::MarketList * marketList = dynamic_cast<OTDB::MarketList *>(storable);
07066     if (!VerifyStorable(marketList, "OTDB::MarketList"))
07067     {
07068         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to dynamic cast a storable to a marketlist.\n");
07069         return NULL;
07070     }
07071 
07072     return marketList;  // success.
07073 
07074     // This WAS a "load or create" sort of function, but I commented out the "create" part because
07075     // you will literally NEVER need to create this list.
07076     //
07077     //    else
07078     //    {
07079     //        OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Didn't exist. Creating market list object...\n");
07080     //        storable := OTDB::CreateObject(STORED_OBJ_MARKET_LIST)
07081     //
07082     //        if (!VerifyStorable(storable))
07083     //        {
07084     //            OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed trying to create market list object!\n");
07085     //            return storable  // containing null or undef
07086     //; }
07087     //
07088     //        OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "CreateObject worked. Now dynamic casting from storable to marketlist...\n");
07089     //        marketList := OTDB::CAST_MARKET_LIST(storable)
07090     //
07091     //        if (!VerifyStorable(marketList))
07092     //        {
07093     //            OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failed to dynamic cast from storable to marketlist.\n");
07094     //; }
07095     //; }
07096 }
07097 
07098 
07099 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_market_list()
07100 {
07101     if (VerifyExists("Server"))
07102     {
07103         if (!OTDB::Exists("markets", Server, "market_data.bin", ""))
07104         {
07105             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "No market list available.\n");
07106             return 0;
07107         }
07108 
07109         OTDB::MarketList & marketList = *loadMarketList(Server);
07110 
07111         if (!VerifyStorable(&marketList, "OTDB::MarketList"))
07112         {
07113             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to load up marketlist from local storage.\n");
07114             return -1;
07115         }
07116 
07117         // LOOP THROUGH THE MARKETS AND PRINT THEM OUT.
07118 
07119         int32_t nCount = marketList.GetMarketDataCount();
07120         if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount))
07121         {
07122             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Loaded the market list, but GetMarketDataCount returns an invalid result. (Failure.)\n");
07123         }
07124         else if (!(nCount > 0))
07125         {
07126             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Loaded the market list, but GetMarketDataCount says there aren't any markets in the list. (Returning.)\n");
07127         }
07128         else
07129         {
07130             //          print("\nIndex\tScale\tMarket\tAsset\tCurrency")
07131             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nIndex\tScale\tMarket\t\t\t\t\t\tAsset\t\t\t\t\t\tCurrency\n");
07132 
07133             for (int32_t nIndex = 0; nIndex < nCount; ++nIndex)
07134             {
07135                 OTDB::MarketData & marketData = *marketList.GetMarketData(nIndex);
07136                 if (!VerifyStorable(&marketData, "OTDB::MarketData"))
07137                 {
07138                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to reference marketData on marketList, at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + "\n");
07139                     return -1;
07140                 }
07141 
07142                 // OUTPUT THE MARKET DATA...
07143                 //
07144                 print(to_string(nIndex) + "\t" + marketData.scale + "\tM " + marketData.market_id + "\tA " + marketData.asset_type_id + "\tC " + marketData.currency_type_id);
07145             }
07146         }
07147 
07148         return 1;
07149     }
07150 
07151     return -1;
07152 }
07153 
07154 
07155 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_get_market_list()
07156 {
07157     string strUsage = "\n\n USAGE: getmarketlist --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n\n";
07158 
07159     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07160 
07161 
07162     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
07163     {
07164 
07165         // Send the request.
07166         //
07167         string strResponse = MadeEasy::get_market_list(Server, MyNym);
07168         string strAttempt = "get_market_list";
07169 
07170         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
07171         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
07172         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
07173 
07174         // ***************************************************************
07175 
07176         int32_t nInterpretReply = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
07177 
07178         if (1 == nInterpretReply)
07179         {
07180             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS getting market list.\n\n");
07181 
07182             OT_Command::main_show_market_list(); // if it was successful, then we display the list on the screen.
07183         }
07184 
07185         return nInterpretReply;
07186     }
07187 
07188     return -1;
07189 }
07190 
07191 
07192 OT_COMMANDS_OT OTDB::OfferListMarket * OT_Command::loadMarketOffers(const string & serverID, const string & marketID)
07193 {
07194     OTDB::OfferListMarket * offerList = NULL;
07195     OTDB::Storable * storable = NULL;
07196 
07197     if (OTDB::Exists("markets", serverID, "offers", marketID + ".bin"))
07198     {
07199         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(1, "Offers file exists... Querying file for market offers...\n");
07200         storable = OTDB::QueryObject(OTDB::STORED_OBJ_OFFER_LIST_MARKET, "markets", serverID, "offers", marketID + ".bin");
07201 
07202         if (!VerifyStorable(storable, "OTDB::Storable"))
07203         {
07204             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to verify storable object. Probably doesn't exist.\n");
07205             return NULL; // containing null or undef
07206         }
07207 
07208         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(1, "QueryObject worked. Now dynamic casting from storable to a (market) offerList...\n");
07209         offerList = dynamic_cast<OTDB::OfferListMarket *>(storable);
07210 
07211         if (!VerifyStorable(offerList, "OTDB::OfferListMarket"))
07212         {
07213             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to dynamic cast a storable to a (market) offerList.\n");
07214             return NULL; // containing null or undef
07215         }
07216     }
07217 
07218     return offerList;  // possibly containing the offerList (if success), or possibly containing a null/undef value (if failure.)
07219 }
07220 
07221 
07222 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_show_market_offers(const string & strServerID, const string & strMarketID)
07223 {
07224     OTDB::OfferListMarket & offerList = *loadMarketOffers(strServerID, strMarketID);
07225 
07226     if (!VerifyStorable(&offerList, "OTDB::OfferListMarket"))
07227     {
07228         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to load up a (market) offerList from local storage.\n");
07229         return -1;
07230     }
07231 
07232     // LOOP THROUGH THE BIDS AND PRINT THEM OUT.
07233     int32_t nBidCount = offerList.GetBidDataCount();  // size_t
07234     int32_t nTemp = nBidCount; // just so it's created as size_t
07235 
07236     if (VerifyIntVal(nBidCount) && (nBidCount > 0))
07237     {
07238         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n** BIDS **\n\nIndex\tTrans#\tPrice\tAvailable\n");
07239 
07240         for (int32_t nIndex = 0; nIndex < nBidCount; ++nIndex)
07241         {
07242             OTDB::BidData & offerData = *offerList.GetBidData(nIndex);
07243             if (!VerifyStorable(&offerData, "OTDB::BidData"))
07244             {
07245                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to reference bidData on offerList, at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + "\n");
07246                 return -1;
07247             }
07248 
07249             // OUTPUT THE BID OFFER DATA...
07250             //
07251             print(to_string(nIndex) + "\t" + offerData.transaction_id + "\t" + offerData.price_per_scale + "\t" + offerData.available_assets);
07252         }
07253     }
07254 
07255     // LOOP THROUGH THE ASKS AND PRINT THEM OUT.
07256     int32_t nAskCount = offerList.GetAskDataCount();
07257 
07258     if (VerifyIntVal(nAskCount) && (nAskCount > 0))
07259     {
07260         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n** ASKS **\n\nIndex\tTrans#\tPrice\tAvailable\n");
07261 
07262         for (int32_t nIndex = 0; nIndex < nAskCount; ++nIndex)
07263         {
07264             nTemp = nIndex;
07265             OTDB::AskData & offerData = *offerList.GetAskData(nTemp);
07266 
07267             if (!VerifyStorable(&offerData, "OTDB::AskData"))
07268             {
07269                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to reference askData on offerList, at index: " + to_string(nIndex) + "\n");
07270                 return -1;
07271             }
07272 
07273             // OUTPUT THE ASK OFFER DATA...
07274             //
07275             print(to_string(nIndex) + "\t" + offerData.transaction_id + "\t" + offerData.price_per_scale + "\t" + offerData.available_assets);
07276         }
07277     }
07278 
07279     return 1;
07280 }
07281 
07282 
07283 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::impl_show_market_offers(string & strMarket)
07284 {
07285     string strUsage1 = "\n\n USAGE: showoffers --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n";
07286     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1, "Also: --args \"market MARKET_ID\"\n");
07287 
07288     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07289 
07290 
07291     if (VerifyExists("Server"))
07292     {
07293 
07294         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
07295         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
07296         // at the command line.
07297         //
07298         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMarket) && VerifyExists("Args", false))
07299         {
07300             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
07301             //                                  const std::string str_key)
07302             //
07303             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
07304             // EXAMPLE:  --args "market MARKET_ID"
07305             //
07306             string strNewMarket = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "market"); // the market ID
07307 
07308             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
07309             //
07310             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewMarket))
07311             {
07312                 strMarket = strNewMarket;
07313             }
07314         }
07315 
07316         // If the transfer parameters aren't provided, then we
07317         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
07318         //
07319         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMarket))
07320         {
07321             OT_Command::main_show_market_list();
07322 
07323             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nEnter the market ID: ");
07324             strMarket = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
07325         }
07326 
07327         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMarket))
07328         {
07329             return -1;
07330         }
07331 
07332 
07333         return details_show_market_offers(Server, strMarket);
07334     }
07335 
07336     return -1;
07337 }
07338 
07339 
07340 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_market_offers()
07341 {
07342     string strMarket;
07343 
07344     return impl_show_market_offers(strMarket);
07345 }
07346 
07347 
07348 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_get_market_offers()
07349 {
07350     string strUsage1 = "\n\n USAGE: getoffers --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n";
07351     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1, "Also: --args \"market MARKET_ID depth MAX_DEPTH\"\n");
07352 
07353     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07354 
07355 
07356     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
07357     {
07358         string strMarket = ""; // must ultimately be an ID.
07359         string strDepth = ""; // can be blank
07360 
07361         string strDefaultDepth = "50"; // can be blank
07362 
07363         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
07364         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
07365         // at the command line.
07366         //
07367         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
07368         {
07369             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
07370             //                                  const std::string str_key)
07371             //
07372             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
07373             // EXAMPLE:  --args "market MARKET_ID depth 50"
07374             //
07375             string strNewMarket = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "market"); // the market ID
07376             string strNewDepth = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "depth");    // how many offers should we retrieve?
07377 
07378 
07379             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
07380             //
07381             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewMarket))
07382             {
07383                 strMarket = strNewMarket;
07384             }
07385             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewDepth))
07386             {
07387                 strDepth = strNewDepth;
07388             }
07389         }
07390 
07391         // If the transfer parameters aren't provided, then we
07392         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
07393         //
07394         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMarket))
07395         {
07396             OT_Command::main_show_market_list();
07397 
07398             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nEnter the market ID: ");
07399             strMarket = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
07400         }
07401         if (!VerifyStringVal(strDepth))
07402         {
07403             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter a max depth on a single line[" + strDepth + "]: ");
07404             strDepth = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
07405         }
07406 
07407         if (!VerifyStringVal(strMarket))
07408         {
07409             return -1;
07410         }
07411         if (!VerifyStringVal(strDepth))
07412         {
07413             strDepth = strDefaultDepth;
07414         }
07415 
07416         // Send the request.
07417         //
07418         int64_t lDepth = to_long(strDepth);
07419         string strResponse = MadeEasy::get_market_offers(Server, MyNym, strMarket, lDepth);
07420         string strAttempt = "get_market_offers";
07421 
07422         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
07423         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
07424         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
07425 
07426         // ***************************************************************
07427 
07428         int32_t nInterpretReply = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
07429 
07430         if (1 == nInterpretReply)
07431         {
07432             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS getting market offers.\n\n");
07433 
07434             impl_show_market_offers(strMarket); // if it was successful, then we display the list on the screen.
07435         }
07436 
07437         return nInterpretReply;
07438     }
07439 
07440     return -1;
07441 }
07442 
07443 
07444 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_adjust_usage_credits()
07445 {
07446     string strUsage1 = concat("\n\n  Options: --server SERVER_ID --mynym NYM_ID\n",
07447         "           --hisnym SUBJECT_NYM_ID\n\n");
07448 
07449     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "To adjust (change) a Nym's usage credits: --args \"adjust POSITIVE_OR_NEGATIVE_VALUE\" \n (Used for giving or taking away usage credits.)\n",
07450         "For example, --args \"adjust 10000\"   or:  --args \"adjust -100\" \n\nFYI, this command also retrieves the current usage credits,\nand any Nym can use it on himself, read-only.\n\n");
07451 
07452     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07453 
07454     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("HisNym"))
07455     {
07456         string strAdjustment = "0";
07457 
07458         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
07459         {
07460             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
07461             //                                  const std::string str_key)
07462             //
07463             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
07464             // EXAMPLE:  --args "adjust 1"
07465             //
07466             string strNewAdjust = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "adjust"); // any positive or negative integer value, or zero.
07467 
07468 
07469             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
07470             //
07471             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAdjust))
07472             {
07473                 strAdjustment = strNewAdjust;
07474             }
07475         }
07476 
07477         string strResponse = MadeEasy::adjust_usage_credits(Server, MyNym, HisNym, strAdjustment);
07478         int32_t nStatus = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
07479 
07480         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
07481         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
07482         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
07483         //
07484         // -1 is error,
07485         //  0 is reply received: failure
07486         //  1 is reply received: success
07487         //
07488         switch (nStatus)
07489         {
07490         case 1:
07491         {
07492                   OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Server response:\n\n");
07493                   print(strResponse); // stdout
07494 
07495                   // IF THE_MESSAGE is of command type @usageCredits, and IF it was a SUCCESS,
07496                   // then this function returns the usage credits BALANCE (it's a int64_t int32_t, but
07497                   // passed as a string). If you adjusted the balance using the usageCredits
07498                   // command (THE_MESSAGE being the server's reply to that) then you will see
07499                   // the balance AFTER the adjustment. (The current "Usage Credits" balance.)
07500                   //
07501                   int64_t lNewUsageBalance = OTAPI_Wrap::Message_GetUsageCredits(strResponse);
07502                   string strNewUsageBalance = VerifyIntVal(lNewUsageBalance) ? to_string(lNewUsageBalance) : "";
07503 
07504                   if (!VerifyStringVal(strNewUsageBalance))
07505                   {
07506                       strNewUsageBalance = "(Error while calling API to retrieve usage credits from server reply.)";
07507                   }
07508                   else if (int64_t(-2) == lNewUsageBalance)
07509                   {
07510                       strNewUsageBalance = "Error code -2, while attempting to retrieve usage credits from this server reply.";
07511                   }
07512                   else if (int64_t(-1) == lNewUsageBalance)
07513                   {
07514                       strNewUsageBalance = concat("Either Nym has unlimited usage credits, or server has its usage credit enforcement turned off.\n",
07515                           "(Either way, Nym is good to go, since -1 was returned as his 'credits balance'.)");
07516                   }
07517                   else if (int64_t(0) == lNewUsageBalance)
07518                   {
07519                       strNewUsageBalance = concat("Nym appears to have exhausted his supply of usage credits.\n",
07520                           "(0 was returned as his 'credits balance'.)");
07521                   }
07522                   else
07523                   {
07524                       strNewUsageBalance = concat("Nym currently has " + to_string(lNewUsageBalance), " usage credits.");
07525                   }
07526 
07527                   string strOutput = concat("\n\n adjust_usage_credits -- reply: " + strNewUsageBalance,
07528                       "\n\n(FYI, this server message is the only and proper way to query for your own current usage credits balance, or also to set someone else's.)\n\n");
07529                   OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strOutput);
07530 
07531                   break;
07532         }
07533         case 0:
07534             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nServer response:\n\n");
07535             print(strResponse); // stdout
07536             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n FAILURE in adjust_usage_credits!\n\n");
07537             break;
07538         default:
07539             if (VerifyStringVal(strResponse))
07540             {
07541                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response:\n\n");
07542                 print(strResponse); // stdout
07543             }
07544             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nError in adjust_usage_credits! nStatus is: " + to_string(nStatus) + "\n");
07545             break;
07546         }
07547 
07548         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); //stderr
07549 
07550         return (0 == nStatus) ? -1 : nStatus;
07551     }
07552 
07553     return -1;
07554 }
07555 
07556 
07557 /*
07558 //      pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::gui_label),          "gui_label");
07559 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::valid_from),         "valid_from");
07560 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::valid_to),           "valid_to");
07561 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::server_id),          "server_id");
07562 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::asset_type_id),      "asset_type_id");
07563 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::asset_acct_id),      "asset_acct_id");
07564 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::currency_type_id),   "currency_type_id");
07565 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::currency_acct_id),   "currency_acct_id");
07566 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::selling),            "selling");
07567 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::scale),              "scale");
07568 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::price_per_scale),    "price_per_scale");
07569 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::transaction_id),     "transaction_id");
07570 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::total_assets),       "total_assets");
07571 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::finished_so_far),    "finished_so_far");
07572 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::minimum_increment),  "minimum_increment");
07573 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::stop_sign),          "stop_sign");
07574 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTDB::OfferDataNym::stop_price),         "stop_price");
07575 
07576 OT_CHAI_CONTAINER(OfferListNym, OfferDataNym);
07577 */
07578 
07579 
07580 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_show_nym_offers(const string & strServerID, const string & strNymID)
07581 {
07582     string strLocation = "details_show_nym_offers";
07583 
07584     OTDB::OfferListNym & offerList = *loadNymOffers(strServerID, strNymID);
07585 
07586     if (!VerifyStorable(&offerList, "OTDB::OfferListNym"))
07587     {
07588         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to load up a (nym) offerList from local storage. Probably doesn't exist.\n");
07589         return -1;
07590     }
07591 
07592     // LOOP THROUGH THE OFFERS and sort them into a map_of_maps, key is: scale-assetID-currencyID
07593     // the value for each key is a sub-map, with the key: transaction ID and value: the offer data itself.
07594     //
07595     int32_t nCount = offerList.GetOfferDataNymCount(); // size_t
07596     if (VerifyIntVal(nCount) && (nCount > 0))
07597     {
07598         MapOfMaps & map_of_maps = *convert_offerlist_to_maps(offerList);
07599 
07600         if (!VerifyType(&map_of_maps, "Map"))
07601         {
07602             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to convert offer list to map of offers. Perhaps it's empty?\n");
07603             return -1;
07604         }
07605 
07606         // output_nymoffer_data is called for each offer, for this nym,
07607         // as it iterates through the maps.
07608         //
07609         // iterate_nymoffers_maps takes a final parameter extra_vals (not seen here)
07610         // Other sections in the code which use iterate_nymoffers_maps might pass a value
07611         // here, or expect one to be returned through the same mechansim.
07612         //
07613         int32_t nIterated = iterate_nymoffers_maps(map_of_maps, output_nymoffer_data); // low level. map_of_maps must be good. (assumed.)
07614 
07615         if (-1 == nIterated)
07616         {
07617             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error trying to iterate nym's offers.\n");
07618             return -1;
07619         }
07620     }
07621 
07622     return 1;
07623 }
07624 
07625 
07626 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_nym_offers()
07627 {
07628     string strUsage = "\n\n USAGE: showmyoffers --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n\n";
07629 
07630     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07631 
07632 
07633     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
07634     {
07635         return details_show_nym_offers(Server, MyNym);
07636     }
07637 
07638     return -1;
07639 }
07640 
07641 
07642 OT_COMMANDS_OT string OT_Command::details_get_nym_market_offers(const string & strServerID, const string & strNymID)
07643 {
07644     string strResponse;
07645 
07646     if (VerifyStringVal(strServerID) && VerifyStringVal(strNymID))
07647     {
07648         // Send the request.
07649         //
07650         strResponse = MadeEasy::get_nym_market_offers(strServerID, strNymID);
07651 
07652         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
07653         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
07654         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
07655     }
07656 
07657     return strResponse;
07658 }
07659 
07660 
07661 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_get_nym_market_offers()
07662 {
07663 
07664     string strUsage = "\n\n USAGE: getmyoffers --server SERVER_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n";
07665 
07666     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07667 
07668     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym"))
07669     {
07670 
07671         // Send the request.
07672         //
07673         string strResponse = details_get_nym_market_offers(Server, MyNym);
07674         string strAttempt = "get_nym_market_offers";
07675 
07676         // NOTICE: No need here to deal with retries, timeouts, request number,
07677         // syncing transaction number, download / process nymbox, etc! It's all
07678         // handled at a lower level!  Instead, simply check for success or failure:
07679 
07680         // ***************************************************************
07681 
07682         int32_t nInterpretReply = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
07683 
07684         if (1 == nInterpretReply)
07685         {
07686             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS getting nym's market offers.\n\n");
07687 
07688             OT_Command::main_show_nym_offers(); // if it was successful, then we display the list on the screen.
07689         }
07690 
07691         return nInterpretReply;
07692     }
07693 
07694     return -1;
07695 }
07696 
07697 
07698 //
07699 // PAY DIVIDEND
07700 //
07701 // Just like withdraw voucher...except instead of withdrawing a single voucher to yourself,
07702 // it removes the total dividend payout from your account, and then divides it up amongst the
07703 // shareholders, sending them EACH a voucher cheque in the amount of strAmount * number of shares owned.
07704 //
07705 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_pay_dividend(const string & strAmount, const string & strMemo)
07706 {
07707     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
07708     //
07709     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(MyAcct);
07710 
07711     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
07712     {
07713         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find Payer NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct DIVIDEND_SOURCE_ACCT_ID\n");
07714         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account (that the dividends will be paid out of) must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on that account.\n\n");
07715         return -1;
07716     }
07717 
07718 
07719     string strHisPurse;
07720 
07721     if (VerifyExists("HisPurse")) // This ID is already validated in the C++ code (in this case.)
07722     {
07723         strHisPurse = HisPurse;
07724     }
07725     else
07726     {
07727         while (true)
07728         {
07729             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the SHARES asset type ID (Nym must also be the issuer for these shares): ");
07730             string strHisPartialPurseID = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
07731 
07732             if (VerifyStringVal(strHisPartialPurseID)) // If the user typed something...
07733             {
07734                 strHisPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_GetAssetIDFromPartial(strHisPartialPurseID); // Try to find the associated ID...
07735 
07736                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strHisPurse)) // But if it returned NULL, failure (return.)
07737                 {
07738                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find SHARES_ASSET_TYPE_ID in your wallet. Use: --hispurse SHARES_ASSET_TYPE_ID\n");
07739                     return -1;
07740                 }
07741                 break;
07742             }
07743         }
07744     }
07745 
07746     // ***************************************************************
07747 
07748     // HERE, WE SEND THE PAY DIVIDEND REQUEST TO THE SERVER
07749     //
07750 
07751     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
07752 
07753     int64_t lAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount);
07754     string strResponse = MadeEasy::pay_dividend(Server, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strHisPurse, strMemo, lAmount);
07755     string strAttempt = "pay_dividend";
07756 
07757     //static int32_t payDividend(const std::string SERVER_ID,
07758     //                       const std::string ISSUER_USER_ID,
07759     //                       const std::string DIVIDEND_FROM_ACCT_ID,
07760     //                       const std::string SHARES_ASSET_TYPE_ID,
07761     //                       const std::string DIVIDEND_MEMO,
07762     //                       const std::string AMOUNT_PER_SHARE);
07763     // ***************************************************************
07764 
07765     // HERE, WE INTERPRET THE SERVER REPLY, WHETHER SUCCESS, FAIL, OR ERROR...
07766 
07767     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(Server, strMyNymID, MyAcct, strAttempt, strResponse);
07768 
07769     if (1 == nInterpretReply) // Success!
07770     {
07771 
07772         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
07773         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
07774         //
07775         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(Server, strMyNymID, MyAcct, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
07776         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
07777 
07778         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nServer response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS paying out dividends.\n");
07779     }
07780 
07781     return nInterpretReply;
07782 }
07783 
07784 
07785 //static int32_t payDividend(const std::string SERVER_ID,
07786 //                       const std::string ISSUER_USER_ID,
07787 //                       const std::string DIVIDEND_FROM_ACCT_ID,
07788 //                       const std::string SHARES_ASSET_TYPE_ID,
07789 //                       const std::string DIVIDEND_MEMO,
07790 //                       const std::string AMOUNT_PER_SHARE);
07791 
07792 // HERE, WE GET ALL THE ARGUMENTS TOGETHER,
07793 // and then call the above function.
07794 //
07795 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_pay_dividend()
07796 {
07797     string strUsage1 = concat("\n\n  USAGE: paydividend --server SERVER_ID --mynym SHARES_ISSUER_NYM_ID\n",
07798         "             --myacct DIVIDEND_SOURCE_ACCT_ID --hispurse SHARES_ASSET_TYPE_ID\n\n");
07799 
07800     string strUsage = concat(strUsage1 + "Also necessary: --args \"amount PAYOUT_AMOUNT_PER_SHARE\"\n",
07801         "And OPTIONALLY: --args \"memo \\\"Just a memo for the dividend payment.\\\"\"\n\n");
07802 
07803     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07804 
07805 
07806     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
07807     {
07808         // strAmount and strNote...
07809         //
07810         string strAmount = "0"; // must ultimately be >= 1  (Payout per share.)
07811         string strNote = ""; // can be blank
07812 
07813         string strDefaultAmount = "1"; // must be >= 1
07814         string strDefaultNote = "(blank memo field)"; // can be blank
07815 
07816         // If custom arguments have been passed on the command line,
07817         // then grab them and use them instead of asking the user to enter them
07818         // at the command line.
07819         //
07820         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
07821         {
07822             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
07823             //                                  const std::string str_key)
07824             //
07825             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
07826             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 1"
07827             // EXAMPLE:  --args "amount 15 memo \"Just a memo for the dividend payout.\""
07828             //
07829             string strNewAmount = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "amount"); // any integer value
07830             string strNewNote = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "memo");     // optional memo field
07831 
07832 
07833             // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
07834             //
07835             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewAmount))
07836             {
07837                 strAmount = strNewAmount;
07838             }
07839             if (VerifyStringVal(strNewNote))
07840             {
07841                 strNote = strNewNote;
07842             }
07843         }
07844 
07845 
07846         string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(MyAcct);
07847 
07848         // If the transfer parameters aren't provided, then we
07849         // ask the user to supply them at the command line.
07850         //
07851         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
07852         {
07853             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Enter the 'Payout Amount Per-Share'[" + strDefaultAmount + "]: ");
07854             strAmount = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
07855         }
07856         if (!VerifyStringVal(strNote))
07857         {
07858             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Optionally, enter a memo on a single line[" + strDefaultNote + "]: ");
07859             strNote = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
07860         }
07861 
07862         if (!VerifyStringVal(strAmount) || (OTAPI_Wrap::StringToAmount(strAssetTypeID, strAmount) < 1))
07863         {
07864             strAmount = strDefaultAmount;
07865         }
07866         if (!VerifyStringVal(strNote))
07867         {
07868             strNote = strDefaultNote;
07869         }
07870 
07871 
07872         return details_pay_dividend(strAmount, strNote);
07873     }
07874 
07875     return -1;
07876 }
07877 
07878 
07879 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_purse()
07880 {
07881     string strUsage = "\n\n  USAGE: showpurse --mypurse ASSET_TYPE_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID --server SERVER_ID \n\n";
07882     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
07883 
07884 
07885     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("MyPurse"))
07886     {
07887 
07888         string strPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPurse(Server, MyPurse, MyNym); // returns NULL, or a purse.
07889 
07890         if (!VerifyStringVal(strPurse))
07891         {
07892             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n OT_Command::main_show_purse: Unable to load purse. Does it even exist?\n");
07893         }
07894         else
07895         {
07896             int64_t lAmount = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_GetTotalValue(Server, MyPurse, strPurse);
07897 
07898             print("\n\nTOTAL VALUE: " + OTAPI_Wrap::FormatAmount(MyPurse, lAmount));
07899 
07900 
07901             // Loop through purse contents and display tokens.
07902             int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Count(Server, MyPurse, strPurse);
07903             if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount) || (nCount < 0))
07904             {
07905                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n OT_Command::main_show_purse: Error: Unexpected bad value returned from OT_API_Purse_Count.\n\n");
07906                 return -1;
07907             }
07908 
07909 
07910             if (nCount > 0)
07911             {
07912                 print("Token count: " + to_string(nCount) + "\n");
07913                 print("Index\tValue\tSeries\tValidFrom\tValidTo\t\tStatus");
07914 
07915                 int32_t nIndex = -1;
07916 
07917                 while (nCount > 0)
07918                 {
07919                     --nCount;
07920                     ++nIndex;  // on first iteration, this is now 0.
07921 
07922                     string strToken = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Peek(Server, MyPurse, MyNym, strPurse);
07923 
07924                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strToken))
07925                     {
07926                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "main_show_purse: Error: OT_API_Purse_Peek unexpectedly returned NULL instead of token.\n");
07927                         return -1;
07928                     }
07929 
07930 
07931                     string strNewPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Pop(Server, MyPurse, MyNym, strPurse);
07932 
07933                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strNewPurse))
07934                     {
07935                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "main_show_purse: Error: OT_API_Purse_Pop unexpectedly returned NULL instead of updated purse.\n");
07936                         return -1;
07937                     }
07938 
07939                     strPurse = strNewPurse;
07940 
07941                     int64_t lDenomination = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetDenomination(Server, MyPurse, strToken);
07942                     int32_t nSeries = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetSeries(Server, MyPurse, strToken);
07943                     time64_t tValidFrom = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetValidFrom(Server, MyPurse, strToken);
07944                     time64_t tValidTo = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetValidTo(Server, MyPurse, strToken);
07945                     time64_t lTime = OTAPI_Wrap::GetTime();
07946 
07947                     if (0 > lDenomination)
07948                     {
07949                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad lDenomination.\n");
07950                         return -1;
07951                     }
07952                     if (!VerifyIntVal(nSeries))
07953                     {
07954                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad nSeries.\n");
07955                         return -1;
07956                     }
07957                     if (!VerifyTimeVal(tValidFrom))
07958                     {
07959                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad tValidFrom.\n");
07960                         return -1;
07961                     }
07962                     if (!VerifyTimeVal(tValidTo))
07963                     {
07964                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad tValidTo.\n");
07965                         return -1;
07966                     }
07967                     if (OT_TIME_ZERO > lTime)
07968                     {
07969                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad strTime.\n");
07970                         return -1;
07971                     }
07972 
07973                     // Output the token...
07974 
07975                     string strStatus = (lTime > tValidTo) ? "expired" : "valid";
07976 
07977                     print(to_string(nIndex) + "\t" + to_string(lDenomination) + "\t" + to_string(nSeries) + "\t" + to_string(tValidFrom) + "\t" + to_string(tValidTo) + "\t" + strStatus);
07978 
07979                 } // while
07980             } // if nCount > 0
07981 
07982             return 1;
07983 
07984         } // valid purse string was loaded.
07985 
07986     }
07987 
07988     return -1;
07989 }
07990 
07991 
07992 //
07993 //
07994 // THESE FUNCTIONS were added for the PAYMENTS screen. (They are fairly new.)
07995 //
07996 // Basically there was a need to have DIFFERENT instruments, but to be able to
07997 // treat them as though they are a single type.
07998 //
07999 // In keeping with that, the below functions will work with disparate types.
08000 // You can pass [ CHEQUES / VOUCHERS / INVOICES ] and PAYMENT PLANS, and
08001 // SMART CONTRACTS, and PURSEs into these functions, and they should be able
08002 // to handle any of those types.
08003 //
08004 //
08005 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAmount(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08006 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetTransNum(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08007 //
08008 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidFrom(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08009 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidTo(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08010 //
08011 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetMemo(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08012 //
08013 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08014 //
08015 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08016 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderAcctID(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08017 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08018 //const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientAcctID(const char * SERVER_ID, const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08019 //
08020 
08021 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_deposit_cheque(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyAcct, const string & strMyNymID, const string & strInstrument, const string & strType)
08022 {
08023     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(strInstrument);
08024 
08025     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetTypeID))
08026     {
08027         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find Asset Type ID on the instrument.\n\n");
08028         return -1;
08029     }
08030 
08031     string strAssetTypeAcct = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcct);
08032 
08033     if (strAssetTypeID != strAssetTypeAcct)
08034     {
08035         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Asset Type ID on the instrument ( " + strAssetTypeID + " ) doesn't match the one on the MyAcct ( " + strAssetTypeAcct + " )\n\n");
08036         return -1;
08037     }
08038 
08039     // HERE, WE SEND THE DEPOSIT CHEQUE REQUEST TO THE SERVER
08040     //
08041     string strResponse = MadeEasy::deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcct, strInstrument);
08042     string strAttempt = "deposit_cheque";
08043 
08044     // ***************************************************************
08045 
08046     // HERE, WE INTERPRET THE SERVER REPLY, WHETHER SUCCESS, FAIL, OR ERROR...
08047 
08048     int32_t nInterpretReply = InterpretTransactionMsgReply(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcct, strAttempt, strResponse);
08049 
08050     if (1 == nInterpretReply)
08051     {
08052         // Download all the intermediary files (account balance, inbox, outbox, etc)
08053         // since they have probably changed from this operation.
08054         //
08055         bool bRetrieved = MadeEasy::retrieve_account(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyAcct, true); //bForceDownload defaults to false.
08056 
08057         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Server response (" + strAttempt + "): SUCCESS!\n");
08058         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, string(bRetrieved ? "Success" : "Failed") + " retrieving intermediary files for account.\n");
08059     }
08060 
08061     // ***************************************************************
08062     //
08063     // Return status to caller.
08064     //
08065     return nInterpretReply;
08066 
08067 
08068 }
08069 
08070 
08071 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_deposit_purse(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyAcct, const string & strFromNymID, const string & strInstrument, const string & strIndices)
08072 {
08073     string strLocation = "details_deposit_purse";
08074 
08075     string strTHE_Instrument = "";
08076 
08077     if (VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
08078     {
08079         strTHE_Instrument = strInstrument;
08080     }
08081 
08082     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE asset type ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
08083     //
08084     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcct);
08085 
08086     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetTypeID))
08087     {
08088         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find Asset Type ID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
08089         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the asset type based on the account.\n\n");
08090         return -1;
08091     }
08092 
08093     if (VerifyExists("MyPurse", false) && (MyPurse != strAssetTypeID))
08094     {
08095         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Warning: Depositing to MyAcct, which is NOT the same asset type as the MyPurse asset type specified.\n");
08096     }
08097 
08098 
08099     bool bLoadedPurse = false;
08100 
08101     // If strInstrument wasn't passed, that means we're supposed to load
08102     // the purse ourselves, from local storage.
08103     //
08104     if (!VerifyStringVal(strTHE_Instrument))
08105     {
08106         // LOAD PURSE
08107 
08108         strTHE_Instrument = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPurse(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strFromNymID); // returns NULL, or a purse.
08109 
08110         if (!VerifyStringVal(strTHE_Instrument))
08111         {
08112             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n " + strLocation + ": Unable to load purse from local storage. Does it even exist?\n");
08113             return -1;
08114         }
08115 
08116         bLoadedPurse = true;
08117     }
08118 
08119     // Below this point, we know that strTHE_Instrument contains either the purse as it was passed in
08120     // to us, or it contains the purse as we loaded it from local storage.
08121     // If it WAS from local storage, then there's a chance that strIndices contains "all" or "4, 6, 2" etc.
08122     // If that's the case, then we need to iterate through the purse, and add the denoted token IDs to
08123     // a vector (selectedTokens) and pass it into depositCashPurse.
08124     //
08125 
08126 
08127     vector<string> vecSelectedTokenIDs;
08128 
08129     // If we loaded the purse (vs the user pasting one in...)
08130     // then the user might have wanted to deposit only selected indices,
08131     // rather than ALL the tokens in that purse.
08132     // So we'll loop through the purse and add any relevant IDs to the
08133     // "selected" list, since the actual Token IDs must be passed.
08134     //
08135     if (bLoadedPurse)
08136     {
08137 
08138         // Loop through purse contents...
08139         //
08140         int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Count(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strTHE_Instrument);
08141         if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount) || (nCount < 0))
08142         {
08143             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n " + strLocation + ": Error: Unexpected bad value returned from OT_API_Purse_Count.\n\n");
08144             return -1;
08145         }
08146 
08147         if (nCount < 1)
08148         {
08149             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n " + strLocation + ": The purse is empty, so you can't deposit it.\n\n");
08150             return -1;
08151         }
08152 
08153         else //nCount >= 1
08154         {
08155             // Make a copy of the purse passed in, so we can iterate it and find the
08156             // appropriate Token IDs...
08157 
08158             string strPurse = strTHE_Instrument;
08159 
08160             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices))
08161             {
08162                 int32_t nIndex = -1;
08163 
08164                 while (nCount > 0)
08165                 {
08166                     --nCount;
08167                     ++nIndex;  // on first iteration, this is now 0.
08168 
08169                     //                  string strOwner = bPasswordProtected ? "" : strFromNymID
08170 
08171                     // NOTE: Owner can ONLY be strFromNymID in here, since bLoadedPurse
08172                     // is only true in the case where we LOADED the purse from local storage.
08173                     // (Therefore this DEFINITELY is not a password-protected purse.)
08174                     //
08175                     string strToken = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Peek(strServerID, strAssetTypeID,
08176                         strFromNymID,
08177                         strPurse);
08178 
08179                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strToken))
08180                     {
08181                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: OT_API_Purse_Peek unexpectedly returned NULL instead of token.\n");
08182                         return -1;
08183                     }
08184 
08185                     string strNewPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Pop(strServerID, strAssetTypeID,
08186                         strFromNymID,
08187                         strPurse);
08188 
08189                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strNewPurse))
08190                     {
08191                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: OT_API_Purse_Pop unexpectedly returned NULL instead of updated purse.\n");
08192                         return -1;
08193                     }
08194 
08195                     strPurse = strNewPurse;
08196 
08197                     string strTokenID = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetID(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08198 
08199                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strTokenID))
08200                     {
08201                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error while depositing purse: bad strTokenID.\n");
08202                         return -1;
08203                     }
08204 
08205                     if (!("all" == strIndices) && OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nIndex))) // empty vector should be interpreted already as "all"
08206                     {
08207                         vecSelectedTokenIDs.push_back(strTokenID);
08208                     }
08209 
08210                 } // while
08211             } // if strIndices
08212         } // if nCount > 0
08213     }// if (bLoadedPurse)
08214 
08215 
08216     int32_t nResult = MadeEasy::depositCashPurse(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strFromNymID, strTHE_Instrument, vecSelectedTokenIDs, strMyAcct, bLoadedPurse);
08217 
08218     return nResult;
08219 
08220 }
08221 
08222 
08223 //case (this.DEPOSIT_CASH)
08224 //{ nRetVal = OTAPI_Wrap::notarizeDeposit(this.serverID, this.nymID, this.accountID, this.strData);  break; }
08225 //case (this.DEPOSIT_CHEQUE)
08226 //{ nRetVal = OTAPI_Wrap::depositCheque(this.serverID, this.nymID, this.accountID, this.strData);  break; }
08227 //case (this.DEPOSIT_PAYMENT_PLAN)
08228 //{ nRetVal = OTAPI_Wrap::depositPaymentPlan(this.serverID, this.nymID, this.strData);  break; }
08229 
08230 
08231 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_deposit(const string & strServerID, const string & strMyAcctID)
08232 {
08233     string strInstrument = "";
08234 
08235 
08236     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE recipient NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
08237     //
08238     string strToNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
08239 
08240     if (!VerifyStringVal(strToNymID))
08241     {
08242         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to find depositor NymID based on account ( " + strMyAcctID + " ).\nUse: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
08243         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
08244         return -1;
08245     }
08246 
08247     //
08248     string strIndices = "";
08249 
08250     if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
08251     {
08252         // You have the OPTION to pass in indices for tokens in your purse, and deposit
08253         // will automatically assume "deposit cash" and deposit those tokens.
08254         // You can also specify to deposit ALL tokens in your cash purse.
08255         // Without this extra argument, OT will ask you to paste an instrument,
08256         // and then will dynamically determine its contract type.
08257         //
08258 
08259         // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
08260         //                                  const std::string str_key)
08261         //
08262         // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
08263         // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
08264         // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices all"
08265         //
08266         strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
08267     }
08268 
08269     //
08270     if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices)) // He wants to deposit some or all of his local purse.
08271     {
08272         // Only in the case of cash, it's possible you have some cash in Nym A's purse, but
08273         // you want to deposit it into Nym B's account. So we have a "to" Nym and a "from" Nym
08274         // even though they will often be the same.
08275         //
08276         string strFromNymID = "";
08277 
08278         if (VerifyExists("MyNym", false))
08279         {
08280             strFromNymID = MyNym;
08281         }
08282         else
08283         {
08284             strFromNymID = strToNymID;
08285         }
08286 
08287         // In this case, strInstrument is blank.
08288         // That's how the callee knows that we're working with the local purse.
08289         // Then strIndices tells him either to use "all" tokens in that purse, or
08290         // the selected indices.
08291         //
08292         return details_deposit_purse(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strFromNymID, strInstrument, strIndices);
08293     }
08294 
08295     else // he wants to paste an instrument.
08296     {
08297         //
08298         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "You can deposit a PURSE (containing cash tokens) or a CHEQUE / VOUCHER. \n");
08299         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Paste your financial instrument here, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line: \n");
08300 
08301         strInstrument = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
08302 
08303         if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
08304         {
08305             return -1;
08306         }
08307 
08308 
08309         //      const char * OTPayment::_TypeStrings[] =
08310         //      {
08311         //          // ------------------
08312         //          // OTCheque is derived from OTTrackable, which is derived from OTInstrument, which is
08313         //          // derived from OTScriptable, which is derived from OTContract.
08314         //          // ------------------
08315         //          "CHEQUE",         // A cheque drawn on a user's account.
08316         //          "VOUCHER",        // A cheque drawn on a server account (cashier's cheque aka banker's cheque)
08317         //          "INVOICE",        // A cheque with a negative amount. (Depositing this causes a payment out, instead of a deposit in.)
08318         //          // ------------------
08319         //          "PAYMENT_PLAN",   // An OTCronItem-derived OTPaymentPlan, related to a recurring payment plan.
08320         //          "SMART_CONTRACT", // An OTCronItem-derived OTSmartContract, related to a smart contract.
08321         //          // ------------------
08322         //          "PURSE",          // An OTContract-derived OTPurse containing a list of cash OTTokens.
08323         //          // ------------------
08324         //          "ERROR_STATE"
08325         //; };
08326 
08327 
08328         string strType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strInstrument);
08329 
08330         if (!VerifyStringVal(strType))
08331         {
08332             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine instrument type. Expected CHEQUE, VOUCHER, INVOICE, or (cash) PURSE.\n");
08333             return -1;
08334         }
08335 
08336 
08337         if ("CHEQUE" == strType)
08338         {
08339             return details_deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strToNymID, strInstrument, strType);
08340         }
08341         else if ("VOUCHER" == strType)
08342         {
08343             return details_deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strToNymID, strInstrument, strType);
08344         }
08345         else if ("INVOICE" == strType)
08346         {
08347             return details_deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strToNymID, strInstrument, strType);
08348         }
08349         else if ("PURSE" == strType)
08350         {
08351             return details_deposit_purse(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strToNymID, strInstrument, ""); // strIndices is left blank in this case
08352         }
08353         else
08354         {
08355             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine instrument type. Expected CHEQUE, VOUCHER, INVOICE, or (cash) PURSE.\n");
08356             return -1;
08357         }
08358     }
08359 
08360     return -1;
08361 }
08362 
08363 
08364 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_deposit()
08365 {
08366     string strUsage1 = "\n\n  USAGE: deposit --myacct YOUR_ACCT_ID  \n(OT will ask you to paste the instrument.)\n";
