08367     string strUsage2 = concat(strUsage1, "Optionally:    --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID \n");
08368     string strUsage3 = concat(strUsage2, "Optionally:    --args \"indices 4,6,9\"\n");
08369     string strUsage4 = concat(strUsage3, "Optionally:    --args \"indices all\"  (To deposit ALL cash tokens in your purse.)\n");
08370     string strUsage = concat(strUsage4, "Server and NymID are usually determined based on MyAcct.\n If you supply optional indices, they must correspond to tokens in your cash purse.\n\n");
08371 
08372     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
08373 
08374 
08375     // A bit complicated:
08376     //
08377     // If I specify MyPurse and MyAcct, then they MUST have the same asset type.
08378     //
08379     // If I specify MyNym and MyPurse, that is where we will look for the purse.
08380     //
08381     // If I specify MyAcct, and it's owned by a different Nym than MyNym, then the cash
08382     // tokens will be reassigned from MyNym to MyAcct's Nym, before depositing.
08383     // Basically ALWAYS look up MyAcct's owner, and set HIM as the recipient Nym.
08384     // (But still use MyNym, independently, to find the purse being deposited.)
08385     //
08386     // Must ALWAYS specify MyAcct because otherwise, where are you depositing to?
08387     //
08388     // If MyNym isn't available, should use MyAcct's Nym.
08389     //
08390     // Shouldn't need to specify MyPurse, since we can ONLY deposit into MyAcct of
08391     // the same type as MyAcct. Thus we should ignore any other asset types or purses
08392     // since they couldn't possibly be deposited into MyAcct anyway.
08393     //
08394 
08395     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
08396     {
08397 
08398         // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE SERVER ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
08399         //
08400         string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(MyAcct);
08401 
08402         if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
08403         {
08404             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find Server ID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
08405             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Server based on the account.\n\n");
08406             return -1;
08407         }
08408 
08409         if (VerifyExists("Server", false) && !(Server == strServerID))
08410         {
08411             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "This account is on server ( " + strServerID + " -- the server is deduced based on the account), but the default server is ( " + Server + " ). To override it, use:  --server " + strServerID + " \n");
08412             return -1;
08413         }
08414 
08415         return details_deposit(strServerID, MyAcct);
08416     }
08417 
08418     return -1;
08419 }
08420 
08421 
08422 /*
08423 
08424 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAmount(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08425 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetTransNum(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08426 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidFrom(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08427 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidTo(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08428 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetMemo(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08429 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08430 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08431 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08432 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08433 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderAcctID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08434 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08435 const char * OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientAcctID(const char * THE_INSTRUMENT);
08436 
08437 
08438 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::CreatePurse), "OT_API_CreatePurse");
08439 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::CreatePurse_Passphrase), "OT_API_CreatePurse_Passphrase");
08440 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::SavePurse), "OT_API_SavePurse");
08441 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_GetTotalValue), "OT_API_Purse_GetTotalValue");
08442 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Count), "OT_API_Purse_Count");
08443 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Peek), "OT_API_Purse_Peek");
08444 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Pop), "OT_API_Purse_Pop");
08445 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Push), "OT_API_Purse_Push");
08446 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ImportPurse), "OT_API_Wallet_ImportPurse");
08447 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::exchangePurse), "OT_API_exchangePurse");
08448 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Token_ChangeOwner), "OT_API_Token_ChangeOwner");
08449 pScript->chai.add(fun(&OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_HasPassword), "OT_API_Purse_HasPassword");
08450 
08451 */
08452 
08453 
08454 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_import_purse(const string & strInstrument, const bool bHasPassword, const string & strPurseOwner)
08455 {
08456     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
08457     {
08458         return -1;
08459     }
08460 
08461     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strInstrument);
08462 
08463     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
08464     {
08465         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine server ID from purse.\n");
08466         return -1;
08467     }
08468 
08469     string strAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(strInstrument);
08470 
08471     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetID))
08472     {
08473         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine asset type ID from purse.\n");
08474         return -1;
08475     }
08476 
08477     bool bActuallyHasPassword = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_HasPassword(strServerID, strInstrument);
08478 
08479     if (bHasPassword != bActuallyHasPassword)
08480     {
08481         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The actual purse's opinion of whether or not it has a password, doesn't match the caller's opinion.\n");
08482         return -1;
08483     }
08484 
08485     bool bImported = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ImportPurse(strServerID, strAssetID, strPurseOwner, strInstrument);
08486 
08487     if (bImported)
08488     {
08489         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Success importing purse!\nServer: " + strServerID + "\nAsset Type: " + strAssetID + "\nNym: " + strPurseOwner + "\n\n");
08490         return 1;
08491     }
08492 
08493     return -1;
08494 }
08495 
08496 
08497 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_import_cash(const string & strInstrument)
08498 {
08499     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
08500     {
08501         return -1;
08502     }
08503 
08504     string strType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strInstrument);
08505 
08506     if (!VerifyStringVal(strType))
08507     {
08508         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine instrument type. Expected (cash) PURSE.\n");
08509         return -1;
08510     }
08511 
08512     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetServerID(strInstrument);
08513 
08514     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
08515     {
08516         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine server ID from purse.\n");
08517         return -1;
08518     }
08519 
08520     if ("PURSE" == strType)
08521     {
08522     }
08523     // Todo: case "TOKEN"
08524     //
08525     // NOTE: This is commented out because since it is guessing the NymID as MyNym,
08526     // then it will just create a purse for MyNym and import it into that purse, and
08527     // then later when doing a deposit, THAT's when it tries to DECRYPT that token
08528     // and re-encrypt it to the SERVER's nym... and that's when we might find out that
08529     // it never was encrypted to MyNym in the first place -- we had just assumed it
08530     // was here, when we did the import. Until I can look at that in more detail, it
08531     // will remain commented out.
08532     else
08533     {
08534         //            // This version supports cash tokens (instead of purse...)
08535         //            bool bImportedToken = importCashPurse(strServerID, MyNym, strAssetID, userInput, isPurse)
08536         //
08537         //            if (bImportedToken)
08538         //            {
08539         //                OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Success importing cash token!\nServer: "+strServerID+"\nAsset Type: "+strAssetID+"\nNym: "+MyNym+"\n\n");
08540         //                return 1;
08541         //; }
08542 
08543         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine instrument type. Expected (cash) PURSE.\n");
08544         return -1;
08545     }
08546 
08547     // This tells us if the purse is password-protected. (Versus being owned
08548     // by a Nym.)
08549     bool bHasPassword = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_HasPassword(strServerID, strInstrument);
08550 
08551     // Even if the Purse is owned by a Nym, that Nym's ID may not necessarily
08552     // be present on the purse itself (it's optional to list it there.)
08553     // OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID tells us WHAT the recipient User ID
08554     // is, IF it's on the purse. (But does NOT tell us WHETHER there is a
08555     // recipient. The above function is for that.)
08556     //
08557     string strPurseOwner = "";
08558 
08559     if (!bHasPassword)
08560     {
08561         strPurseOwner = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(strInstrument); // TRY and get the Nym ID (it may have been left blank.)
08562     }
08563 
08564     // Whether the purse was password-protected (and thus had no Nym ID)
08565     // or whether it does have a Nym ID (but it wasn't listed on the purse)
08566     // Then either way, in those cases strPurseOwner will still be NULL.
08567     //
08568     // (The third case is that the purse is Nym protected and the ID WAS available,
08569     // in which case we'll skip this block, since we already have it.)
08570     //
08571     // But even in the case where there's no Nym at all (password protected)
08572     // we STILL need to pass a Signer Nym ID into OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ImportPurse.
08573     // So if it's still NULL here, then we use --mynym to make the call.
08574     // And also, even in the case where there IS a Nym but it's not listed,
08575     // we must assume the USER knows the appropriate NymID, even if it's not
08576     // listed on the purse itself. And in that case as well, the user can
08577     // simply specify the Nym using --mynym.
08578     //
08579     // Bottom line: by this point, if it's still not set, then we just use
08580     // MyNym, and if THAT's not set, then we return failure.
08581     //
08582     if (!VerifyStringVal(strPurseOwner))
08583     {
08584         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n The NymID isn't evident from the purse itself... (listing it is optional.)\nThe purse may have no Nym at all--it may instead be password-protected.) Either way, a signer nym is still necessary, even for password-protected purses.\n\n Trying MyNym...\n");
08585 
08586         if (!VerifyExists("MyNym"))
08587         {
08588             return -1;
08589         }
08590 
08591         strPurseOwner = MyNym;
08592     }
08593 
08594     return details_import_purse(strInstrument, bHasPassword, strPurseOwner);
08595 }
08596 
08597 
08598 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_import_cash()
08599 {
08600     string strUsage1 = "\n\n  USAGE: importcash   (OT will ask you to paste the instrument.)\n";
08601     string strUsage2 = concat(strUsage1, "Optionally: importcash --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID\n\n");
08602     string strUsage3 = concat(strUsage2, "Asset (Purse) ID and ServerID are both deduced from the cash purse that you're importing.\n");
08603     string strUsage = concat(strUsage3, "NymID is also deduced, if necessary. (Otherwise, specify using --mynym.)\n\n");
08604 
08605     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
08606 
08607     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "You can import a PURSE (containing cash tokens.)\n");
08608     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Paste your financial instrument here, followed by a ~ by itself on a blank line: \n");
08609 
08610     string strInstrument = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
08611 
08612     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
08613     {
08614         return -1;
08615     }
08616 
08617     return details_import_cash(strInstrument);
08618 }
08619 
08620 
08621 // MyPurse and HisPurse will call the script even when not found, giving the script
08622 // the opportunity to download the appropriate asset contract from the server, if
08623 // necessary.
08624 //
08625 // Similarly, HisAcct works without being expected to be found in the wallet (since
08626 // maybe it's HIS account and thus it's not IN your wallet...)
08627 //
08628 // Similarly, HisNym will call the script even when not found, giving the script the
08629 // opportunity to download the appropriate pubkey ("check_user" aka "checknym") and
08630 // continue operating.
08631 //
08632 // All of the above, plus Server, ALREADY attempt a partial match search. Therefore,
08633 // it's not necessary to perform ANOTHER partial match, when the value comes from
08634 // --server, --mynym, --hisnym, --mypurse, --hispurse, --myacct, or --hisacct.
08635 //
08636 // You only need to do partial matches when you get values from ELSEWHERE, such as
08637 // from custom arguments, or user-pasted input.
08638 //
08639 // Therefore, add a function for downloading a Nym's pubkey if not already in the wallet,
08640 // and one that downloads an asset contract if not already in the wallet
08641 
08642 
08643 OT_COMMANDS_OT string OT_Command::details_export_cash(const string & strServerID, const string & strFromNymID, const string & strAssetTypeID, string & strHisNymID, const string & strIndices, const bool bPasswordProtected, string & strRetainedCopy)
08644 {
08645 
08646     string strLocation = "\n details_export_cash";
08647 
08648     // The first three arguments are for loading up the purse we're exporting FROM.
08649     //
08650     // Then strHisNymID is for the Nym we're exporting TO (if bPasswordProtected is false.)
08651     //
08652     // Then strIndices contains the indices for the tokens to export.
08653     //
08654     // Then bPasswordProtected tells us whether to export to strHisNymID,
08655     // or to create a password-protected purse and export to that instead.
08656     // (In which case, the purse itself becomes the "owner" and can be passed
08657     // wherever we would normally pass a NymID as a purse owner.)
08658     //
08659     // if bPasswordProtected is false, then strHisNymID needs to contain the recipient Nym.
08660     // This will contain MyNym by default, if --hisnym wasn't used at the command line.
08661     //
08662 
08663     string strContract = MadeEasy::load_or_retrieve_contract(strServerID, strFromNymID, strAssetTypeID);
08664 
08665     if (!VerifyStringVal(strContract))
08666     {
08667         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to load asset contract: " + strAssetTypeID + "\n");
08668         return "";
08669     }
08670 
08671     bool bLoadedPurse = false;
08672 
08673     string strInstrument = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPurse(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strFromNymID); // returns NULL, or a purse.
08674 
08675     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
08676     {
08677         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to load purse from local storage. Does it even exist?\n");
08678         return "";
08679     }
08680 
08681     bLoadedPurse = true;
08682 
08683     // Below this point, we know that strInstrument contains the purse as we loaded it from local storage.
08684     // If it WAS from local storage, then there's a chance that strIndices contains "4, 6, 2" etc.
08685     // If that's the case, then we need to iterate through the purse, and add the denoted token IDs to
08686     // a vector (selectedTokens) and pass it into exportCashPurse.
08687 
08688 
08689     vector<string> vecSelectedTokenIDs;
08690 
08691     // the user might have wanted to export only selected indices,
08692     // rather than ALL the tokens in the purse.
08693     // So we'll loop through the purse and add any relevant IDs to the
08694     // "selected" list, since the actual Token IDs must be passed.
08695     //
08696     if (bLoadedPurse)
08697     {
08698 
08699         // Loop through purse contents...
08700         //
08701         int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Count(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strInstrument);
08702         if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount) || (nCount < 0))
08703         {
08704             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: Unexpected bad value returned from OT_API_Purse_Count.\n\n");
08705             return "";
08706         }
08707 
08708         if (nCount < 1)
08709         {
08710             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": The purse is empty, so you can't export it.\n\n");
08711             return "";
08712         }
08713 
08714         else //nCount >= 1
08715         {
08716             // Make a COPY of the purse for this loop, so we can iterate it and find the
08717             // appropriate Token IDs...
08718 
08719             string strPurse = strInstrument;
08720 
08721             if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices)) // if strIndices is empty, then we send vecSelectedTokenIDs empty as well (which means, "do them all.")
08722             {
08723                 int32_t nIndex = -1;
08724 
08725                 while (nCount > 0)
08726                 {
08727                     --nCount;
08728                     ++nIndex;  // on first iteration, this is now 0.
08729 
08730                     string strToken = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Peek(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strFromNymID, strPurse);
08731 
08732                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strToken))
08733                     {
08734                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: OT_API_Purse_Peek unexpectedly returned NULL instead of token.\n");
08735                         return "";
08736                     }
08737 
08738                     string strNewPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Pop(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strFromNymID, strPurse);
08739 
08740                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strNewPurse))
08741                     {
08742                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: OT_API_Purse_Pop unexpectedly returned NULL instead of updated purse.\n");
08743                         return "";
08744                     }
08745 
08746                     strPurse = strNewPurse;
08747 
08748                     string strTokenID = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetID(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08749 
08750                     if (!VerifyStringVal(strTokenID))
08751                     {
08752                         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error while exporting purse: bad strTokenID.\n");
08753                         return "";
08754                     }
08755 
08756                     //                  bool NumList_VerifyQuery(const std::string str_NumList, const std::string str_Numbers)
08757 
08758                     // If there are no indices, then do them all. (Thus push this one,
08759                     // as we push every one.)
08760                     // OR, If there are indices, and the current index is FOUND on the
08761                     // vector of indices, then we push this one (since it was selected.)
08762                     //
08763                     if (!("all" == strIndices) && OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nIndex))) // empty vector should be interpreted already as "all"
08764                     {
08765                         vecSelectedTokenIDs.push_back(strTokenID);
08766                     }
08767 
08768                 } // while
08769             } // if strIndices
08770 
08771             string strExportedCashPurse = MadeEasy::exportCashPurse(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strFromNymID, strInstrument, vecSelectedTokenIDs, strHisNymID, bPasswordProtected, strRetainedCopy);
08772 
08773             return strExportedCashPurse;
08774 
08775         } // if nCount > 0
08776 
08777     }// if (bLoadedPurse)
08778 
08779     return "";
08780 }
08781 
08782 
08783 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_export_cash()
08784 {
08785     string strUsage1 = "\n\n  USAGE: exportcash --mypurse ASSET_TYPE_ID --mynym YOUR_NYM_ID --hisnym RECIPIENT_NYM_ID --server SERVER_ID\n";
08786     string strUsage2 = concat(strUsage1, "Optionally:    --args \"indices 4,6,9\"\n");
08787     string strUsage3 = concat(strUsage2, "Optionally:    --args \"passwd true\"  (To create a password-protected purse.)\n\n");
08788     string strUsage4 = concat(strUsage3, "(If you create a password-protected purse, then HisNym will be ignored and can be left out.)\n");
08789     string strUsage = concat(strUsage4, "If you supply optional indices, they must correspond to tokens in your cash purse.\n\n");
08790 
08791     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
08792 
08793     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("MyPurse"))
08794     {
08795         string strIndices = "";
08796         bool bPasswordProtected = false;
08797 
08798         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
08799         {
08800             // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
08801             //                                  const std::string str_key)
08802             //
08803             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
08804             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
08805             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices \"all\" "
08806             //
08807             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
08808 
08809             string strPasswordProtected = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "passwd");
08810 
08811             if (VerifyStringVal(strPasswordProtected) && ("true" == strPasswordProtected))
08812             {
08813                 bPasswordProtected = true;
08814             }
08815         }
08816 
08817         string strHisNym = MyNym;  // default export is to your own Nym.
08818 
08819         if (!bPasswordProtected && VerifyExists("HisNym", false))
08820         {
08821             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "HisNym was provided at the command line.\nDo you wish to export this cash to HisNym instead of MyNym?\n\n");
08822             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "HisNym is: " + HisNym + "\n MyNym is: " + MyNym + "\n\n Type yes to use HisNym, or no to use MyNym.[no]: ");
08823 
08824             string strAnswer = OT_CLI_ReadLine();
08825 
08826             if (VerifyStringVal(strAnswer) && (("y" == strAnswer) || ("yes" == strAnswer)))
08827             {
08828                 strHisNym = HisNym;
08829             }
08830         }
08831 
08832         string strServerID = Server;  // so it makes a copy. (Partial ID processing will alter the variable internally here, and that will fail with Server since it's a global constant.)
08833         string strMyNymID = MyNym;   // Same reason.
08834         string strMyPurse = MyPurse; // Same reason.
08835         string strRetainedCopy = ""; // A copy of the exported purse, except this copy is encrypted to the SENDER's key. (In case he needs to recover it from his outpayments.)
08836 
08837         string strExportedPurse = details_export_cash(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyPurse, strHisNym, strIndices, bPasswordProtected, strRetainedCopy);
08838 
08839         if (VerifyStringVal(strExportedPurse))
08840         {
08841             print("\n" + strExportedPurse + "\n"); // stdout
08842             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Success exporting cash purse!\n\n"); // stderr
08843             return 1; // Success!
08844         }
08845     }
08846 
08847     return -1;
08848 }
08849 
08850 
08851 // Pass in the exact indices, or an amount, and this function will return true;
08852 // or false.
08853 //
08854 // If you pass the indices, this function returns true if those exact indices
08855 // exist. In that case, this function will also set lAmount to the total.
08856 //
08857 // If, instead, you pass lAmount and a blank indices, this function will try to
08858 // determine the indices that would create lAmount, if they were selected. If it
08859 // returns true, strIndices, will contain the result, at the end of it all.
08860 //
08861 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::purse_get_indices_or_amount(const string & strServerID, const string & strAssetTypeID, const string & strMyNymID, int64_t & lAmount, string & strIndices) // If strIndices is input, lAmount is output. (And vice-versa.)
08862 {
08863 
08864     string strLocation = "\n purse_get_indices_or_amount";
08865 
08866     string strLoopIndices = "";
08867     int64_t lLoopAmount = lAmount; // so they are the same data type.
08868     int64_t lAmountRemaining = lAmount; // so they are the same data type.
08869     lLoopAmount = 0; // to initialize it back to 0.
08870 
08871     // lLoopAmount is where we will start at 0, and keep the running total of the value for the selected indices, as we loop.
08872     // lAmountRemaining is where we will start at lAmount, and then SUBTRACT the value of each selected index, as we loop.
08873     // If we are trying to determine the indices based on lAmount, we'll SEE if the current index is less-than-or-equal-to
08874     // lAmountRemaining, and if so, we'll concat that index to our output and subtract the denomination of the token at the
08875     // current index from lAmountRemaining.
08876     // If bFindAmountFromIndices is true then lAmount is already 0 and then lAmountRemaining is already 0 as well.
08877 
08878     bool bFindIndicesFromAmount = false;
08879     bool bFindAmountFromIndices = false;
08880 
08881     if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices) && (0 == lAmount))
08882     {
08883         // all good.
08884         bFindAmountFromIndices = true;
08885     }
08886     else if (!VerifyStringVal(strIndices) && (0 != lAmount))
08887     {
08888         // all good.
08889         bFindIndicesFromAmount = true;
08890     }
08891     else
08892     {
08893         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Can only pass indices, OR amount to this function, but not both (the other becomes output.)\n");
08894         return false;
08895     }
08896 
08897     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "strServerID: " + strServerID + "\n");
08898     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "strAssetTypeID: " + strAssetTypeID + "\n");
08899     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "strMyNymID: " + strMyNymID + "\n");
08900 
08901     string strLocalPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPurse(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strMyNymID);
08902 
08903     bool bLoadedPurse = VerifyStringVal(strLocalPurse);
08904     if (!bLoadedPurse)
08905     {
08906         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to load local purse. Does it even exist?\n");
08907         return false;
08908     }
08909     else
08910     {
08911 
08912         // Loop through purse contents...
08913         //
08914         int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Count(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strLocalPurse);
08915         if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount) || (nCount < 0))
08916         {
08917             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: Unexpected bad value returned from OT_API_Purse_Count.\n\n");
08918             return false;
08919         }
08920 
08921         if (nCount < 1)
08922         {
08923             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": The purse is empty.\n\n");
08924             return false;
08925         }
08926 
08927         else //nCount >= 1
08928         {
08929             // Make a copy of the purse passed in, so we can iterate it and find the
08930             // appropriate Token IDs...
08931 
08932             string strPurse = strLocalPurse;
08933 
08934             int32_t nIndex = -1;
08935 
08936             while (nCount > 0)
08937             {
08938                 --nCount;
08939                 ++nIndex;  // on first iteration, this is now 0.
08940 
08941 
08942                 //                  string strOwner = bPasswordProtected ? "" : strMyNymID
08943 
08944                 // NOTE: Owner can ONLY be strMyNymID in here, since bLoadedPurse
08945                 // is only true in the case where we LOADED the purse from local storage.
08946                 // (Therefore this DEFINITELY is not a password-protected purse.)
08947                 //
08948                 string strToken = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Peek(strServerID, strAssetTypeID,
08949                     strMyNymID,
08950                     strPurse);
08951 
08952                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strToken))
08953                 {
08954                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: OT_API_Purse_Peek unexpectedly returned NULL instead of token.\n");
08955                     return false;
08956                 }
08957 
08958                 string strNewPurse = OTAPI_Wrap::Purse_Pop(strServerID, strAssetTypeID,
08959                     strMyNymID,
08960                     strPurse);
08961 
08962                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strNewPurse))
08963                 {
08964                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: OT_API_Purse_Pop unexpectedly returned NULL instead of updated purse.\n");
08965                     return false;
08966                 }
08967 
08968                 strPurse = strNewPurse;
08969 
08970                 string strTokenID = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetID(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08971                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strTokenID))
08972                 {
08973                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Error: bad strTokenID.\n");
08974                     return false;
08975                 }
08976                 int64_t lDenomination = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetDenomination(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08977                 if (0 > lDenomination)
08978                 {
08979                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad lDenomination.\n");
08980                     return false;
08981                 }
08982                 int32_t nSeries = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetSeries(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08983                 if (!VerifyIntVal(nSeries))
08984                 {
08985                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad nSeries.\n");
08986                     return false;
08987                 }
08988                 time64_t tValidFrom = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetValidFrom(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08989                 if (!VerifyTimeVal(tValidFrom))
08990                 {
08991                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad tValidFrom.\n");
08992                     return false;
08993                 }
08994                 time64_t tValidTo = OTAPI_Wrap::Token_GetValidTo(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strToken);
08995                 if (!VerifyTimeVal(tValidTo))
08996                 {
08997                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad tValidTo.\n");
08998                     return false;
08999                 }
09000                 time64_t lTime = OTAPI_Wrap::GetTime();
09001                 if (OT_TIME_ZERO > lTime)
09002                 {
09003                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Error while showing purse: bad lTime.\n");
09004                     return false;
09005                 }
09006                 string strStatus = (lTime > tValidTo) ? "expired" : "valid";
09007 
09008                 // ------------------------------------------
09009                 // lLoopAmount is where we will start at 0, and keep the running total of the value for the selected indices, as we loop.
09010                 // lAmountRemaining is where we will start at lAmount, and then SUBTRACT the value of each selected index, as we loop.
09011                 // If we are trying to determine the indices based on lAmount, we'll SEE if value at the current index is less-than-or-equal-to
09012                 // lAmountRemaining, and if so, we'll concat that index to our output and subtract the denomination of the token at the
09013                 // current index from lAmountRemaining.
09014                 // If bFindAmountFromIndices is true then lAmount is already 0 and then lAmountRemaining is already 0 as well.
09015 
09016                 // TODO:  This would work better if the tokens were sorted. In the future, pull the tokens onto a map or something,
09017                 // and then SORT IT based on denomination of token. THEN go through the tokens from largest to smallest and do what we're
09018                 // doing here in this loop. And then it will work perfectly everytime. Todo.  This version will work okay, but there will be
09019                 // times it fails and ends up withdrawing cash when it didn't really need to. TOdo.
09020 
09021                 if (lTime > tValidTo)
09022                 {
09023                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Skipping: Token is " + strStatus + ".\n");
09024                 }
09025 
09026                 else if (bFindAmountFromIndices)
09027                 {
09028                     if (VerifyStringVal(strIndices) && (("all" == strIndices) || OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nIndex))))
09029                     {
09030                         string strTempIndices = OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Add(strLoopIndices, to_string(nIndex));
09031                         strLoopIndices = strTempIndices;
09032                         lLoopAmount += lDenomination;
09033                     }
09034                 }
09035                 else if (bFindIndicesFromAmount)
09036                 {
09037                     if (VerifyIntVal(lAmount) && (lAmountRemaining > 0) && (lDenomination <= lAmountRemaining))
09038                     {
09039                         string strTempIndices = OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Add(strLoopIndices, to_string(nIndex));
09040                         strLoopIndices = strTempIndices;
09041                         lLoopAmount += lDenomination;
09042                         lAmountRemaining -= lDenomination;
09043 
09044                         if (0 == lAmountRemaining)
09045                         {
09046                             break;
09047                         }
09048                     }
09049                 }
09050 
09051             } // while
09052         } // if nCount > 0
09053     }// if (bLoadedPurse)
09054 
09055     if (bFindAmountFromIndices)
09056     {
09057         lAmount = lLoopAmount;
09058         return true;
09059     }
09060     else if (bFindIndicesFromAmount)
09061     {
09062         strIndices = strLoopIndices;
09063         lAmount = lAmountRemaining;  // So the caller, if this fails, sees how much he still needs to withdraw.
09064 
09065         if (0 == lAmountRemaining)
09066         {
09067             return true;
09068         }
09069 
09070         strIndices = ""; // Since we're about to return false, and since we were finding the indices, we set them back to "" again.
09071     }
09072 
09073     return false;
09074 }
09075 
09076 
09077 OT_COMMANDS_OT bool OT_Command::withdraw_and_send_cash(const string & strMyAcctID, string & strHisNymID, const string & strMemo, const string & strAmount)
09078 {
09079     string strLocation = "withdraw_and_send_cash";
09080 
09081     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyAcctID) || !VerifyStringVal(strHisNymID) || !VerifyStringVal(strAmount))
09082     {
09083         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Failure: Missing one of: strMyAcctID (" + strMyAcctID + "), strHisNymID (" + strHisNymID + "), or strAmount (" + strAmount + ")\n");
09084         return false;
09085     }
09086 
09087     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
09088     //
09089     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
09090 
09091     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
09092     {
09093         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Failure: Unable to find NymID based on strMyAcctID (" + strMyAcctID + ").\n");
09094         return false;
09095     }
09096 
09097     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE SERVER ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
09098     //
09099     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strMyAcctID);
09100 
09101     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
09102     {
09103         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Failure: Unable to find Server ID based on strMyAcctID (" + strMyAcctID + ").\n");
09104         return false;
09105     }
09106 
09107     string strAssetTypeID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcctID);
09108 
09109     if (!VerifyStringVal(strAssetTypeID))
09110     {
09111         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Failure: Unable to find Asset Type ID based on strMyAcctID (" + strMyAcctID + ").\n");
09112         return false;
09113     }
09114 
09115     int64_t lAmount = int64_t(0);
09116 
09117     if (VerifyStringVal(strAmount))
09118     {
09119         lAmount = to_long(strAmount);
09120     }
09121 
09122     if (!VerifyIntVal(lAmount) || (lAmount <= 0))
09123     {
09124         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Invalid value: strAmount (" + strAmount + ")\n");
09125         return false;
09126     }
09127 
09128     string strTempMemo = "";
09129     string strResponse = "";
09130     string strIndices = "";
09131     bool bPasswordProtected = false;
09132 
09133     if (VerifyStringVal(strMemo))
09134     {
09135         strTempMemo = strMemo;
09136     }
09137 
09138     if (1 == OT_Command::details_send_cash(strResponse, strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strMyNymID, strMyAcctID, strHisNymID, strTempMemo, strAmount, strIndices, bPasswordProtected))
09139     {
09140         return true;
09141     }
09142 
09143     return false;
09144 }
09145 
09146 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_send_cash(string & strResponse, const string & strServerID, const string & strAssetTypeID, const string & strMyNymID, const string & strMyAcctID, string & strHisNymID, const string & strMemo, const string & strAmount, string & strIndices, const bool bPasswordProtected)
09147 {
09148 
09149     string strLocation = "\n details_send_cash";
09150 
09151     int64_t lStartAmount = int64_t(0);
09152 
09153     if (VerifyStringVal(strAmount))
09154     {
09155         lStartAmount = to_long(strAmount);
09156     }
09157 
09158     int64_t lAmount = lStartAmount;
09159 
09160     // What we want to do from here is, see if we can send the cash purely using cash we already
09161     // have in the local purse.
09162     // If so, we just package it up and send it off using send_user_payment.
09163     //
09164     // But if we do NOT have the proper cash tokens in the local purse to send, then we need to
09165     // withdraw enough tokens until we do, and then try sending again.
09166     //
09167 
09168     bool bAmountFromIndices = VerifyStringVal(strIndices);
09169     bool bIndicesFromAmount = VerifyIntVal(lAmount);
09170 
09171     bool bGotData = purse_get_indices_or_amount(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strMyNymID, lAmount, strIndices); // If strIndices is input, lAmount is output. (And vice-versa.)
09172 
09173     if (!bGotData)  // NOT ENOUGH CASH FOUND IN EXISTING PURSE TO MATCH THE AMOUNT (or indices were specified and not found.)
09174     {
09175         if (bAmountFromIndices)
09176         {
09177             // If we were starting out with indices, and those indices failed to be found, then there's
09178             // nothing more we can do. They aren't there.
09179             //
09180             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Sorry, those indices weren't found: " + strIndices + "\nPerhaps try: 'opentxs showpurse'\n");
09181             return -1;
09182         }
09183 
09184         // By this point, it means we started with the amount, and tried to use it to find the
09185         // appropriate indices -- and they weren't there. This means we need to withdraw more cash
09186         // from the server before we can send it, since we don't have enough in our purse already.
09187         //
09188         int32_t nWithdraw = details_withdraw_cash(strMyAcctID, lAmount); // By this point lAmount is only the remaining amount that wasn't found in the purse already.
09189 
09190         if (1 != nWithdraw)
09191         {
09192             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Tried to withdraw cash, but failed.\n");
09193             return -1;
09194         }
09195 
09196         // Okay we performed the withdrawal, so now let's see again if we can extract the proper
09197         // cash tokens from the local purse. We'll load it up again...
09198         //
09199         lAmount = lStartAmount;
09200 
09201         bGotData = purse_get_indices_or_amount(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strMyNymID, lAmount, strIndices); // If strIndices is input, lAmount is output. (And vice-versa.)
09202 
09203         if (!bGotData)
09204         {
09205             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strLocation + ": Unable to get enough cash into the local purse to send, EVEN after performing a cash withdrawal. (Failure.)\n strIndices: " + strIndices + " lAmount: " + OTAPI_Wrap::FormatAmount(strAssetTypeID, lAmount) + "\n");
09206             return -1;
09207         }
09208     }
09209 
09210     // By this point, bGotData is definitely true, meaning there are already enough cash tokens in the purse
09211     // to send, or there are now since performing a withdrawal. Either way, we should be good to go...
09212 
09213     // Returns the exported cash purse, with strRetainedCopy containing the sender's version of that.
09214     //
09215     string strRetainedCopy = "";
09216     string strExportedCashPurse = details_export_cash(strServerID, strMyNymID, strAssetTypeID, strHisNymID, strIndices, bPasswordProtected, strRetainedCopy);
09217     int32_t nReturnVal = -1;
09218 
09219     if (VerifyStringVal(strExportedCashPurse))
09220     {
09221         strResponse = MadeEasy::send_user_cash(strServerID, strMyNymID, strHisNymID, strExportedCashPurse, strRetainedCopy); // <==================
09222 
09223         nReturnVal = VerifyMessageSuccess(strResponse);
09224 
09225         if (1 != nReturnVal)
09226         {
09227             // It failed sending the cash to the recipient Nym.
09228             // Re-import strRetainedCopy back into the sender's cash purse.
09229             //
09230             bool bImported = OTAPI_Wrap::Wallet_ImportPurse(strServerID, strAssetTypeID, strMyNymID, strRetainedCopy);
09231 
09232             if (bImported)
09233             {
09234                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailed sending cash, but at least: success re-importing purse.\nServer: " + strServerID + "\nAsset Type: " + strAssetTypeID + "\nNym: " + strMyNymID + "\n\n");
09235             }
09236             else
09237             {
09238                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Failed sending cash AND failed re-importing purse.\nServer: " + strServerID + "\nAsset Type: " + strAssetTypeID + "\nNym: " + strMyNymID + "\n\nPurse (SAVE THIS SOMEWHERE!):\n\n" + strRetainedCopy + "\n");
09239             }
09240         }
09241     }
09242 
09243 
09244     return nReturnVal;
09245 }
09246 
09247 
09248 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_new_symmetric_key()
09249 {
09250     string strKey = OTAPI_Wrap::CreateSymmetricKey();
09251 
09252     if (VerifyStringVal(strKey))
09253     {
09254         // stderr
09255         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
09256 
09257         // stdout
09258         print(strKey);
09259 
09260         // stderr
09261         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
09262 
09263         return 1;
09264     }
09265 
09266     // "return value"
09267     return -1;
09268 }
09269 
09270 
09271 //case ("CHEQUE")
09272 //case ("VOUCHER")
09273 //case ("INVOICE")
09274 //case ("PURSE")
09275 //
09276 // If one of the above types is passed in, then the payment will only be handled if the type matches.
09277 //
09278 // But if "ANY" is passed in, then the payment will be handled for any of them.
09279 //
09280 
09281 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::handle_payment_index(const string & strMyAcctID, const int32_t nIndex, const string & strPaymentType, const string & strInbox) // (If nIndex is -1, then it will ask user to paste an invoice.)
09282 {
09283     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyAcctID) || !VerifyIntVal(nIndex))
09284     {
09285         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Either strMyAcctID not a valid string, or nIndex not a valid int32_t.\n");
09286         return -1;
09287     }
09288 
09289     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
09290     //
09291     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
09292 
09293     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
09294     {
09295         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
09296         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
09297         return -1;
09298     }
09299 
09300     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE SERVER ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
09301     //
09302     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strMyAcctID);
09303 
09304     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
09305     {
09306         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find Server ID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
09307         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Server based on the account.\n\n");
09308         return -1;
09309     }
09310     // ***************************************************************
09311     string strInstrument = "";
09312 
09313     if (-1 == nIndex) // paste an instrument
09314     {
09315         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Please paste the instrument, followed by an EOF or a ~ by itself on a blank line:\n\n");
09316 
09317         // The reason we accept the tilde ~ on a blank line by itself, is because
09318         // the EOF, while it works, causes us not to be able to read any more input
09319         // from stdin. Stdin is considered "closed" for the duration of the run.
09320         // So the tilde allows us to read multiple times without closing stdin.
09321         //
09322         strInstrument = OT_CLI_ReadUntilEOF();
09323 
09324         if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
09325         {
09326             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Sorry, You must paste the instrument, in order to process it. Or, specify an index in the\npayments inbox using the option:  --args \"index INDEX_OF_INVOICE\".\n\n");
09327             return -1;
09328         }
09329     }
09330 
09331     else // Use an instrument from the payments inbox, since a valid index was provided.
09332     {
09333         strInstrument = MadeEasy::get_payment_instrument(strServerID, strMyNymID, nIndex, strInbox); // strInbox is optional and avoids having to load it multiple times. This function will just load it itself, if it has to.
09334 
09335         if (!VerifyStringVal(strInstrument))
09336         {
09337             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n Unable to get payment instrument based on index: " + to_string(nIndex) + ".\n\n");
09338             return -1;
09339         }
09340     }
09341     // ***************************************************************
09342     // By this point, strInstrument is a valid string (whether we got it from the payments inbox,
09343     // or whether we got it from stdin.)
09344     //
09345     string strType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strInstrument);
09346 
09347     if (!VerifyStringVal(strType))
09348     {
09349         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\nFailure: Unable to determine strInstrument's type. Expected CHEQUE, VOUCHER, INVOICE, or (cash) PURSE.\n");
09350         return -1;
09351     }
09352 
09353     string strIndexErrorMsg = "";
09354 
09355     if (-1 != nIndex)
09356     {
09357         strIndexErrorMsg = "at index " + to_string(nIndex) + " ";
09358     }
09359 
09360     // If there's a payment type,
09361     // and it's not "ANY", and it's the wrong type,
09362     // then skip this one.
09363     //
09364     if (VerifyStringVal(strPaymentType) && (strPaymentType != "ANY") && (strPaymentType != strType))
09365     {
09366         if ((("CHEQUE" == strPaymentType) && ("VOUCHER" == strType)) || (("VOUCHER" == strPaymentType) && ("CHEQUE" == strType)))
09367         {
09368             // in this case we allow it to drop through.
09369         }
09370         else
09371         {
09372             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument " + strIndexErrorMsg + "is not a " + strPaymentType + ". (It's a " + strType + ". Skipping.)\n");
09373             return -1;
09374         }
09375     }
09376 
09377     // Note: I USED to check the ASSET TYPE ID here, but then I removed it, since
09378     // details_deposit_cheque() already verifies that (so I don't need to do it twice.)
09379     //
09380     //  string strInstrumentAssetType  = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(strInstrument)
09381     //  string strAccountAssetID       = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcctID)
09382     //
09383     //  if (strInstrumentAssetType != strAccountAssetID)
09384     //  {
09385     //      OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument's asset type ("+strInstrumentAssetType+") doesn't match the account's asset type ("+strAccountAssetID+").\nTry specifying a different account using --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
09386     //      return -1;
09387     //; }
09388 
09389     // By this point, we know the invoice has the right asset type for the account
09390     // we're trying to use (to pay it from.)
09391     //
09392     // But we need to make sure the invoice is made out to strMyNymID (or to no one.)
09393     // Because if it IS endorsed to a Nym, and strMyNymID is NOT that nym, then the
09394     // transaction will fail. So let's check, before we bother sending it...
09395     //
09396     string strRecipientUserID = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetRecipientUserID(strInstrument);
09397 
09398     // Not all instruments have a specified recipient. But if they do, let's make
09399     // sure the Nym matches.
09400     //
09401     if (VerifyStringVal(strRecipientUserID) && (strRecipientUserID != strMyNymID))
09402     {
09403         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument " + strIndexErrorMsg + "is endorsed to a specific recipient (" + strRecipientUserID + ") and that doesn't match the account's owner Nym (" + strMyNymID + "). (Skipping.)\nTry specifying a different account, using --myacct ACCT_ID \n");
09404         return -1;
09405     }
09406 
09407     // At this point I know the invoice isn't made out to anyone, or if it is, it's properly
09408     // made out to the owner of the account which I'm trying to use to pay the invoice from.
09409     // So let's pay it!  P.S. strRecipientUserID might be NULL, but strMyNymID is guaranteed
09410     // to be good.
09411 
09412     //  string strPayeeUserID    = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderUserID    (strInstrument)
09413     //  string strPayeeAcctID    = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetSenderAcctID    (strInstrument)
09414 
09415     //
09416     string strInstrumentAssetType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetAssetID(strInstrument);
09417     string strAccountAssetID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_AssetTypeID(strMyAcctID);
09418 
09419     if (VerifyStringVal(strInstrumentAssetType) && (strAccountAssetID != strInstrumentAssetType))
09420     {
09421         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument at index " + to_string(nIndex) + " has a different asset type than the selected account. (Skipping.)\nTry specifying a different account, using --myacct ACCT_ID \n");
09422         return -1;
09423     }
09424 
09425     time64_t tFrom = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidFrom(strInstrument);
09426     time64_t tTo = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetValidTo(strInstrument);
09427     time64_t tTime = OTAPI_Wrap::GetTime();
09428 
09429     if (tTime < tFrom)
09430     {
09431         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument at index " + to_string(nIndex) + " is not yet within its valid date range. (Skipping.)\n");
09432         return -1;
09433     }
09434     if ((tTo > OT_TIME_ZERO) && (tTime > tTo))
09435     {
09436         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The instrument at index " + to_string(nIndex) + " is expired. (Moving it to the record box.)\n");
09437 
09438         // Since this instrument is expired, remove it from the payments inbox, and move to record box.
09439 
09440         // Note: this harvests
09441         if ((nIndex >= 0) && OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(strServerID, strMyNymID, true, // bIsInbox = true;
09442             nIndex, true)) // bSaveCopy = true. (Since it's expired, it'll go into the expired box.)
09443         {
09444             return 0;
09445         }
09446 
09447         return -1;
09448     }
09449 
09450     // TODO, IMPORTANT: After the below deposits are completed successfully, the wallet
09451     // will receive a "successful deposit" server reply. When that happens, OT (internally)
09452     // needs to go and see if the deposited item was a payment in the payments inbox. If so,
09453     // it should REMOVE it from that box and move it to the record box.
09454     //
09455     // That's why you don't see me messing with the payments inbox even when these are successful.
09456     // They DO need to be removed from the payments inbox, but just not here in the script. (Rather,
09457     // internally by OT itself.)
09458     //
09459     if ("CHEQUE" == strType)
09460     {
09461         return details_deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strMyNymID, strInstrument, strType);
09462     }
09463     else if ("VOUCHER" == strType)
09464     {
09465         return details_deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strMyNymID, strInstrument, strType);
09466     }
09467     else if ("INVOICE" == strType)
09468     {
09469         return details_deposit_cheque(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strMyNymID, strInstrument, strType);
09470     }
09471     else if ("PURSE" == strType)
09472     {
09473         int32_t nDepositPurse = details_deposit_purse(strServerID, strMyAcctID, strMyNymID, strInstrument, ""); // strIndices is left blank in this case
09474 
09475         // if nIndex !=  -1, go ahead and call RecordPayment on the purse at that index, to
09476         // remove it from payments inbox and move it to the recordbox.
09477         //
09478         if ((nIndex != -1) && (1 == nDepositPurse))
09479         {
09480             int32_t nRecorded = OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(strServerID, strMyNymID, true, //bIsInbox=true
09481                 nIndex, true); // bSaveCopy=true.
09482         }
09483 
09484         return nDepositPurse;
09485     }
09486     else
09487     {
09488         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nSkipping this instrument: Expected CHEQUE, VOUCHER, INVOICE, or (cash) PURSE.\n");
09489     }
09490 
09491     return -1;
09492 }
09493 
09494 
09495 /*
09496 EXPORT static std::string NumList_Add (const std::string & strNumList, const std::string & strNumbers);
09497 EXPORT static std::string NumList_Remove (const std::string & strNumList, const std::string & strNumbers);
09498 EXPORT static bool NumList_VerifyQuery(const std::string & strNumList, const std::string & strNumbers); // returns OT_BOOL
09499 EXPORT static bool NumList_VerifyAll (const std::string & strNumList, const std::string & strNumbers); // returns OT_BOOL
09500 EXPORT static int32_t NumList_Count (const std::string & strNumList);
09501 */
09502 
09503 
09504 // COULD have been named "details_accept_specific_instruments_of_specific_types_from_the_payment_inbox."
09505 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::accept_from_paymentbox(const string & strMyAcctID, const string & strIndices, const string & strPaymentType)
09506 {
09507     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyAcctID))
09508     {
09509         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: strMyAcctID not a valid string.\n");
09510         return -1;
09511     }
09512 
09513     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE NYM ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
09514     //
09515     string strMyNymID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_NymID(strMyAcctID);
09516 
09517     if (!VerifyStringVal(strMyNymID))
09518     {
09519         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find NymID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
09520         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Nym based on the account.\n\n");
09521         return -1;
09522     }
09523 
09524     // HERE, WE LOOK UP THE SERVER ID, BASED ON THE ACCOUNT ID.
09525     //
09526     string strServerID = OTAPI_Wrap::GetAccountWallet_ServerID(strMyAcctID);
09527 
09528     if (!VerifyStringVal(strServerID))
09529     {
09530         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Failure: Unable to find Server ID based on myacct. Use: --myacct ACCT_ID\n");
09531         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "The designated asset account must be yours. OT will find the Server based on the account.\n\n");
09532         return -1;
09533     }
09534     // ******************************************************************
09535     //
09536     string strInbox = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPaymentInbox(strServerID, strMyNymID); // Returns NULL, or an inbox.
09537 
09538     if (!VerifyStringVal(strInbox))
09539     {
09540         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n accept_from_paymentbox:  OT_API_LoadPaymentInbox Failed.\n\n");
09541         return -1;
09542     }
09543 
09544     int32_t nCount = OTAPI_Wrap::Ledger_GetCount(strServerID, strMyNymID, strMyNymID, strInbox);
09545     if (!VerifyIntVal(nCount))
09546     {
09547         OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Unable to retrieve size of payments inbox ledger. (Failure.)\n");
09548         return -1;
09549     }
09550 
09551     int32_t nIndicesCount = VerifyStringVal(strIndices) ? OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Count(strIndices) : 0;
09552 
09553     // Either we loop through all the instruments and accept them all, or
09554     // we loop through all the instruments and accept the specified indices.
09555     //
09556     // (But either way, we loop through all the instruments.)
09557     //
09558     for (int32_t nIndex = (nCount - 1); nIndex >= 0; --nIndex) // Loop from back to front, so if any are removed, the indices remain accurate subsequently.
09559     {
09560         bool bContinue = false;
09561 
09562         // - If indices are specified, but the current index is not on
09563         //   that list, then continue...
09564         //
09565         // - If NO indices are specified, accept all the ones matching MyAcct's asset type.
09566         //
09567         if ((nIndicesCount > 0) && !OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_VerifyQuery(strIndices, to_string(nIndex)))
09568         {
09569             //          continue  // apparently not supported by the language.
09570             bContinue = true;
09571         }
09572 
09573         else if (!bContinue)
09574         {
09575             int32_t nHandled = handle_payment_index(strMyAcctID, nIndex, strPaymentType, strInbox);
09576         }
09577     }
09578 
09579     return 1;
09580 }
09581 
09582 
09583 // strIndices == "" when you want to loop through all accounts and accept all invoices for them.
09584 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_accept_invoices(const string & strMyAcctID, const string & strIndices)
09585 {
09586     return accept_from_paymentbox(strMyAcctID, strIndices, "INVOICE");
09587 }
09588 
09589 
09590 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_invoices()
09591 {
09592     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:  acceptinvoices --myacct FROM_ACCT --args \"indices 3,6,8\"  \n (Sample indices are shown.)\n";
09593     string strUsage2 = "The invoice and myacct must both have same asset type. If indices\nare not specified for the payments inbox, ";
09594     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "then OT will pay ALL invoices in it\nthat have the same asset type as MyAcct.\n\n";
09595 
09596     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
09597 
09598     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
09599     {
09600         string strIndices = "";
09601 
09602         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
09603         {
09604             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
09605             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
09606             //
09607             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
09608         }
09609 
09610         return details_accept_invoices(MyAcct, strIndices);
09611     }
09612 
09613     return -1;
09614 }
09615 
09616 
09617 // strIndices == "" to accept all incoming "payments" from the payments inbox. (NOT Invoices.)
09618 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::details_accept_payments(const string & strMyAcctID, const string & strIndices)
09619 {
09620 
09621     int32_t nAcceptedPurses = accept_from_paymentbox(strMyAcctID, strIndices, "PURSE");
09622     // Voucher is already interpreted as a form of cheque, so this is redundant.
09623     //
09624     //  int32_t nAcceptedVouchers = accept_from_paymentbox(strMyAcctID, strIndices, "VOUCHER")
09625     int32_t nAcceptedCheques = accept_from_paymentbox(strMyAcctID, strIndices, "CHEQUE");
09626 
09627     // Note: NOT invoices.
09628 
09629     // If all two calls succeed, then the total here is 2.
09630     // So we return success as well (1).
09631     //
09632     if ((nAcceptedPurses > -1) || (nAcceptedCheques > -1))
09633     {
09634         return 1;
09635     }
09636 
09637     return -1;
09638 
09639 }
09640 
09641 
09642 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_accept_payments()
09643 {
09644     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:  acceptpayments --myacct INTO_ACCT --args \"indices 3,6,8\"  \n (Sample indices are shown.)\n";
09645     string strUsage2 = "The payment instrument and myacct must both have same asset type. If indices\nare not specified for the payments inbox, ";
09646     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "then OT will accept ALL payment\ninstruments in it that have the same asset type as MyAcct.\n\n";
09647 
09648     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
09649 
09650     if (VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
09651     {
09652         string strIndices = "";
09653 
09654         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
09655         {
09656             // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
09657             // EXAMPLE:  --args "indices 4,6,9"
09658             //
09659             strIndices = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "indices"); // OTNumList will be used for this value.
09660         }
09661 
09662         return details_accept_payments(MyAcct, strIndices);
09663     }
09664 
09665     return -1;
09666 }
09667 
09668 
09669 // Pay an invoice
09670 //
09671 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_payinvoice()
09672 {
09673     string strUsage1 = "\nUsage:  payinvoice --myacct FROM_ACCT --args \"index INVOICE_INDEX\" \n";
09674     string strUsage2 = "The invoice and myacct must both have same asset type. If an index is not\n";
09675     string strUsage = strUsage1 + strUsage2 + "specified for the payments inbox, then OT will ask you to paste an invoice.\n\n";
09676 
09677     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
09678 
09679     //
09680     if (!VerifyExists("MyAcct"))
09681     {
09682         return -1;
09683     }
09684     // ***************************************************************
09685     int32_t nIndex = -1;
09686 
09687     if (VerifyExists("Args"))
09688     {
09689         // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
09690         //                                  const std::string str_key)
09691         //
09692         // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
09693         // EXAMPLE:  --args "index 1"
09694         //
09695         string strIndex = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "index"); // any integer value
09696 
09697         if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
09698         {
09699             int32_t nTempIndex = to_int(strIndex);
09700 
09701             if (VerifyIntVal(nTempIndex) && (nTempIndex >= 0))
09702             {
09703                 nIndex = nTempIndex;
09704             }
09705         }
09706     }
09707     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n\n"); // stderr
09708     // ***************************************************************
09709     //
09710     int32_t nPaidInvoice = handle_payment_index(MyAcct, nIndex, "INVOICE", "");
09711 
09712     if (1 == nPaidInvoice) // Success!  (Therefore, remove from payments inbox, and move to record box.)
09713     {
09714         // Should I bother moving the invoice from the payments inbox to the record box?
09715         //
09716         // Update: Okay for now, I'm using an API call here (RecordPayment) which moves the invoice.
09717         // HOWEVER, in the int64_t term, we don't want to do it here. Rather, we want to do it inside OT while
09718         // it's processesing the server reply for your cheque (invoice) deposit. For example what if there's
09719         // a network problem and we don't process that reply here now? There'll still be a copy of the reply
09720         // in the Nymbox and it will still get processed at a future time... and THAT's when we need to move
09721         // the record, not here. (But this is what we'll do for now.)
09722         //
09723         // OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(const OTIdentifier & SERVER_ID,
09724         //                              const OTIdentifier & USER_ID,
09725         //                              bool bIsInbox, // true == payments inbox. false == payments outbox.
09726         //                              int32_t  nIndex)   // removes payment instrument (from payments in or out box) and moves to record box.
09727         //        if (!OTAPI_Wrap::RecordPayment(strServerID, strMyNymID, ))   {; }
09728         //
09729 
09730         // UPDATE:
09731         /*
09732         - In my Payments Inbox, there could be a cheque or invoice. Either way, when I deposit the cheque or
09733         pay the invoice, the chequeReceipt goes back to the signer's asset account's inbox.
09734         - When he accepts the chequeReceipt (during a processInbox) and WHEN HE GETS THE "SUCCESS" REPLY to that
09735         processInbox, is when the chequeReceipt should be moved from his inbox to his record box. It MUST be
09736         done then, inside OT, because the next time he downloads the inbox from the server, that chequeReceipt
09737         won't be in there anymore! It'll be too late to pass it on to the records.
09738         - Whereas I, being the recipient of his cheque, had it in my **payments inbox,** and thus upon receipt
09739         of a successful server-reply to my deposit transaction, need to move it from my payments inbox to my
09740         record box. (The record box will eventually be a callback so that client software can take over that
09741         functionality, which is outside the scope of OT. The actual CALL to store in the record box, however
09742         should occur inside OT.)
09743         - For now, I'm using the below API call, so it's available inside the scripts. This is "good enough"
09744         for now, just to get the payments inbox/outbox working for the scripts. But in the int64_t term, I'll need
09745         to add the hooks directly into OT as described just above. (It'll be necessary in order to get the record
09746         box working.)
09747         - Since I'm only worried about Payments Inbox for now, and since I'll be calling the below function
09748         directly from inside the scripts, how will this work? Incoming cheque or invoice will be in the payments
09749         inbox, and will need to be moved to recordBox (below call) when the script receives a success reply to
09750         the depositing/paying of that cheque/invoice.
09751         - Whereas outoing cheque/invoice is in the Outpayments box, (fundamentally more similar to the outmail
09752         box than to the payments inbox.) If the cheque/invoice is cashed/paid by the endorsee, **I** will receive
09753         the chequeReceipt, in MY asset account inbox, and when I accept it during a processInbox transaction,
09754         the SUCCESS REPLY from the server for that processInbox is where I should actually process that chequeReceipt
09755         and, if it appears in the outpayments box, move it at that time to the record box. The problem is, I can NOT
09756         do this much inside the script. To do this part, I thus HAVE to go into OT itself as I just described.
09757         - Fuck!
09758         - Therefore I might as well comment this out, since this simply isn't going to work.
09759 
09760         - Updated plan:
09761         1. DONE: Inside OT, when processing successful server reply to processInbox request, if a chequeReceipt
09762         was processed out successfully, and if that chequeReceipt is found inside the outpayments, then
09763         move it at that time to the record box.
09764         2. DONE: Inside OT, when processing successful server reply to depositCheque request, if that cheque is
09765         found inside the Payments Inbox, move it to the record box.
09766         3. As for cash:
09767         If I SENT cash, it will be in my outpayments box. But that's wrong. Because I can
09768         never see if the guy cashed it or not. Therefore it should go straight to the record box, when
09769         sent. AND it needs to be encrypted to MY key, not his -- so need to generate BOTH versions, when
09770         exporting the purse to him in the FIRST PLACE. Then my version goes straight into my record box and
09771         I can delete it at my leisure. (If he comes running the next day saying "I lost it!!" I can still
09772         recover it. But once he deposits it, then the cash will be no good and I might as well archive it
09773         or destroy it, or whatever I choose to do with my personal records.)
09774         If I RECEIVED cash, it will be in my payments inbox, and then when I deposit it, and when I process
09775         the SUCCESSFUL server REPLY to my depositCash request, it should be moved to my record Box.
09776         4. How about vouchers? If I deposit a voucher, then the "original sender" should get some sort of
09777         notice. This means attaching his ID to the voucher--which should be optional--and then dropping an
09778         "FYI" notice to him when it gets deposited. It can't be a normal chequeReceipt because that's used
09779         to verify the balance agreement against a balance change, whereas a "voucher receipt" wouldn't represent
09780         a balance change at all, since the balance was already changed when you originally bought the voucher.
09781         Instead it would probably be send to your Nymbox but it COULD NOT BE PROVEN that it was, since OT currently
09782         can't prove NOTICE!!
09783 
09784         All of the above needs to happen inside OT, since there are many plances where it's the only appropriate
09785         place to take the necessary action. (Script cannot.)
09786         */
09787 
09788         print("\n Success paying invoice!\n\n");
09789 
09790         return 1;
09791     }
09792 
09793 
09794     return -1;
09795 }
09796 
09797 
09798 vector<string> tokenize(const string & str, const string & delimiters, const bool trimEmpty)
09799 {
09800     int32_t pos = 0;
09801     int32_t lastPos = 0;
09802     vector<string> tokens;
09803 
09804     while (true)
09805     {
09806         pos = str.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
09807 
09808         if (-1 == pos)
09809         {
09810             pos = str.size();
09811 
09812             if (pos != lastPos || !trimEmpty)
09813             {
09814                 tokens.push_back(str.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
09815             }
09816             break;
09817         }
09818         else
09819         {
09820             if (pos != lastPos || !trimEmpty)
09821             {
09822                 tokens.push_back(str.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
09823             }
09824         }
09825 
09826         lastPos = pos + 1;
09827     }
09828     return tokens;
09829 }
09830 
09831 
09832 
09833 // Show the active cron item IDs, or the details of one by ID.
09834 //
09835 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_active()
09836 {
09837     string strUsage =
09838         "\nUsage:  showactive --server SERVER_ID --mynym NYM_ID   (To display a list of IDs.)\n"
09839         "OR:     showactive --server SERVER_ID --args \"id TRANSACTION_ID\"\n"
09840         "\nLists the transaction numbers of currently active payment plans\n"
09841         "and smart contracts. Also useful for displaying contents by ID.\n\n";
09842 
09843     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
09844     // --------------------------------------------------------------------
09845     //
09846     int64_t lTransNum = 0;
09847     bool bDetailMode = false;
09848 
09849     string strError =
09850         "\nPlease provide either:  --mynym NYM_ID   (to view a list of active transactions)\n"
09851         "or, to view details for a specific transaction, use --args \"id TRANSACTION_ID\" \n\n";
09852 
09853     if (VerifyExists("Server"))
09854     {
09855         if (VerifyExists("Args", false))
09856         {
09857             string strTransNum = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "id"); // transaction number.
09858             // -----------------------------
09859             if (VerifyStringVal(strTransNum))
09860             {
09861                 lTransNum = to_long(strTransNum);
09862 
09863                 if (lTransNum > 0)
09864                 {
09865                     bDetailMode = true;
09866                 }
09867                 else
09868                 {
09869                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Missing argument (1): " + strError);
09870                     return -1;
09871                 }
09872             }
09873         }
09874         // -----------------------------
09875         if (!bDetailMode && !VerifyExists("MyNym"))
09876         {
09877             OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Missing argument (2): " + strError);
09878             return -1;
09879         }
09880         // -----------------------------
09881         // By this point, we know for a fact that either MyNym was supplied, and thus we need to display a list
09882         // of active transactions for the given nym/server, or otherwise, bDetailMode will be true, and lTransNum
09883         // contains a greater-than-zero value in int64_t form, in which case, we need to display the details
09884         // of that cron item.
09885         //
09886         // ***************************************************************
09887 
09888         if (bDetailMode)
09889         {
09890             string strCronItem = OTAPI_Wrap::GetActiveCronItem(Server, lTransNum);
09891 
09892             if (VerifyStringVal(strCronItem))
09893             {
09894                 string strType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strCronItem);
09895 
09896                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strType))
09897                 {
09898                     strType = "UNKNOWN";
09899                 }
09900 
09901                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "Found an active transaction!\n");
09902                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "ID: " + to_string(lTransNum) + "  Type: " + strType + "\n\nContents:\n\n");
09903 
09904                 print(strCronItem);
09905 
09906                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
09907             }
09908         }
09909         else
09910         {
09911             string strIDs = OTAPI_Wrap::GetNym_ActiveCronItemIDs(MyNym, Server);
09912 
09913             if (VerifyStringVal(strIDs) && OTAPI_Wrap::NumList_Count(strIDs) > 0)
09914             {
09915                 vector<string> vecIDs = tokenize(strIDs, ",", true);
09916 
09917                 for (size_t nIndex = 0; nIndex < vecIDs.size(); ++nIndex)
09918                 {
09919                     string strTransNum = vecIDs[nIndex];
09920                     // -----------------------------
09921                     if (VerifyStringVal(strTransNum))
09922                     {
09923                         lTransNum = to_long(strTransNum);
09924 
09925                         if (lTransNum > 0)
09926                         {
09927                             string strCronItem = OTAPI_Wrap::GetActiveCronItem(Server, lTransNum);
09928 
09929                             if (VerifyStringVal(strCronItem))
09930                             {
09931                                 string strType = OTAPI_Wrap::Instrmnt_GetType(strCronItem);;
09932 
09933                                 if (!VerifyStringVal(strType))
09934                                 {
09935                                     strType = "UNKNOWN";
09936                                 }
09937                                 // ----------------------------------
09938                                 if (0 == nIndex)
09939                                 {
09940                                     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n Found " + to_string(vecIDs.size()) + " active transactions:\n\n");
09941                                 }
09942                                 // ----------------------------------
09943                                 print("ID: " + strTransNum + "  Type: " + strType + "\n");
09944                             }
09945                         }
09946                     }
09947                 } // for
09948                 // -----------------------------------
09949                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\n");
09950             }
09951             else
09952             {
09953                 OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, "\nFound no active transactions. Perhaps try 'opentxs refresh' first?\n");
09954             }
09955         } // list mode (not detail mode.)
09956         // -----------------------------------
09957         return 1;
09958 
09959     } // if (VerifyExists("Server"))
09960     // -------------------
09961     return -1;
09962 }
09963 
09964 
09965 // Show an individual payment in detail.
09966 //
09967 OT_COMMANDS_OT int32_t OT_Command::main_show_payment()
09968 {
09969     string strUsage = "\nUsage:  showpayment --args \"index PAYMENT_INDEX showmemo true|false\"\n Default index is 0. Default showmemo is false.\n";
09970 
09971     OTAPI_Wrap::Output(0, strUsage);
09972 
09973     // SHOW a payment from the PAYMENTS INBOX
09974     //
09975     // Load an asset account's payments inbox from local storage and display it on the screen.
09976     //
09977 
09978     if (VerifyExists("Server") && VerifyExists("MyNym") && VerifyExists("Args"))
09979     {
09980 
09981         // std::string OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(const std::string str_Args,
09982         //                                  const std::string str_key)
09983         //
09984         // OPTION:   --args "key value key value"
09985         // EXAMPLE:  --args "index 1"
09986         //
09987         string strIndex = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "index"); // any integer value
09988         string strShowLargeMemo = OT_CLI_GetValueByKey(Args, "showmemo"); // any integer value
09989         int32_t nIndex = 0;
09990         bool bShowLargeMemo = false;  // Memos aren't normally shown if they contain a newline. But you can force them to show anyway.
09991 
09992         // Set the values based on the custom arguments, for those found.
09993         //
09994         if (VerifyStringVal(strShowLargeMemo) && ("true" == strShowLargeMemo))
09995         {
09996             bShowLargeMemo = true; // now we'll show the memo even if it spans multiple lines.
09997         }
09998 
09999         if (VerifyStringVal(strIndex))
10000         {
10001             int32_t nTempIndex = to_int(strIndex);
10002 
10003             if (VerifyIntVal(nTempIndex) && (nTempIndex >= 0))
10004             {
10005                 nIndex = nTempIndex;
10006             }
10007         }
10008         // ***************************************************************
10009 
10010         string strInbox = OTAPI_Wrap::LoadPaymentInbox(Server, MyNym); // Returns NULL, or an inbox.
